loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 31-year-old father of two, aged four and one. He says that he is committed to his work which is selling charcoal.  From this business, he earns a living.  He has been running the business for three years with two employees. 

 Antony became a member of Faulu Kenya through Funga Leso group. Since he became part of Faulu Kenya, he has become dilligent in his work.  He hopes to expand his business and become independent in five years.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Juana Aristina

texts.es: Juana Aristina tiene 22 años, su actividad económica es  una pulpería. Por lo que todos los días se levanta temprano desde la 8 de la mañana hasta las  9 de la noche por lo que sus clientes llegan a comprar los productos que ofrece  Tiene más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio ella comenzó a comprar muy pocos productos, pero eran lo que sus clientes le solicitaban de primera necesidad. Poco a poco surtió su pequeña tienda y la estableció en su vivienda. El financiamiento lo va utilizar para comprar arroz, bebidas, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, detergentes y jugos. Ella sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y además proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana Aristina is 22-years-old. She runs a general store. Everyday she gets up early and works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. so that her customers can buy her products. She's had this business for more than 3 years. She began with only a few products, but they were the most essential for her customers. Little by little she stocked up her small store and established her home. She will use this loan to buy rice, drinks, sugar, oil, candy, detergent, and juice. She dreams of increasing her income and improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Betzabe

texts.es: Maria Betzabe tiene 42 años, su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos y bolsitas además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, cuando dio inicio fue porque tenía que buscar un trabajo que le generara ingresos necesarios para su hogar, siempre le ha gustado ser una persona que lucha para buscar la forma de mejorar cada día mas su calidad de vida. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsitas, frutas, azúcar entre otras cosas necesarias para su elaboración. Sueña cada día con que su hijo pueda obtener lo necesario para sobrevivir.
texts.en: Maria Betzabe is 42 years old. She sells soft drinks and bags and also raises pigs. She has had this business for over four years, which she started because she needed to find work that would generate the income necessary for her home. She has always liked being a person who fights to find a way to improve her quality of living day by day. Now she is seeking a loan to buy bags, fruits, and sugar among other things she needs for production. She hopes every day that her son gets what he needs to survive.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. makes a living selling various food items at a local market and is applying for a loan to buy more bags of beans and rice to sell to her customers. She is 23 years old and a widow.  She has two children, both of whom are in school.  With the additional income made possible by this loan, Mary hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more beans and rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia M. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Eugenia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eugenia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Eugenia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eugenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugenia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Eugenia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Amélégan

texts.fr: Amélégan a 43 ans  et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est mariée et gère comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de produits  d’alimentations générales pour contribuer au ménage. Elle cumule dans cette activité près de  20 ans. Elle est née à Vogan et vit à Bè Kpota mais exerce son activité à côté de la station akodessewa. Le crédit demandé permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de riz, 8 bidons d’huile et 5 cartons de liqueurs pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Amélégan is 43 years old and mother to three children. She is married and, in order to make a contribution to the household, has an income-generating activity selling general food products. She has been active in this business for nearly 20 years. She was born in Vogan and lives in Bè Kopta; she carries out her business next to the station in Akodessewa. The loan she has asked for will allow her to buy ten sacks of rice, eight containers of oil and five cartons of liqueurs, in order for her to satisfy her ever growing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Dasak

texts.en:
Mrs. Dasak S. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Sophak Horng, have been married since 2007. They have two young children: one son and one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

To support the family, Dasak sells rice at home. Recently, she decided to try to supplement her income by selling groceries, too. Her husband is a full-time worker in Phnom Penh. She is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase additional grocery items for resale purposes.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a un hijo de 16 años de edad en el caserío El Verde, una zona agrícola del distrito de Pítipo, zona situada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de 10 años a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar todo tipo de granos y cereales. Los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades los utiliza para sacar adelante a su familia. En esta oportunidad ha sembrado maíz y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para sacar adelante su cultivo.

Jorge desea realizar labores de mantenimiento a su cultivo, para ello se ha propuesto adquirir fertilizantes, para realizar esta acción ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jorge is 52 years old.  He is married and lives with his 16 year-old son in the village of El Verde, an agricultural area of Pítipo district, in Ferreñafe province, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Jorge has been working in agriculture for more than 10 years.  He has a small plot of land where he grows all kinds of grains and cereals.  He uses the profits that he makes from this business to get his family ahead.  On this occasion, he has grown corn and he is working hard to look after his crop.

Jorge would like to do some work toward maintaining his crops.  He would like to acquire some fertilizers and, in order to do this, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To maintain his corn crop

loans.name: Pedro Agustin

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el Barrio El Calvario, en Estelí, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el sector agrícola.
Desde pequeño comenzó ayudándole a sus padres en la siembra, específicamente de Frijoles y Cebolla. Se independizo a la edad de 15 años y por falta de dinero no pudo seguir estudiando.
Las primeras veces que sembró, tuvo que hacerlo en sociedad, ya que el no podía cubrir todos los gastos para sembrar de manera independiente cebolla y frijoles. También se dedicaba a la compra venta de hortalizas y verduras.
Realizo este crédito para compra de insumos para la siembra de Cebolla, y espera que esto pueda mejorar un poco sus ingresos.
Sus metas son muchas pero las más importantes son enseñarles a sus hijos como trabajar la tierra que posee para que ellos puedan mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro is 36 years old and lives in the neighborhood of El Calvario ["The Calvary"] in the department of Estelí.  He has more than 20 years of experience in agriculture.

At a very young age, he started helping his parents with planting beans and onions.  He became independent at the age of 15 and for lack of money, he was not able to continue attending school.

The first few times he planted, he had to do so in partnership with others because he couldn't cover all the costs of planting onions and beans on his own.  He also buys and sells vegetables and greens. 

Pedro is taking out this loan to buy supplies for planting onions.  With it, he hopes to be able to improve his earnings a bit.  He has many goals but most importantly, he wants to teach his children how to work the land he owns so that they can improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting onions

loans.name: Jambar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité JAMBAR est créé depuis bientôt 5 ans. Il regroupe 19 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont pratiquement le même centre d'intérêt qui le développement de leur terroir. Elle sont nouées par des liens d'amitié et de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KIGNABOUR2 

Madame ADAMA N°1 S. debout en sixième position à partir de la gauche sur la photo, en écharpe verte et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 04 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers tels: des fruits, du pain de singe, du sucre, du café, du lait etc.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de petit commerce en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de soutenir ses enfants dans la prise en charge de la nourriture
texts.en:
The solidarity group Jambar was created nearly five years ago. It is made up of 19 women who all live in the same neighborhood and share a common goal: developing their area. They know each other through ties of friendship and kinship. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Kignabour 2.

Mrs Adama N° 2 S., pictured sixth from the left, wearing  a green scarf and portrayed in the small inlay, chairs the group. She is 59 years old, widowed and the mother of four children. She runs a small business selling various products, such as fruit, baobab fruit (monkey bread), sugar, coffee, milk, etc. Her new loan will enable her to efficiently develop her small business thanks to the increased inventory. Her goal is to pay for her personal needs, support her children and provide them with food.

loans.use: To finance her small store

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is a 62-year-old married man who supports his family by operating a general store. He lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. He has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved his living conditions with the help of his loans from NWTF and through his own efforts. By working hard in his business, he is gradually making his family more economically stable. He now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Efren is borrowing PHP 15,000 in order to purchase more inventory to sell. This will be his 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. His previous loan of PHP 14,000, which he paid off well within its term, was just another step in his journey toward economic freedom. Efren hopes to elevate his family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Densenbal

texts.en:
Densenbal L. is  39 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and four children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her two younger daughters attend a local secondary school. 

Densenbal used to operate a cafe, which she started in 2000. She ran the cafe for five years until she injured her legs. In 2005 she began making clothes from home. Her husband and two older daughters help her with this business. They make deels – Mongolian traditional long coats, vests, jackets, felt  slippers, as well as most kinds of custom handmade clothing. Densenbal  and her two daughters are responsible for the manufacturing and her husband does the delivery. 

Densenbal  is a sociable, hardworking person who says, "my wish is to help my daughters get their own jobs".  She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more textiles and clothes for her handmade clothing business.

loans.use: To purchase more textiles and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old divorced man living on his own. He is from Lebanon. He works in the Lebanese army. At the same time, he decided to open a small bakery in 2010. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. In Lebanon, it’s very common to have multiple jobs to be able to handle the heavy living expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to develop his bakery and expand his productivity by increasing his inventory. In the long term, he is planning to continue expansion of his business and he is positive about the coming year. In the future, he is planning to enlarge his operation by opening a restaurant on the same lot where his bakery is located.

loans.use: to develop his bakery and expand his productivity by increasing his inventory

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a widow and has three sons who live with her. After the death of her husband, she started an embroidery business. She is expert in hand embroidery and crafts beautiful designs on clothes and gives them a new look.  

She couldn’t educate her eldest son but she taught him the art of stitching. He is now a tailor and operates his tailoring shop in the market and supports the family financially. Perveen’s younger children are enrolled in a school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk to prepare beautiful embroidered dresses to sell to different cloth shops for larger profits. She hopes that an investment will increase the profit from her business.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit record and never missed any meeting. 

Perveen lives in a small city in Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishen in a 3-room brick house. This town is located in Punjab, Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Apec-Al Ouma Tivaouane Diacksao Groupe 2

texts.fr:
Le sous groupe APEC al Ouma Tivaouane Diacksao groupe 2 est un regroupement de 15 femmes qui habitent toutes dans la même localité et évoluent depuis longtemps dans le secteur du commerce de produits divers (tissus, légumes, pain, thiakry, oranges, etc.…). La présidente s’appelle madame Fatoumata D.. Elle est vendeuse de beignets à la devanture d’une école qui se situe non loin de son domicile. Elle est aussi marchande ambulante en dehors des heures de classe, elle circule dans la localité pour vendre des jouets et des parfums. Elle a choisi son activité par amour mais aussi dans le but de se procurer des revenus qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Elle a des enfants et doit les soutenir a affronter la vie. Elles sont membres  du guichet de Dalifort depuis Mars 2011. Elles sollicitent un crédit de 1 000 000 frs Cfa prévu pour l’achat de tissus, parfums légumes et produits saisonniers destinés à diversifier et développer leur commerce. L’augmentation de leurs bénéfices leur permettra de mieux participer dans l’entretien de leurs familles respectives. Leur objectif est d’aider leurs maris dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne au sein de leurs foyers.
Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 
 
Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.
 
Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.
texts.en:
The APEC sub-group Al Ouma Tivaouane Diacksao, Group 2, consists of fifteen women who all live in the same locality. For a long time now, they have been selling various items such as fabrics, vegetables, bread, thiakry, oranges, etc. The group president is Mrs. Fatoumata D.. She sells donuts in front of a school located close to her home. Outside of school hours, she is also a street vendor, going around town to sell toys and perfumes. She chose her activity out of love, but also to earn income and provide for her personal needs. She has children to raise and support. 

The group members joined the Dalifort branch in March 2011. They are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 FCFA to purchase fabrics, perfumes, vegetables and seasonal products intended to diversify and develop their businesses. An increase in profits will allow them to better contribute to the well-being of their respective families. Their goal is to help their husbands in managing the daily expenditures of their households.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, perfumes, and seasonal products for resale

loans.name: Hilda Cristina

texts.es: Hilda Cristina V. D. J., D. 50 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su compañero D. vida y su hijo que se encuentra estudiando. Hilda posee una tienda en la que ofrece diferentes productos como: papel desechable, frutas, bebidas, golosinas, galletas, café, entre otros D. primera necesidad. Además D. estos productos también venD. paletas refrigeradas y licuados que ella prepara D. fruta natural y fresca, todo esto en su casa D. habitación, ubicada en el Municipio D. Armenia del Departamento D. Sonsonate. Sueña con ampliar su negocio para poder dar a sus clientes una mayor variedad D. productos. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito con la esperanza D. mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y las D. su familia. Con el préstamo pretenD. invertir en su negocio para abastecerlo D. una mejor gama D. productos tales como: cereales, bebidas, huevos, leche, café, verduras, frutas, azúcar, sal, y D. más productos atractivos para una tienda. Con la fe puesta en Dios que sus ingresos se verán aumentados y esto le permitirá obtener mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Hilda Cristina V. D. J., age 50, lives in her own home with her life partner and her child, who is in school. Hilda has a store in which she offers different products such as: disposable paper, fruits, drinks, candies, cookies, and coffee, among other basic staples. On top of these products she also sells frozen and liquid popsicles that she prepares from fresh fruit in her own home in the Armenia municipality in the Sonsonate Department. She dreams of expanding her business in order to give her customers a greater variety of products. She has decided to request this loan with the hope of improving her living conditions and those of her family. With this loan, she plans to invest in her business in order to stock it with a better range of products, such as: cereal, drinks,  eggs, milk, coffee, vegetables, fruits, sugar, salt, and more good products for her store. She has faith in God that her income will increase and this will allow her to have a greater quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase: sweet drinks, candies, cookies, coffee, popsicles and more fruit to prepare fruit drinks.

loans.name: Bonivie

texts.en:
Bonivie P. is from the village of Quezon, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Bonivie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Bonivie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Bonivie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bonivie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bonivie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used towards working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Bonivie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & biscuits. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Bonivie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & biscuits.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo ehijos, tiene casa propia  con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande y a una hora del departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Ana María  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y de aves de corral (pollos, gallinas, patos y pavos), desde hace 5 años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales en la parte posterior de la casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura.  Esto le permite obtener mayores ganacias para cubrir sus gastos diarios. 

Ana María  solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento para sus animales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un buen precio.   Ana María es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el fin que en un futuro brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposo.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, 33, lives with her ​​husband and children in their own house, which has electricity only, in the district of Tambogrande, one hour away from the department of Piura. The main business activities in the area are agriculture, livestock and crafts.

Ana Maria breeds and sells sheep and poultry (chickens, ducks and turkeys). She started 5 years ago. She raises her animals in the back of the house, feeding them balanced food and natural grains. Once they have the right size and weight she sells them in different markets. She has a stable client base in the city of Piura. This allows her to obtain higher profits to cover her daily expenses.

Ana Maria is requesting Alternative Edpyme a loan of 500 new soles to buy feed for her animals, which will allow her to keep  them well fed and hence to sell them at a good price. Ana Maria is well known in the area she lives in because she is always concerned for the wellbeing of her family, and wants to provide her husband and children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed for her sheep and poultry.

loans.name: Saydhe

texts.es: Saydhe tiene 39 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, juntos viven en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 5 años decidió emprender la venta de repuestos para todo tipo de vehículos. En un inicio emprendió otro negocio pero no le fue tan bien, así que hizo un estudio de mercado logrando decidirse por dedicarse al negocio de este rubro. Es así que diariamente trabaja en un puesto de venta, que es un local que alquiló para ejecutar dicho negocio. Por otro lado este trabajo le permite cuidar de sus hijos y atenderlos para cuando deban ir al colegio. Su negocio ha requerido prepararse y conocer cada pieza y su función para el tipo de vehículo que requiera. La mayoría de sus clientes son mecánicos que trabajan dentro de la  zona donde vive, pues ello siempre solicita estos repuestos. Poco a poco su negocio tiene mucha demanda y eso la satisface y la motiva para continuar trabajando. Por lo pronto desea comprar más repuestos y por tal espera de su ayuda económica para que concrete sus planes.  Es su primer crédito individual con MFP,  por lo que desea invertirlo en su negocio y además  aprovechar las ofertas de compra que le ofrecieron. Asimismo se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos pequeños al por mayor y una caja mecánica para camionetas.
texts.en:
Saydhe, 39, is married and the mother of two children.  They live together in a rented house.  Over five years ago she started selling spare parts for all kinds of vehicles.  At the beginning, she started out with another kind of business but she didn’t do too well so she did a market study and decided to go into this line of work.  She thus works daily at her sales stand which is located in a locale she rented to carry out this business.  On the other hand, this work allows her to care for her children and tend to them when they have to go to school.  Her business has required her to become knowledgeable and know every part and its use for the type of vehicle it was designed for.  Most of her customers are mechanics that work in her neighborhood so she always requests these parts.  Gradually her business’  demand has grown and this makes her feel very satisfied and motivated to continue working  For the time being, she’d like to buy more spare parts and hopes to get the economic help to actualize her plans.

This is her first individual loan with MFP and she hopes to invest it in her business and to take advantage of the price opportunities she was offered.  At the same time, she commits to be very punctual with her payments.  She will use the requested loan to buy small spare parts at wholesale and a van gear box.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He is 53 years old and has been farming for 20 years. Gideon produces cabbage, milk, maize, beans, and potatoes.

Gideon is requesting a loan of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is optimistic about the dairy business and is focused on having eight quality dairy cows. 

Gideon says Juhudi Kilimo loans have been of great help to farmers. He says the income from his business will help him educate his two children who are still in school.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Khvan

texts.en:
Mrs. Khvan, 33, is married and the mother of four teenage children who are not yet employed. Her husband is 44 years old and a local farmer who works in the fields.

For over a year Mrs. Khvan has made a living by selling different kinds of fresh fish in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap Province. She always gets up early in the morning in order to buy fish from local fisherman, and she hurries to sell them. She currently earns an average of $3 a day.

Mrs. Khvan is an assiduous woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her customers, Mrs. Khvan is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell and plant potatoes as well.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell and potatoes to plant.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is 57 years old and lives in Aloran. He is married and has 4 children. Roger has a business selling snacks, earning about PHP 6,000 each month. Roger has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more ingredients for his snack vending business. Roger has become a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for his snack vending business

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Unity” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Josephine. She is 38 years old and was born in Kenema, where she currently lives with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is a trader and her children attend primary and secondary schools. For 3 years, Josephine has been selling gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava roots) at both retail and wholesale. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy gari wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy gari wholesale

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Females of Central Asian countries are mostly employed in such business spheres as textiles, light industry, hotel business and food production. Our next entrepreneur says women are more socially responsible, therefore donors should pay attention to women’s issues.

Ainura, 38, is the leader of this group. She is married and has four young kids. Ainura has been successfully breeding cattle for the past seven years. She confesses she wouldn’t be able to do that without the assistance of her husband, who is also a shepherd. 

Ainura’s activity involves purchasing young calves, fattening them and reselling them. The funds for the business start-up were taken from her salary seven years ago. Ainura doesn’t regret taking such risks because now the business generates 10,000 soms monthly. “Having four young kids, who constantly need attention and care is not easy," says Ainura, “so if I had a washing machine, that would be very helpful.” The acquired loan correspondingly will be spent on a purchase of a washing machine. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo, de 62 años, es un hombre alegre, cortés y trabajador. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Felicita de 66 años y sus 02 hijos menores, a quienes les brinda una educación justa y adecuada.
Todos los días Máximo abre desde las 06 de la mañana su tienda y comienza a vender sus deliciosas golosinas, su negocio es muy concurrido en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es un vendedor muy persuasivo y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprar más de lo que tenían que comprar.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, sobre las cosas que suceden en la ciudad, así aprovecha para distraerse un poco, lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda en espera de clientes.  Máximo con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar maquinas especiales para preparar los refrescos que calmen la sed de sus consumidores. Para mejorar sus ingresos espera montar otro tipo de negocio una tienda de pastiquerias donde pueda brindar a sus clientes variedad de productos.Este será su quinto crédito y por ello se siente muy contento de saber que contara una vez mas con el apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de seguir prosperando y esta dispuesto a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados.Con el monto solicitado adquirirá una maquina especial donde pueda preparar sus refrescos.
texts.en:
Máximo, 62, is a happy, courteous and hardworking man. He lives in his own house with his wife Felicita, 66, and his two young sons, who he provides with a decent education.

Every day, Máximo opens his shop at 6am and begins selling his delicious sweets. His business is very popular in the city of San Francisco, as he is a very persuasive seller and he always convinces his customers to buy more than they need. What he most likes about his work is talking to his customers about all the goings on in the city, which gives him the chance to amuse himself a bit. He has been doing this work for 6 years and he says that the most difficult thing is having to spend all day in his shop waiting for customers.

With this loan, Máximo will be able to buy special machines to prepare soft drinks to quench the thirst of his customers. In order to increase his earnings, he hopes to start up another kind of business - a plastics shop - where he can provide his customers with a variety of products. This will be his fifth loan and he is very happy to know that he can count on financial support, as he feels certain his business will continue to prosper and he is determined to make his repayments on time. With the amount requested, he will acquire a special machines for preparing soft drinks.

loans.use: to acquire a special machine for preparing soft drinks.

loans.name: Trinidad Lisette

texts.es: Walter de 39 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su negocio porque a su esposa le brindaron un permiso para trabajar como taxista, fue así que el decide hacerse cargo del negocio En la actualidad trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de noche juntos han sabido sacar adelante su negocio y siempre brindar el mejor servicio.  Este crédito es para la compra de llantas, focos, espejos y otras reparaciones. cabe señalar que quien conduce el taxi es su esposo Walter Enrique, ya que fue Doña Trinidad que adquirio el permiso y el vehiculo y es ella quien administra el negocio.
texts.en: Trinidad Lisette, 39, is a hardworking man who started his business because his wife, Trinidad Lisette, received a permit to start working as a taxi triver. He then decided to take over the business. Currently she works every day from 6am to 10pm and together they have made the business successful and always provide good service. This loan is to buy tires, headlights, mirrors and other repairs. It is worth mentioning that the husband of Trinidad is the driver of the taxi, since she got the permits and takes care of the administrative side of the business.

loans.use: to buy tires, headlights, mirrors and other repairs.

loans.name: El Surcador Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la comunidad Panarhuaylla D. la provincia del Anta. (En la fotografía la señora Isabel está levantando la mano). 

La señora Isabel tiene una relación D. unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos (Ingrid D. 19 años, José Ángel D. 13 años, Evelyn D. 12 años y Yudith D. 6 años), ella es una madre trabajadora y responsable que saca adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, gallinas y cuyes, ella desD. joven se dedica a la agricultura por lo tanto  cultiva y siembra maíz, habas, quinua, cebada y trigo. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

La señora Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “El Surcador” y su primer crédito fue D. S/. 300 nuevos soles y lo invirtió en la compra D. chanchos. En esta oportunidad Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar varios chanchos que cuesta aproximadamente entre S/. 300 a S/. 500  nuevos soles.    

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “El Surcador” son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Panarhuaylla. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la comunidad D. Panarhuaylla y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. animales menores como cuyes, venta D. comida, ganadería, agricultura y artesanía. 

La comunidad D. Panarhuaylla se encuentra ubicada a una D. hora D. la ciudad del Cusco. 

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

(La socia que aparece en la parte inferior D. la fotografía llego tarD. a la reunión.)
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the Panarhuaylla Community in the province of Anta.  (Isabel is the one raising her hand in the photograph).

She has a common-law husband and four children (Ingrid, 19, José Ángel, 13, Evelyn, 12 and Yudith, 6).  She is a hard-working, responsible mother who helps her children get ahead.  She raises small animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.  She has always been involved in agriculture and grows corn, lima beans, quinoa, barley and wheat.  For several years now she has been in this traD. which is going well thanks to her hard work.

Isabel belongs to the communal bank "El Surcador" and her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN was used to buy pigs.  Now she wants to buy several more pigs which will cost between 300 and 500 PEN.

The members of the communal bank "El Surcador" meet every month in the Panarhuaylla Community.  The bank is comprised of working entrepreneurs who look for every opportunity to get ahead and give their children a better future.  Most of the members live in Panarhuaylla and their work involves sales of small animals such as guinea pigs, food sales, livestock farming, agriculture and crafts.

The Panarhuaylla Community is located an hour away from the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for its tourism, commerce and Inti Raymi traditional festivities and for being home to one of the Seven Wonders of the World: "Machupicchu".

(The member appearing in the lower part of the photograph arrived late for the meeting.)

loans.use: To buy several pigs.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a 61 year-old villager who has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. 

His profession in cultivating rice crops in rainy and dry seasons with his wife, who always helps him. This couple usually receives an average of $2.40 each day to cover all expenses. 

Chan and his wife are blessed with four children, two of whom are single and the other two have already married and have new homes.  

One of their daughters is a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh.  Every day, she must walk or hire a motor taxi service to get to work, and she always spends too much money to travel.  Chan has decided to borrow some funds from Kiva to purchase a second hand motorcycle for his daughter. 

In the future, Chan wishes to buy a plowing machine and rebuild his old house.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand motorcycle for her daughter.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 43-year-old married man and father of two children. He opened a grocery store in 2006 and is working hard to improve it. Ahmad has 10 years of experience in this field. He is very talented in developing such a business.
Ahmad has applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner A. Majmoua, in order to increase his store's merchandise of goods necessary for the autumn-winter season.
Ahmad opened his store in 2006 and it has improved a lot since he started. He hopes the requested loan will have a great effect on his business development and family’s sociA. conditions improvement.

loans.use: To increase his store's merchandise of autumn-winter season goods

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has operated her retail shop in Njabini town for the last three years.  She is 22 years old, married to Pius and they have two school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this is her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods for resale in her retail shop. Some of the goods she hopes to buy include maize meal flour, cooking fat, detergents and much more.

In future, Esther hopes to grow her retail shop to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to increase the stock of goods in her retail shop

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié et père de deux enfants.Après avoir suivi des études générales jusqu'au collége, il a arrété et a fréquenté pendant deux mois la boutique de son oncle qui vend des appareils électroniques.Ce dernier lui a ouvert une boutique de vente de téléphones mais surtout d'accessoirs téléphoniques dont la demande est très forte  actuellement.Son commerce lui rapporte ainsi des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent d'entretenir sa famille.Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetant notamment des téléphones et des accessoirs téléphoniques.
texts.en: The borrower is a young married man and father of two children. After having completed his general studies as far as middle school, he stopped and frequented his uncle's store for two months, which sells electronic devices. His uncle opened him a store for phone sales, but especially phone accessories, for which the demand is very high right now. His business thereby brings him quite consistent revenue, which permits him to look after his family. He seeks a loan of 250000F in order to increase his business equipment by buying in particular, phones and phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone accessories.

loans.name: Leah Wanjiru

texts.en:
Leah used her third loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant a crop.  Her harvest was very profitable.

She repaid the loan and in good time.

This will be her fourth loan.  Leah plans to buy a motorcycle to start a transport business.  She'll also use the motorcycle to transport her produce to the market.

In the future, Leah hopes to become one of the leading traders and farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en: Sokna, 19, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sokna sells vegetables, and her husband is a soldier. Sokna is requesting a loan of $750 to pay for a passport and the administration fee to work in South Korea. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to pay for a passport and the administration fee to work in South Korea.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee de 23 años, es una mujer emprendedora, convive con Leo, su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 3 años. Esta joven familia vive en una casa alquilada en el anexo de Yapaz Alto, en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro – Chanchamayo. Como una buena mujer trabajadora, Haydee cuenta con 3 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos donde siembra piñas, y ahora tiene otra parcela destinada para la producción de café.
A su vez, Leo también cuenta con 5 lotes de terrenos, ahí tiene cultivados más piñas y café. Su producción es buena y considerable.
Ambos se dedican al trabajo duro dentro del campo. Solo para las temporadas de cosechas, que son la más absorbentes y arduas, contratan personal u operarios a quienes pagan al día.
Haydee ve su futuro como un camino en el que encontrará obstáculos, por eso no se preocupa si algún inconveniente se le presenta en el trayecto. 
Por ende continuará con las labores del campo, ampliando sus terrenos y aumentando su producción, de esa manera podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, concretizada en buena educación, comida, vestido, etc. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 de MFP, que obtendría gracias a su ayuda. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. “Alto Yapaz” es el nombre de su banco comunal. Se siente respaldada y apoyada por el grupo.
Con el dinero del crédito podrá adquirir 10 bolsas de abonos para fertilizar sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Haydee is 23 years old and a very enterprising woman.  She lives with her husband, Leo, and they’ve had three children.  This young family lives in a rented home in Yapaz Alto, within the San Luis de Shuaro – Chanchamayo district.  Like a hardworking woman, Haydee has three parcels of farmland where she raises pineapples.  Now she has another parcel that she will use to grow coffee.

Leo also has 5 plots of land where he raises pineapples and coffee.  Production is considerable and of good quality.

Both of them work in the fields.  They only hire help during the harvest periods, which are the busiest and most demanding.

Haydee sees her future as a change where she will encounter obstacles, but it doesn’t bother her if inconveniences present themselves.  In the end she’ll continue working in the fields, expanding her farmland, and increasing her production in a way that will allow her to give her family a better quality of life, solidified by a good education, food, clothing, etc.

Thanks to your support, this will be her fifth loan through MFP and she’s committed to making her payments on time.  The communal bank is called “Alto Yapaz.”  She feels backed and supported by the group.

She will use the money from this loan to buy ten sacks of fertilizer for her coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en: Cesar is 43 years old and is married to Maricel who had a retail store in front of their house. Cesar also grows rice for future merchandise in the store. They help each other in making their family achieve progress. Cesar had been in the farming business for almost 30 years. Cesar realized that through the years his farming business was not increasing its yield - he had constant production and income. He asks for a loan of P30,000 to buy farm inputs to use to improve his crop for additional net profits. He will buy three bags of rice seeds and six sacks of fertilizers and insecticides use in farming. With these inputs he knows that it will help increase his yield and someday help him improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seeds and six sacks of fertilizers and insecticides use in farming

loans.name: Mba'apora Group

texts.es:
El comité Mba'apora se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjunto para poder fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Fidelina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vende por la calle. Es una señora muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, lucha diariamente por sus 4 hijos ya que ella es madre soltera. Comenta que se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora Fidelina solicita el crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras, como ser naranjas, manzanas, tomates, cebollas, y demás frutas y verduras. Ella al igual que sus amigas están agradecidas a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The Mba'apora communal bank was formed when several neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso came together. All the members of the bank have independent businesses but they also carry out joint activities in order to strengthen their solidarity.

Sra. Fidelina is one of the bank members. She is a street vendor and sells fruits and vegetables. She is a very hardworking woman with a great desire to succeed. She manages every day on behalf of her children since she is a single mother. She says that she is very satisfied with her work and the training the group receives.

Fidelina is requesting the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, such as oranges, apples, tomatoes, onions and others. She, together with her friends, is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for later sale.

loans.name: Tafuta Upate Group

texts.en:
Apolonia, is in her early forties and is married with three children.  She   has been a food vendor for seven years now. She works from 6am to 10pm and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Apolonia’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock of food and pay the school fees for her children and has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to add more stock of food to sell.  Apolonia’s dream is to one day build her own house.

Apolonia will share this loan with her loan group, "Tafuta upate", which totals 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to add more stock of  food to sell.

loans.name: José Isaac

texts.es: José de 21 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad, vive en la zona occidental del país. Es un hombre muy trabajador que desde que se levanta, desea siempre un mejor futuro para su familia, además posee grandes características es responsable, honesto, dedicado a su trabajo y muy humilde. José se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, maicillo, entre otros. Siempre ha tratado la manera de que sus cultivos sean los mejores ya que posee abundante capacidad de producción y de crecimiento de los mismos, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso, vende en las principales tiendas de su localidad y mercados, así como también entre sus vecinos ya que posee precios accesibles. El desea ampliar su cosecha y es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL para adquirir un préstamo con el cual comprara insumos básicos como lo son: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, está seguro que seguirá cosechando y que esta vez será mejor y le dará un buen futuro a su familia

loans.use: Para comprar insumos basicos como : abonos, semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en: Maram is a 28 year old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. She is requesing a loan of 400 JOD to buy accessories, perfume and clothes to sell. She has been selling these products to her neighbors and relatives but plans on opening her own shop. Her hopes are for her children to have a good education. Since Maram is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan. Maram prefers that her photo is not on the internet, thus the photo is of her brother.

loans.use: to pay for accessories and clothes to sell

loans.name: Isunga Elders Savings & Credit Sugar Cane & Chilli Group

texts.en:
Stella is a member of Isunga Elders Savings & Credit Sugar Cane & Chilli where members guarantee each other when borrowing and paying back a loan. She is a 36-year-old married lady with six children, all living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a business selling second-hand clothes in a busy village, and has been doing this for over six years.

Stella is hindered by price fluctuations, climate changes, and poor roads as a result of heavy rains.
Stella is charged with the responsibility of educating her children and looking after her family. She Besides that, Stella has a target of enlarging her business and putting up a commercial building that will yield her more income for her family. Stella has asked for a loan, together with her group, to buy and sell first class or ready-made clothes.

loans.use: to buy and sell first class or ready-made clothes.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.en:
Madam Mawussi A. D. was born on 11th September 1982 at Tsévié. She has opened a hair dressing workshop at Wuto where she is performing her activity associated to the selling of cosmetics produces. Madam D. is a single without children and only reached the primary school. Born from numerous and poor family, she didn’t succeed to continue her studies for lack of support. Thus, she learns the hair dressing. Currently, she has opened her own dressing salon which she is managing without problems thank to a credit of $ 100 which she has already repaid. She requests a credit of $ 850 to buy hair dressers and dressing items in order to strengthen her activities. What will allow her to increase her incomes leading to her financial autonomy.

Madame D. A. Mawussi est née le 11 Septembre 1982 à Tsévié. Elle a ouvert un atelier de coiffure à Wuto où elle fait son activité associée à la vente des produits cosmétiques. Madame D. A. Mawussi est célibataire sans enfant et n’a atteint que le niveau d’instruction primaire. Issue de famille nombreuse et pauvre, elle n’a pas pu continuer ses études faute de support. Elle a appris la coiffure. Actuellement, elle a ouvert son propre salon de coiffure qu’elle gère sans difficulté grâce à un crédit de $100 qu’elle a déjà remboursé. Elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour acheter des séchoirs et des articles de coiffure afin de renforcer ses activités. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus conduisant à son autonomie financière.

loans.use: to buy hair dressers and dressing items

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a hard-working woman who wishes to expand her business. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is familiar with the TEACH Lending program and has the  entrepreneurial skills to manage her business. She needs a loan of $750 to expand her business by buying more cloths and opening more branches in the near-by towns and villages.By this, she hopes to employ more hands to help her. She will therefore create jobs fot the unemployed youth in her community.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Hoai

texts.en:
The father works as a day laborer and the mother is a farmer. They have 3 children and one of them had heart-attack.
Their income is low $ 9.375 person/month and they want to borrow $75  to buy a steer to rise and they will pay back this money during 7 months.

loans.use: Cow husbandry

loans.name: Karen Darina

texts.es:
I have a tortilla stand in front of my house. I've been selling tortillas for about 8 months. My tortilla business is helping me pay for my schooling since my parents are too poor to do so. My goal is to have an actual locale where I can sell my tortillas. I want to make a bigger profit and to be able to buy a stove made out of cobblestone. I want to provide jobs to others with the same situation as me.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo me dedico a la venta de tortillas, este negocio lo tengo frente de mi casa hace 8 meses, este negocio me ayuda para poder pagar mis estudios, ya que mis padres no puden por que ellos tiene pocos recursos. Mi meta es tener un lugar donde yo las pueda vender e ingrementar mis ganancias y poder comprar una estufa de adoquin para poder dar empleo a otras personas que estan en mi situacion.

loans.use: To purchase a cobblestone stove

loans.name: Lealofi

texts.en: Lealofi is able to make a Samoan dish, Faausi, to sell in her village to earn her living.  The small business operates 3 days a week, Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Lealofi prepares 50 plates each day and sells each for $2.40 in her village and at Vaigaga Primary school.  She earns $72 profit after all expenses.  She now able to support her family. She says that anyone can achieve their goal if they have faith in what they do and whom they seek help from. She is grateful for SPBD whose objective is to help those in need.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and materials

loans.name: Nidia María

texts.es:
Nidia Maria had to start working in order to support the youngest of her three children after she got divorced and the separation caused a lot of problems and time wasted. That meant that she did not have a stable business that provided her enough money, and the help that she gets from her two older sons is not enough since they also have children that they have to support. Nidia started helping a niece who sells clothes in a market in Uman, a town in Yucatan, Mexico, and with time, she was able to be independent and get her own business by buying used clothes and selling them in the market. However, the business does not give her enough earnings in order to support themselves and to reinvest in the business. That is why Nidia is asking for a loan of $300 that she will pay back in a four month period and with that money Nidia will be able to buy merchandise for the winter season and obtain higher earnings. That way she will be able to celebrate Christmas with her son without worrying about debts. With your help, Nidia will be able to support her son so that he is not impacted by the divorce of his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Nidia María se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para poder sacar adelante al menor de sus tres hijos, ya que ella se divorció, y la separación, causó muchos problemas y pérdida de tiempo, lo que hizo que ella no tuviera un negocio estable de dónde sacar dinero y la ayuda económica que le dan sus 2 hijos mayores no le alcanza, puesto que ellos también tienen hijos que apoyar y el dinero no les rinde. Nidia empezó ayudando a una sobrina que vende ropa en el mercado del poblado de Umán, Yucatán, México y con el tiempo, le llegó la oportunidad de obtener su propio puesto e independizarse, así fue como comenzó su negocio, comprando poco a poco ropa usada y vendiéndola en el mercadito. Sin embargo el negocio no da lo suficiente como para mantenerse a ella y su hijo pequeño, y como para resurtir su negocio. Por lo tanto Nidia hoy está solicitando un préstamo de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con ese dinero Nidia podrá comprar mercancía para surtir su puesto de ropa para la temporada de invierno y obtener mayores ganancias. Y así poder celebrar junto con su hijo una navidad, sin preocupaciones de deudas. Con tu ayuda Nidia podrá sacar a su hijo adelante, y que no le afecte más de lo que hasta hoy le perjudicó, el divorcio de sus padres.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
At the bus station in the city of Ayaviri we find madam Natalia, a happy mother with a great entrepreneurial spirit. She sells her delicious KanKacho (grilled meat stewed accompanied by baked potatoes) a typical plate unmistakable in that city. For that reason she started it “The Land of Kankacho” Natalia prepares her delicious stew from 2:00 in the morning in order to sell it later from 8:00 until 5:00. While she is busy with her work her husband, Aníbal, is dedicated to the commercialization of ox and sheep. Natalia’s hope is to implement variety for her stand by adding candy, soda, and snacks. Like that she wants to offer a large variety of products to her bus station clients. In order to solidify her plans Natalia and her husband, parents of two children, are soliciting a loan that they will use for the implementation of their business, and at the same time this money will permit her to amplify her business capital for her beloved husband. Together they will try to find a better quality of life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

En el terminal terrestre de la ciudad de Ayaviri encontramos a doña Natalia, madre alegre con gran espíritu emprendedor, vendiendo su delicioso Kankacho (carne asada acompañada de papas al horno) plato típico e infaltable en dicha ciudad, es por esa razón que se la conoce como “ LaTierra del Kankacho”. Natalia prepara su delicioso potaje a partir de las 2:00 de la mañana para luego ponerlos en venta desde las 8:00 hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, mientras ella se desempeña en esta labor, su esposo, Aníbal, se dedica a la comercialización de ganado ovino y vacuno; el deseo de Natalia es implementar con gran variedad de golosinas, gaseosas, galletas su pequeño puesto de Kankacho, y así ofrecerles una inmensa variedad de productos a los concurrentes del terminal terrestre. Para concretar sus planes Natalia y su esposo padres de dos pequeños, solicitan un préstamo que utilizarán en la implementación de su negocio y al mismo tiempo este dinero le permitirá ampliar su capital de negocio a su querido esposo y así juntos tratan de buscar mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus apreciados hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of more quantity and variety of products

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Latofat R. is divorced and has 8 children. She is a very strong and determined woman. She has previously proved herself to be a good client our organization. The children have grown up and are helping her with the business. She used to purchase goods in Uzbekistan. Now she has an agreement with private distributing companies in Russia. These companies promptly fulfill Latfat's orders. Thanks to her upbringing and past experiences Latofat is able to easily come to agreements with suppliers and make sure that the deal is advantageous. Her produce is well know among clients for it's good quality. A lot of her clients are local stores. She came to Kiva in order to secure additional funds that will allow her to purchase the next batch of candy.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Рахимкулова Латофат разведённая, сама воспитывает 8 детей.Женщина сильного характера,стойкая и волевая. Аккуратный клиент нашей организации.Дети выросли и помогают ей по бизнесу.Раньше она покупала товар в Узбекистане а сейча у неё есть договор с частными фирмами-дистрибюторами с России.Они принимают заказ от неё и выполняют за короткие сроки.Блогодаря жизненому опыту и закалке она искусно ведет переговоры с поставщиками на выгодных условиях.Она так же хорошо зарекомендовала свою продукцию среди клиентов и имеет наибольшее количество клиентов среди местных магазинов.В Киву она обратилачсь с запроссом на мах. сумму для закупки очередной партии конфет.

loans.use: Purchase 10kg of chocolate, 20kg of sugar candies and 20kg of fruit marmelade

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
M. Dilbar is 45 years old. She is married with 2 children.

Dilbar is selling the clothing for women in the local central market. Once a week Dilbar travels to the neighboring city Istaravshan for purchasing the new goods for selling. Dilbar is very polite and open person by her nature, and this helps her in the business. For 4 years of her activities she managed to have her clientele. Dilbar ‘s business is stable and brings the main income allowing the family to improve the living conditions and make the plans for future.

Dilbar had demonstrated herself as an honest client managing her previous loans accurately. Today she requests 200.00 US Dollars for the term of 8 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing of new clothing for women with the purpose to increase the range of goods for selling. Dilbar would like to thank everyone for support and to promise to pay the loan in time

loans.use: Purchasing of new clothing for women in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita is a very active woman with dreams of getting ahead. She has sold beauty products for some time. She works for a cosmetic line that is well-known at the national level. Because of her good service and friendliness, she has a numerous clientele. This is why she opted to sell more products in her humble home that also serves as her display and advising space. She needs a display case to better display her products, and she is requesting your support to obtain a loan with the goal of making her dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juanita, es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, se dedica desde hace buen tiempo a la venta de productos de belleza, trabaja para una línea cosmética muy conocida a nivel nacional y por su buena atención y amabilidad cuenta con una clientela numerosa, es por eso que optó por implementar con más productos su humilde hogar que le sirve también de espacio de exposición y asesoramiento, le hace falta una vitrina para una mejor exposición y solicita vuestro apoyo para obtener un préstamo a fin de hacer realidad sus deseos.

loans.use: Purchase of a display case

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Mrs. Yen T., age 45, has had a business selling groceries and vegetables in a market since 1979. She earns around $5 a day in revenue. Her husband, Mr. Sim Savoeun, 48, stays at home and raises pigs. He makes approximately $3 a day. They have eight children. Three are married and live away from home. Three sons are construction workers in Phnom Penh City and earn around $3 each per day. One other daughter works in a restaurant with a salary $50 a month.

Mr. Sim Savoeun would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase pig food.

loans.use: To purchase pig food.

loans.name: Nazareth Youth Group

texts.en:
Geofrey M. is a young Kenyan father aged 38 with 4 children. He also lives with 2 orphan children of his late brother who perished a year ago. Geofrey started his business 4 years ago, after accumulating savings from an informal rotating savings fund which his group used to have. This is commonly referred to as “merry-go-round.”

Goefrey stocks maize, millet, and sorghum which he sells to his customers from the neighborhood. With the profits that he gets from his business, he is still able to clothe, feed, and educate his children. With the help of his loan, Goefrey will be able to purchase cereals in bulk to enable him to increase his business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Erasto Jose

texts.en:
Erasto is 47 years old and is originally from Vundica in the district of Moamba, Maputo Province. Erasto is married and the father of 4 children: 2 girls and 2 boys. The oldest is 13 years old and the youngest is 11 months. Besides his children, Erasto also supports 2 stepsons who live with him.

Erasto just studied until 4th grade because he lost his parents when he was quite young. In 1981, he moved to his mother’s region, Matutuine, to serve the obligatory military service. When he retired in 1992, he decided to stay in the region. In 1993, Erasto started to work for the Mozambican railway company as a temporary employee. In his spare time, he would work at the family’s “machamba,” a small agricultural field.

In 1997, Erasto was hired as a permanent employee at the railway company in the department of maintenance and repair, where he still works today. He has a monthly salary of MZN 3,000, which he uses to pay the household expenses and sometimes saves a bit. Erasto’s wife works at the machamba, and she gets between half to one ton of corn every 4 months which helps to increase the household income.

As Erasto already has stable businesses, he decided to start a new business in the family: raising cattle. With Erasto’s third loan with Hluvuku of MZN 14,000, he intends to buy 2 cows for MZN 8,000 each. He will cover the difference between the loan and the cost of the cows with own funds. Erasto used his first loan to buy consumer goods such as a sofa and a fridge, and he used the second loan to buy seeds and other products for the machamba.

In the future, Erasto would like to build a conventional house made of bricks. The picture shows Erasto at his current house.

loans.use: Buy 2 cows

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie S., 42, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years years of experience in the Vegetable Garden business. She sells to the village and public people 4 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Winnie’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The money will be used for the business and her husband helps out with the business.

loans.use: to buy quipment used for the business

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José and his wife, Sanjuana, are making repairs to their home. Their roof is in very bad condition and water leaks into their home when it rains.

He is retired but continues to work in order to maintain his family. He had previously built a room made out of wood, but it gets soaked with the rain. He wants to repair the roof and the floor of this room with the support of a loan from Kiva.

He was not present when this photograph was taken because he works during the day. This photo shows his wife Sanjuana in the room that needs repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. José y su esposa, Sanjuana, están reparando su vivienda ya que el techo está en muy malas condiciones y cuando llueve se mete el agua a su casa.

El es una persona pensionada pero todavía sigue trabajando para poder salir adelante con su familia. El mismo había construido un cuarto de madera anteriormente, pero este se moja cuando llueve, y el quiere reparar el techo y el piso del cuarto con el apoyo del capital Kiva.

El no podia estar presente cuando se tomó esta foto ya que trabaja durante el dia. Esta es foto de la Sra. Sanjuana en el cuarto que necesita reparación.

loans.use: Repair the roof and the floor of a room in his home.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 25 years old and she is single. She has been a charcoal and bites seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwanaidi is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock

loans.name: Sei

texts.en:
Sei M., age 50, is married with 10 children. She has many years of experience in the peanuts, cocoa, and banana plantation business. She sells to the villagers and the public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan from South Pacific Business Development (SPBD).

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala. SPBD loans are Sei's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, fertilizer, wheelbarrow, bush knives

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta baji is a wife of W. A.. She owns a two-room brick house in Arifwala, Pakistan, and has been living in it for the past 6 years. She is the mother of two sons and one daughter. Shagufta baji’s husband has a grocery shop in the community, a business he has run for the past 18 years. Shagufta baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group includes four other members. Husna baji wants a loan to buy plastic utensils to resell. Anwar baji and Siddiqan baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Шарипова Рано жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 42 года,замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка на рынке "Дехкон" имеет небольшую торговую точку,на которой торгует овощами. Рано скупает у оптовых поставщиков  овощи и реализует их в розницу.На доход от торговли она содержит свою семью.Так как муж клиентки временно не работает.На полученный кредит клиентка хочет закупить больше товара.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rano S. lives in the city of Tursunzade. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children. She completed secondary school. She has a small stall at the Dehkon market, where she sells vegetables. Rano buys from wholesale providers and sells retail. She supports her family on the income from sales, since her husband is temporarily unemployed. She wants to use a loan to buy more goods. She will repay the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en: N. Margaret is the leader of Musita lending group in Mayuge district. She is married with 6 children of which 4 are in school. She has a retail shop business which she has been operating for 6 years.  With the loans and with support from her husband, she has been able to recapitalize her shop and is now able to sell a lot of items which bring in a reasonable income. She is grateful for the loans. In her shop, she has stocked her products in large quantities and this helps her in reducing the transport costs since she does her buying only once for a long period of time. Margaret needs a loan to help with stocking her shop with more sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, millet and baking flour which will increase her revenues.

loans.use: Restocking her shop wih sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and other items.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif U., an educated, married man, has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years. With plenty of land available for cultivation, this hard-working man is requesting a loan to buy more seeds and ready his land for cultivation. Sharif U. is striving for success as a farmer to support his family and help build a better future for his children and he has requested 40000 (AF) as an individual loan.

He would like to thank everybody supporting him and hopes to continue his partnership with both Kiva and AFSG in the years to come.

loans.use: buying seeds and preparing his land

loans.name: Doung's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers, all of whom live in Kok Chork Commune, in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mrs. N. has been selling groceries out of his house for more than five years. She has a lot of customer that buy her wares as she is well known in the village. She is married and has four children. All four of them are single and in school. Her husband is a staff member at Cambodia national airport. Mrs. N.'s business is going smoothly and she has currently sold all the groceries from her stocks. Therefore, N. would like to request a loan to buy additional grocery inventory to re-sell for profit. 

The other three borrowers are:  Saroeum, 36, is a local souvenir seller, who asks for a loan as capital to expand her business.  S. is aged 32 and sells groceries in the area of Airport. She is applying for a loan to buy a variety of grocery products for sale.  S., 38, sells soft drinks and she needs a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery inventory for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.  
Juana es casada, tiene 49 años, tres hijos de 19, 14 y  12 años, los menores están en la escuela estatal.
Ella estudio enfermería técnico, trabajo en el hospital en el área de los neonatos, la despidieron, puso un negocio de  pollos a la braza en sociedad pero le engañaron y perdió todo, se dedico a su casa, pero la animaron a que trabaje en  venta productos  de belleza por catalogo.   
Juana necesita un préstamo de  1200 soles, para  la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Desde que comenzó en Finca, con los prestamos que brindan  puede invertir mas en su negocio, y recibe charlas de cómo mejorar su negocio.  
El sueño de Juana es tener su negocio de  venta de ropa
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank 'Unidas Triunfaremos' ('United we will triumph').

Juana is married, she is 49 years old and has 3 kids who are 19, 14 and 12 years old. The youngest are in a state school.

She studied technical nursing and worked in the neonatal unit of the hospital, but was fired so started a business selling marinated chicken called 'pollo a la braza' in a society, but they tricked her and she lost everything.
