She dedicated herself to her home, but was encouraged to work selling beauty products from catalogues.

Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy beauty products from catalogues.

Since she started out with Finca with the loans they have given her she has been able to invest in her business and go to talks about how to improve her business.

Juana's dream is to have her own business selling clothes.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy beauty products from catalogues/Juana necesita un préstamo de  1200 soles, para  la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal Corí Soncco que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Fortunata es casada, tiene 56 años y 5 hijos, Fortunata viaja a diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende mercería como artículos de limpieza, candados, linternas  y lana, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija.
Fortunata necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de candados, lanas.
Los sueños de Fortunata son brindar una buena educación y alimentación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the “Corí Soncco” Communal Bank which means Heart of Gold in Quechua. Fortunate is married, 56 years old, and has 5 children. Fortunata travels to different markets in the region where she sells general merchandise such as cleaning items, padlocks, flashlights and wool. She does this work with the help of her daughter. Fortunata needs a loan for 1000 soles which will be investeed in the purchase of flashlights and wool. Fortunata dreams of providing a good education and food to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flashlights and wool

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine S. is 52 years old. She is married and has one daughter who is currently married. Augustine lives with her husband and two of her grandchildren. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. In addition to that, she also sells grinding stone and coal pot. She started this trade a year ago and has realized the tremendous way her customers buy her goods, especially the coal pot and the grinding stone. She is requesting a loan to make business improvements. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and grinding stone, coal pot etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her grandchildren in school. Augustine belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwumapa’ which means Good work.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, sugar, bottled mineral water, biscuits, grinding stones, coal pot etc.

loans.name: Melpora

texts.en: Melpora  B. is a 4 year member of PMPC residing at Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is requesting a loan of 14,000 Philippine Pesos intended for use as additional capital for her sari-sari store. Mrs. Melpora B. is a traditional midwife, her patients are from her village and from other neighboring barangays. This is her activity aside from running the sari-sari store. She is struggling to earn more income just to make a living. This is her 7th loan cycle and she's praying to God that with the help of this loan she will make her business grow and it will become a grocery store someday.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles O. is fifty-five years old. He is married and the father of a son, who is in school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment at Ejura, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a petty trader who trades in toothpaste, tooth brushes, radio sets, touch lights, and other items. He buys his supplies from wholesalers and retails them to his customers. He enjoys his trade very much. However, he is handicapped by low working capital and finds it difficult making enough in the face of general economic hardship. He therefore needs the loan to remain in business.

He wants to use the loan to buy new stock to serve his customers. He believes this will enable him to make a good income to expand his business. He is a member of the community group called Mawuli Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

Augustine is in the photo taken during his group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase toothpaste, tooth brushes, radio sets, touch lights, and other items bulk.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Farming is the major source of income in the village of Pangal Norte in Echague, Isabela, where Roberto has been managing his rice field for almost ten years. He wants to develop his business but due to lack of capital he cannot afford all of the farm inputs he needs. He is therefore asking for a loan of PHP 12,000.00 from the lenders as additional working capital.

With this business alone, Roberto is able to support his family. He is now 36 years old and his wife Anita is an elementary school teacher in their village. He is hoping that his loan request will be approved for it will of great help towards achieving the sustainability of his farming business. He also believes that aside from having enough capital, patience and hard work are essential factors in the success of every business endeavor.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
The need to improve his income and provide education for his three dear children is the reason Nabi B. is courteously requesting this loan.

Nabi is a very responsible and hardworking father who, for many years, has been dedicated to the business of buying and selling men’s clothes. 

Today Nabi is requesting a loan of $2,000 to expand his business so that he can generate more income for the well-being of his family. He is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more men's clothes to sell

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
El señor Elías V. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Elías es chapista, realizando arreglo de vehículos accidentados en el taller que se encuentra en su propio domicilio, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro de cerramiento en la fachada de su vivienda, ya que por el pasar del tiempo el actual muro de adobe se encuentra deteriorado y es ya un peligro, tanto para el señor Eloy, como para los vehículos con los que trabaja.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Elías V. lives in his own house in the Llojeta area, which is on the west side of the city of La Paz. Elías is an auto body repairer. He fixes vehicles that have been in accidents. His shop is in his home. The income supports him. The loan he is asking for is to build a wall enclosing the front part of his house. With the passage of time, the current adobe wall has deteriorated. It is a danger for Elías and for the vehicles that he works on. This is the sixth time he has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a wall in the front of his house, the old adobe wall has deteriorated

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Mr. Phen S. lives in Roka village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for rice cultivation. His wife, Mrs. Poeu Nim, is a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. 

Thus, Mr. Phen S. decided to ask for a loan to expand his wife’s business. He is a 59-year-old father of five children. Two of the children are employed in a garment factory, while one stays at home to do housework and the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: Purchasing more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es: El señor Freddy Aragón 48 años de edad, habita en los cedros, comarca del municipio de Villa del Carmen, departamento de Managua, casado tiene dos hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad, tiene como planes construir un anexo en su casa siendo la cocina. Trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de responsable de bodega desde hace seis meses, poco a poco  espera hacer sus anhelos  de realizar sus planes y con este financiamiento es la opción. Agradece a la Institución por el préstamo el cual  comprara  materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, perlines, piso y zinc. Ofreciendo una mayor comodidad a su familia y sobre todo un techo digno.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para construir la cocina

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two boys and two girls, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Emilia is a food vendor. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi and cooks and sells rice and stew on the street in her community in the mornings. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to make rice and stew

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira has always been a very hard-working woman. She used to work sewing and selling national dresses for women and girls. Starting the business wasn't easy because she didn't have the necessary machine to do the work. However, with the help of her mother, she was able to collect enough money to buy her own machine four years ago and has been working in embroidery ever since. Gulmira would like to grow her business even more by purchasing a modern automated embroidery machine. With your help she can achieve her goal.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase an automated embroidery machine.

loans.name: Filiga

texts.en:
Filiga F. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Tiavea.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Filiga owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Filiga has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Filiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Filiga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Filiga is now requesting a new loan of 2700 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Filiga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pineda

texts.en:
Pineda said she believes that "patience is a virtue". She manages a livestock business, particularly focussed on hog-raising, and her net income is PHP2,000.00 every 3 months. She is now planning to expand her hog-raising business by having an additional pigpen for their shelter. For this, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 that she can use to pursue her plan and also to buy two bags of hog feed.

She is married to Victoriano, a farmer, and they are blessed with six children, four of whom are already married. They live with their two single children in the village of San Pablo, Alicia, a rural area where most of the people are engaged in farming. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Addtional capital in her hog-raising business

loans.name: Do

texts.en:
Do S., 39, is married with three children. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children.

To make a living, her husband provides transportation services by operating his motorbike with the compartment attached, earning approximately an income of $8.50 USD per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children, who is currently employed as a security guard at a local garment factory. He is able to earn an income of $3.00 USD per day to help cover the household expenses.

Mrs. S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Mrs. S. is asking for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase piglets to raise for resale.

loans.use: To buy piglets for resale in order to diversify her business.

loans.name: Unchangeable Group

texts.en:
Gladys F. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Unchangeable. She is 40 years old, married with 4 children ages 11 to 22 years old and their educational levels are 10th grade to high school graduate.  Gladys also cares for 2 siblings.  She is a 7th grade dropout due to poverty.

Gladys and her family live and work in the Duala community, a community that has one of the largest food markets in Monrovia, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.  Her business is the sales of plastic materials and clothing.  She buys plastic materials and clothing from importers and sells retail in the Duala market, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.  She has been running this business for 18 years and is hoping to improve to being an importer.

Gladys talks to her customers in a good manner and sells quality goods in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business, but she started by selling palm oil with LD $200.00, which was given to her by her father. 

She needs this loan to purchase more clothing so that she can serve her customers.  Gladys dreams of giving her children better educations and building a house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes so that she can serve her customers.

loans.name: Bunheng

texts.en: Mr. Bunheng P., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Sreykea Cheng, 38, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married 13 years ago and have six children: one daughter and five sons. Four of them attend school and the other two are still too young. Bunheng has been a fisherman for ten years, while his wife has a grocery at her home in the village.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets for his fishing business and purchase more grocery items for his wife’s store.

loans.name: Brenda Guadalupe

texts.es: Brenda Guadalupe A. P. de 28 años de edad, reside en Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como motorista del transporte público, así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a trabajar. Brenda posee un comedor en el cual se encarga de hacer desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo hace y vende pupusas. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar frutas y verduras, ya que las personas solicitan mucho las frutas para comerlas como postre, de esta manera Brenda lo considera clave para poder mejorar sus ventas, sobre todo lo hace pensando en el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Brenda Guadalupe A. P. is 28 years old; she lives in Armenia, Department of Sonsonate. She lives together with her husband, who works as driver in public transportation, and with her two children, 7 and 9 years old, that also work. Brenda owns an eatery where she serves breakfast and lunch, and she also makes and sells pupusas. She is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables since her customers frequently ask for fruits as dessert, and Brenda considers this key to improve her sales, always thinking in the wellbeing of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nelsa Abigail

texts.es: La señora Nelsa Abigail M. A. tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 35 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y lácteos ella se sobrevive  a desde hace 6 años gracias a su esfuerzo y a la ayuda de los fondos Kiva con un pequeño comedor (venta de comida), los principales problemas que le han aquejado en estos años han sido las pocas comodidades que posee el local de su empresa, esto le ha impedido el poder tener mayor captación entre los clientes es por esta razón que ella solicita este préstamo para poder comprar materiales de construcción y comenzar con la primera etapa de ampliación de su local, ellos son una familia humilde, que viven en Esquipulas, desean que se les brinde este préstamo para poder tener mayores ingresos y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nelsa Abigail M. A. is 59 years old, is a single mother and has a 35 year old son who sells groceries and dairy products. She has survived the past 6 years thanks to her efforts and with the help of funds from Kiva for a small canteen (selling food). The main problem that she has suffered from in these years has been that her business premises are not very comfortable. This has prevented her from gaining more clients and it is for this reason that she requests a loan to be buy construction materials and begin the first stage of expanding the premises. They are a humble family who live in Esquipulas. They wish that you will offer them this loan so that they can have greater income and in this way improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Angmor

texts.en: Angmor is married and is the mother of five children, who are all in school. The forty-year-old woman lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Angmor is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called "banku", made from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. Angmor sells her products on a table by the road side in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina T. is single. She has received junior high education.  Celestina sells fabrics, lining, and other sewing materials at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. Celestina uses her income to pay rent and utility bills.  Celestina will use the loan to buy more sewing materials like fabric, lining, etc. for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Celestina plans to save to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Celestina will use the loan to buy more sewing materials like fabric, lining, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Thierry

texts.fr: H. Thierry est né le 19 juillet 1974 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique. Marié à Prudencia, une revendeuse, Thierry est père de trois enfants.  Thierry a un autre enfant à sa charge.  Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés.  La famille vit ensemble au quartier Gbégamey à Allada depuis quatre ans.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Thierry a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour subvenir  à ses besoins, Thierry mène comme activité la vente des tissus et des pantalons.  C’est au marché de Allada que Thierry s’approvisionne.  Thierry a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’il a bien remboursé.  Thierry sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Thierry H. was born on 19th July 1974 in Allada in the "département" (administrative division) of Atlantique. Married to Prudencia, a retailer, Thierry has three children. He also has another child in his care. Not all the children attend school. The family has lived together in the Gbégamey district of Allada for the past four years. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Thierry attended school up until secondary school level. In order to provide for his needs, he has a business selling fabric and trousers. He gets his supplies at the market in Allada. Thierry has already had a loan from ALIDé which he repaid without incident. He is applying for another loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen his business and better satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and trousers

loans.name: Sanka Yuri Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Collpani es un centro que se encuentra en la periferie de la ciudad de El Alto, llegando de esta forma a las personas que más lo necesitan.
Dentro de este centro se encuentra la asociación comunal  Sanka Yuri, compuesta por 14 personas, 13 socias y un socio varón (en la foto falta la señora Lucía G.).
Con respecto a sus negocios está la venta de Jugos, atención de pensión, venta de salchipapas, venta de mantas de vicuña, elaboración de alcancías, artesanía en cuero, venta de libros y plomería.
La presidenta, Alicia H. de 42 años de edad, casada con tres hijos se dedica a la atención de una pensión con el apoyo de su hermana.  Este es su sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, su primer crédito fue de Bs. 1000.- y lo destinó a la compra de ollas, platos, cocina.   En esta oportunidad su solicitud es por Bs. 1500.- para la compra de un Televisor y Videos para vender, de esa forma aprovechar el espacio de la pensión y la presencia de los clientes.
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta más de Pro Mujer, ella responde “la amistad con las compañeras
texts.en:
The Collpani Regional Headquarters is located on the outskirts of the city of El Alto, making it much easier to reach for the people who need its services the most.

Within this center is the Sanka Yuri Communal Bank, which is comprised of 14 people--13 of whom are women, and 1 of whom is a man (Ms. Lucia G. is not pictured here). Regarding their types of businesses, the members sell juices, run a small restaurant, sell salchipapas (South American street food made with pan-fried sausages and fries), sell vicuña fiber blankets, make piggy banks, sell books, make leather handicrafts, or provide plumbing services.

The group president, Alicia H., is a 42-year-old married mother with 3 children who runs a small restaurant with the help of her sister. This is her sixth loan cycle in Pro Mujer. She used her first loan in the amount of 1,000.00 BOB to purchase pots, plates, and a stove. This time, she is requesting a 1,500.00 BOB loan to purchase a television set and DVD's to sell, thus making the most of her business space and her patrons.

When asked what she likes the most about Pro Mujer, she replied, "My friendship with my group members."

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a T.V. set and DVD´s

loans.name: Zarmina Fozia Group

texts.en: Zarmina is a member of Zarmina Fozia group. She lives in the 11th District of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 31 years old and married with two children. She has a beauty salon and is busy working there seven days a week. She needs new designs of cosmetics and new furniture for her beauty salon and would like to develop her business. She hopes to be a successful beautician and to be famous in her area as well. She is glad for this process and would like to admire it as well.

loans.use: To purchase new cosmetics and furniture

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi B. sells locally produced salt and soap at Jukwa. Asi has a senior high school educational background. She is married and lives with her four children. Her husband is a blacksmith. She helps her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for the family. Her loan will be used to buy more salt and soap to sell. She hopes to save the new income from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more salt and soap to sell

loans.name: Nuri

texts.en:
Nuri is a woman with five children. Her husband left for Russia where he is seeking work. Since she was alone at home, she started her own cattle-breeding business. As Nuri had previous experience working on a farm, her business has gone well. Today, she has three cows. She also has enough hay and forage and has calculated that she has enough fodder for even more cattle. So she decided to take out a loan and purchase more cattle.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua K. sells cooked rice with tomato sauce and yams with 'palava' sauce at Abura.  Akosua has been through junior high school.  She is married to an Account Clerk and has a child with him. Akosua has been selling cooked rice and yams for about a year now. She helps her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more rice and yams to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: buy more rice and yams to cook for sale

loans.name: Zorigoo

texts.en:
Zorigoo B. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed while his daughter is at home.

Zorigoo makes furniture in his own fenced yard near the family home. He started this business in 2009 and has since made quality furnishings for the people of his province. He wants to one day rent a small carpentry workshop and operate the business with his brother. He also wants to expand his business by building a workplace to sell more furniture and further improve his family’s financial situation and their quality of life.

Zorigoo is very modest person. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to buy more wood and furniture-making supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy more wood and furniture-making supplies for his business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa M., 40, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Angelito M., a community worker, and they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.

Marissa has been managing her direct-selling business for the past few years. She sells clothing, cosmetics and footwear from the popular direct selling brands.

Marissa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her direct-selling business.

To ensure the success of her business, Marissa would like to apply for a PHP 32,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more advance orders for her customers.

Marissa dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She hopes that all of them will be able to finish their education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more advance orders for her customers

loans.name: Domingo Santos

texts.es:
El señor Domingo Santos G. S. tiene 22 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de El Huaico  provincia Aviles de la ciudad de Tarija. Domingo aun no se caso y vive en la casa de sus padres.   
       
Domingo se dedica a la producción de papa y maíz misma que vende en el mercado de Tarija. También se dedica a trabajar como albañil ambas actividades las viene realizando desde hace muchísimos años. Pero el nos cuenta que tienen la necesidad de comprar semillas de papa y comprar herramientas de trabajo. Es por eso que solicita el crédito, para de este modo poder incrementar su producción y sus ingresos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                              Domingo nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a sus padres y hermanos para que sean felices. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su casa. Domingo quisiera formar una familia, tener hijos y en un futuro nietos.
texts.en:
Señor Domingo Santos G. S. is 22 years old and lives in the El Huaico community in the Aviles province in the city of Tarija. Domingo is not yet married and lives with his parents. Domingo grows potatoes and corn that he sells in the Tarija market. He also works as a mason. He has worked both jobs for many years. He tells us that he needs to buy potato seeds and work tools. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan. This will help him to increase his production and his income. Domingo tells us that his biggest dream is to be able to give his parents and siblings all the comforts that he can so that they are happy. Also, he says that the next loan that he requests will be to make improvements to his home. Domingo would like to have a family one day with children and eventually, grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and work tools

loans.name: Michael

texts.es: Michael, de 25 años de edad, convive son su pareja y tienen una hija. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de adobe. Para Michael su vida fue difícil y mucho más cuando egresó de la universidad, siendo un ingeniero de minas, no lograba encontrar un trabajo estable, por que solo se conformó con pequeños trabajos temporales, permaneciendo así durante algunos años. Hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar como constructor de viviendas y edificios, hoy realiza diversos servicios para entidades públicas y privadas, por lo que le está yendo muy bien, además tiene a cargo de operarios para cualquier trabajo que se presente, desde entonces su situación económica ha mejorado. Su punto de trabajo lo realiza en su propia localidad. Sus planes a futuro es tener su propia constructora, con la finalidad de que pueda mejorar en su economía y su calidad de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está satisfecho con su grupo comunal, ya que todos se ayudan entre sí. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales de construcción como topógrafos, picos, palas y barretas con el propósito de minimizar tiempo y costo.
texts.en:
Michael, age 25, lives with his life partner and their daughter in the city of Santa Rosa. It is located in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle, where he has an adobe house. Life for Michael was difficult, and it was much more difficult when he graduated from the university as a mining engineer. He was unable to find steady work, and he made due with small seasonal jobs. It stayed that way for several years until he had the opportunity to work as a building contractor for homes and buildings. He now provides diverse services for public and private entities. Therefore, it is going very well for him. Also, he has a group of workmen for whatever work that presents itself. Now his financial situation has improved. He does his work locally. His plan for the future is to have his own construction company. The reason for this is to be able to improve his finances and his quality of life. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He pledges to continue making his payments on time. Also, he is pleased with his communal bank because everyone helps each other. He will use the requested loan to buy construction materials like surveying equipment, pickaxes, shovels, and nail pullers. He will do that to minimize time and cost.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida D. R. is from the town of Rizal West, San Isidro. She is 49 years old. Leonida is married and has 1 grown child. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a business selling home products primarily ingredients such as onions and vegetables. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is 29 years old and married with two children.  He does photography together with his wife and has one employee.  He has been running Evan’s Photo Shop for seven years.  He hopes that one day he will expand his business and employ more people.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy another camera.  For this loan, he has been guaranteed by Shirley’s Group in Faulu Kenya where he is a member.  He hopes to manage his own company in ten years.  He describes himself as hardworking, focused, and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es: El señor José Santos J. Marín es una persona muy trabajadora que percibe ingresos por medio de un transporte que lo maneja desde hace 2 años; llevando a niños a sus respectivas escuelas a su entrada y salida. A José le gustaría remodelar la barda de su vivienda pues la que tiene ya esta muy deteriorada lo cual necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra, es por eso que pide de su apoyo para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
José Santos J. Marín is a very hardworking person who makes his living in transportation. He has been driving for the past 2 years, bringing children to their respective schools and picking them up later. José would like to remodel the wall of his home because the one that he currently has is damaged. To do this, he needs to purchase materials and pay for the labor. This is why he is requesting your help to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel his wall

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda R., 46, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edwin R. and is mother to two young, hard-working adults and two school-aged children. By the grace of God, Luzviminda has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide for their everyday expenses.

Luzviminda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piecemeal rates.  Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Luzviminda dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, from the results of all her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Holger Alfredo

texts.es:
Holger Alfredo R. A. tiene 48 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 11 anos.  

Holger es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Holger trabaja como contador. Solicita el crédito para pagar los estudios universitarios para sus hijos. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría darles a sus hijos un poco más en la vida. Su sueno para los próximo 5 anos es aumentar un proyecto pequeño de cacao. 

En el poco tiempo libre que tiene, le gusta dedicar a la familia.
texts.en:
Holger Alfredo R. A. is 48 years old. He lives with his common-law wife in Chillanes canton, in the province of Bolivar, Ecuador. He has two children, who are 15 and 11.  

Holger is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos [The Joy of Being Friends] rural communal bank, which is located 20 minutes from San Jose del Tambo parish. The bank has 15 members in all, most of whom work growing cocoa beans or have their own small businesses. 

Holger works as an accountant, and is asking for a loan to pay for his children to attend college. With the help of this loan, he will be able to give his children a little bit more in life. His goal for the next five years is to expand his small cocoa-growing enterprise. 

Holger likes to spend what little free time he has with his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children to attend college

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco Antonio S. A. de 50 años de edad, vive junto a su madre de 78 años de edad, quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Francisco posee una venta de medicina natural, la cual esta ubicada en la Plaza Bendición de Dios, y en donde gracias a todos los años que cuenta de tenerlo en la misma locación, es muy conocido por las personas que compran en esta plaza. Francisco depende por completo de las ganancias generadas por este negocio, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee por lo que es de mucha importancia poder mejorarlo. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más medicinas y así atender a más clientes los cuales le hacen diferentes tipos de pedidos. De esta forma Francisco se asegura obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean de gran bendición para su hogar.
texts.en: Francisco Antonio S. A., 50, lives with his 78-year old mother who takes care of their house.  Francisco has operated a business selling herbal medicines in Plaza Bendicion de Dios for many years.  So many years, in fact, that he's very well known among the people who regularly come to the plaza to shop.  Francisco depends on the business for virtually all of his income so being able to grow and improve it is very important to him.  That's why he's applying for this loan: he will use it to buy more inventory so that he can better serve his customers and provide the kinds of products they want to buy.  He expects to be able to increase his income, as a consequence, and better provide for his family.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rosas De Tilata Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Rosas de Tilata” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, es un grupo nuevo que se ha unido para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.    La banca comunal está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  Los negocios que desempeñan son:  venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de chompas tejidas, trenzado de mantas venta de papa, venta de comida, bordados, comida y tejidos.
La presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Claudina,  está casada, es madre de 4 hijos.  La señora Claudina tiene como negocio la venta de café en la parada de un minibús del barrio donde vive, ella cuenta que cuando llegó hace 15 años a la zona, no se contaba con este servicio, por lo que le pareció un buen negocio.  A través de los años ella se dio cuenta que necesitaba un ingreso más, por lo que se decidió a  vender verduras en el mercado de la zona, los días martes y viernes. Su primer préstamo es por Bs.2000 con el objetivo de realizar una compra por mayor de insumos para el puesto de café y de verduras.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta  capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosas de Tilata," started their first loan cycle in the Cascada central office of Pro Mujer.  This is a new group that has gotten together to receive credit services, training and health care.  This communal bank has 9 members.  Their businesses are: fruit sales, neighborhood store, knitted sweater sales, weaving rugs, potato sales, food sales, embroidery, food production, and knitting.  The president of the communal bank, Claudina, is married and is the mother of 4 children.  Claudina has a business selling coffee at a mini-bus stop in the neighborhood where she lives.  She tells us that she arrived in this area 15 years ago, and as no one was providing this service she thought it would make for a good business.  Over the years she realized that she needed a better income, and so she decided to sell vegetables in the market in the area on Tuesdays and Fridays.  Her first loan was for 2,000 bolivianos, which she used to buy supplies at wholesale for her stall where she sells coffee and vegetables.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training and health services.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sugar and coffee

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a married man with one child who is too young to go to school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He operates a coconut selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. Antony faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During hot summer season, fewer coconuts are available in the market. He hopes to become a real estate agents in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to start a video library, purchase a video machine and chairs for the viewers in his video library.

loans.use: To start a video library, purchase a video machine and chairs for the viewers in his video library.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
This is Rodel D., 41, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Rosanna D., who works as a housekeeper, and together they manage the household and business. By the grace of God, Rodel has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Rodel operates a variety store while managing their videoke ( a karaoke with a video showing the lyrics of the song being sung) and their motorized tricycle. They rent out the videoke on a 24-hour basis, while the tricycle enables them to get purchase and deliver their products. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rodel earns income by getting supplies in wholesale price and selling them as single items.  His store is located adjacent to their house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help Rodel continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php25, 000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 
 
Rodel dreams to be able to renovate their house soon and have his children finish their college education, with all of his work with the business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory

loans.name: Vicenta Elicenia

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo.

En este lugar encontramos a la  señora Vicenta. Tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos una niña de 10 años y un varón  de 6 años, los mismos que estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es chofer. Ella estudia educación parbularia en la Universidad Eloy Alfaro a distancia.

Trabaja como maestra parvularia en un jardín, pero también se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de ropa de todo tipo, aunque reconoce que lo que más vende es ropa de damas, trabaja en su negocio de lunes a viernes por las tardes ya que en las mañanas está en su trabajo en el jardín, aunque aquí también aprovecha para venderles a sus compañeras de clases y padres de familia que son sus clientes, la mercadería la compra en Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 años es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son terminar su carrera y obtener el nombramiento para seguir impartiendo sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of green mountains and charming landscapes, there is a place where, every 15 days, the members of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank meet.
Here we meet Vicenta. She is 32 years old, and lives with her partner and their two children, a 10-year-old girl and a 6-year-old boy. Both attend school. Her husband is a chauffeur. She studies elementary education by correspondence at the Eloy Alfaro University.
She works as a kindergarten teacher, but she also sells clothing of all kinds, and mostly women’s clothing. She works the business in the afternoon Monday to Friday since she works at school in the morning. She also sells her products to co-workers and parents who are her customers. She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo.
This loan will be used to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. She has been with this Communal Bank for six years and she is in charge of collecting the payments. She likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dreams are to finish her degree and to be appointed as a teacher so that she can continue passing on her knowledge.

loans.use: Purchase of pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Sy Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE BABACAR SY est créé depuis bientôt 05 ans. Il est composé de 22 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Leur activité dominante est la vente de fruits de saison. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KIGNABOUR2 

Madame ABY D.,debout en seconde position à partir de la droite sur la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe blanche et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 60. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de poisson frais et de légumes. Elle maitrise bien cette activité pour l'avoir menée depuis plus de 10 ans. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son petit commerce afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers. 

Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent d'acheter de la nourriture pour ses enfants et et petits enfants.
texts.en: The solidarity group Sop Serigne Babacar Sy was created nearly 5 years ago.  It is made up of 22 women who all come from the same neighborhood.  Their predominant business is the sale of seasonal fruits.  The group is a member of the Village Bank of Kignabour 2.  Madame Aby D., standing second to the right of the photo, in a white scarf and pictured in the inset, is the leader of the group.  She is 60 years old.  She is a widow and the mother of 6 children.  She runs a small business selling fresh fish and vegetables.  Her talent in this business has allowed her to run it successfully for more than 10 years.  Her new loan will allow her to develop her small business in order to increase her financial revenues.  The profits she makes will allow her to buy food for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: Purchase of fish and vegetables

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a 65-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 businesses: a general store and a cafeteria. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. Ofelia has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 19,500 in order to purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ofelia hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mirna Cecilia

texts.es: Mirna Cecilia P. D. F. es una madre D. familia muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual se dedica por completo a su familia, ella vive junto a sus tres hijos, en el municipio D. San Martín, mismo lugar en el cual posee sun egocio, su esposo resiD. en Los Estados Unidos gracias a lo que Mirna recibe remesas. Ella trabaja elaborando pupusas, las cuales son un platillo típico D. este país, por lo que esta venta en un negocio bastante estable. Mirna solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maís, arroz, frijoles, queso y chicharrón, D. manera que pueda contar con mayor cantidad D. materia prima para elaborar las pupusas. Todo esto lo hace con el enorme deseo D. podar mejorar su estabilidad familiar y D. esta forma vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en: Mirna Cecilia P. D. F. is a responsible mother, hard-working, and dedicates herself to her family.  She lives with her 3 children in the San Martin municipality, same place as her business.  Her husband lives in the United States and thankfully sends Mirna remittances.  She works making pupusas, which is a typicall dish in this country and provides for a stable business.  Mirna requested a loan in order to purchase greater quantities of corn, rice, beans, cheese, and pork rinds; this way she has a larger quantity of raw materials to make the pupusas.  She does all of this with an enormous wish of improving her family's stability and living better off alongsiD. her family.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make pupusas (corn based dish typically with some sort of stuffing)

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman with one pre-school child. She lives in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a tailoring business for the past five years, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Loice faces a major challenge in late payment by those who purchase in credit. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a bundle of materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Isaie

texts.fr: Isaie M. est éleveur des poules, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il a 29 ans, célibataire, et né à Rwanda.  Il a fini un niveau d’éducation d’A1 en gestion.  Ce crédit et son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 192 petits poussins, et 1500kgs du repas de poussins, et autres dépenses relative a son business.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter des petits poussins, chercher et garder le marché de son affaire (par exemple, la vente d’eux dans les restaurants dans la ville de Gisenyi).  Il voudrait devenir un grand éleveur dans le district de Rubavu, préparer et bâtir sa propre maison d’habitation.  Il veut aussi préparer pour son futur en paiement de ses frais d’études.
texts.en: Isaie M.  is a poultry farmer and a client of ACB since 2010. He is 29 years old and single. He was born in Rwanda. He has finished A1 level studies [roughly equivalent to junior college] in management. This loan is his first cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to  pay for 129 chicks, 1500 kg of chicken feed and other expenses necessary to his business. His business strategy is to keep increasing the number of chicks as well as identify and keep his market niche (for example, selling to restaurants in the town of Gisenyi). He wants to become a large-scale farmer in the Rubavu district and have his own house built. He would also like to plan for his future in paying for his studies.

loans.use: to purchase 129 chicks, 1500 kg of chicken feed, and other necessities for his farm

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 30 years old.  She is married to Joshua Tumpes, aged 32 years, who is a farmer.  Together they have two children -- Vivian, aged 16,  and Melvin, aged 10.

Caroline runs a hotel which has been running for a period of 6 years.  It is located near their residential area, a busy remote area where most of her clients are females. Caroline’s business gives her a monthly profit of Kshs 4,000.

Caroline was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. This loan of Kshs 16,000 is her first loan with KADET LTD and she intends to use it to purchase food for the hotel. If the loan boosts her business, she plans to continue supporting her family and getting their necessary basic needs addressed. 

Caroline dreams of opening a guest house. Caroline describes herself as ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase food for her hotel

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La señora Betty tiene una ferretería, que es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para comprar tornillos, lijas, cables, clavos, etc. Betty se enfermo y tuvo un gasto en los medicamentos y su hospitalización, habiendo usado sus ahorros para este gasto imprevisto. Es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona de las Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Sra. Betty owns a hardware store, which serves as a source of income needed to support her family. This loan will be used to buy screws, sandpaper, cables, nails, and other products. Betty became ill and accumulated expenses for medicines and her hospitalization. She utilized her savings in order to cover these unexpected expenses.

Betty is married and has one child. She lives in the home of her in-laws, which is located in the District of Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: To purchase screws, sandpaper, cables, nails, and other products.

loans.name: Sari Ayu Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah M. is chairperson of the group SA. Ayu. This group consisted of 10 women who have the same job, that is, raising pigs to help support their families. With a loan of Rp.1,000,000 per member, they will buy two pigs of superior breed. Currently they are raising pigs of local breeds.

Ni Nengah M. wll use the loan to buy two pigs of superior breed. She already has a good cage at her home and raises a kind of local pig. She wants to increase business revenue by raising superior breed pigs. She hopes these efforts will grow and be able to finance the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy two pigs of superior breed.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La señora Luisa se dedica a la producción de flores . El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más semillas para plantar y producir flores de diversas coloraciones para su venta al público en general. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Waycuni en la población de El Palomar; es casada y tiene un hijo. Esta es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y la segunda a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Señora Luisa makes her living growing flowers.  She needs the loan to purchase more seeds to plant and grow variously colored flowers to sell to the general public.  She lives in her own home in the Waycuni zone, in the nieghborhood of El Palomar.  She is married and has one son.  This is her fifth loan with IMPRO and her second through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to grow flowers, which she sells to the general public.

loans.name: Luis Alexander

texts.es:
Luis tiene 21 años de edad, él es soltero, cuenta con  casa propia ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

Luis se gana la vida desde hace 2 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.
Cuenta con ingresos adicionales de labores en agricultura.

Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de animales para su comercialización ymejoramiento de sus tierras de cultivo.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

luis es una persona responsable y puntual, además cuenta con muy buenas referncias.
texts.en:
Luis tiene 21 años de edad, él es soltero, cuenta con  casa propia ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

Luis se gana la vida desde hace 2 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.
Cuenta con ingresos adicionales de labores en agricultura.

Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de animales para su comercialización ymejoramiento de sus tierras de cultivo.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

luis es una persona responsable y puntual, además cuenta con muy buenas referncias.

loans.use: Compra de animales con sus respectivos alimentos y mejoramiento de sus tierras de cultivo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old and a hard working businessman.  He is married and is a proud father of two children ages 11 and 7 years old.  He has been selling second-hand shoes for the last ten years.  He wants 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more shoes.

In five years, he wants to open up a permanent business stall and he dreams of having a successful business.  He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching him the art of customer care and how to save money.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Arlyn has a shop that sells hypo or cleansing agent. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making hypo or cleansing agent. Arlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make hypo or cleansing agent

loans.name: Maida

texts.es:
La Sra. Maida tiene 53 años de edad, es Viuda. del Sr. Migdonio, tiene un solo hijo con el que vive en su casa propia en la  ciudad de Carapeguá.
El Sr. Migdonio se dedicaba a la venta ambulante durante mucho tiempo mientras su Sra. fabricaba la tradicional frazada y sobrecama, él se encargaba de venderlo hasta que un día falleció en un trágico accidente cuando realizaba su trabajo. Desde entonces la Sra. ya viuda se encargó de todos los trabajos de su marido, actualmente hace más de 6 años que se encuentra trabajando con su hijo quien también le ayuda en la actividad.
La Sra. solicita el crédito para la compra de sobrecamas, sabanas y hamaca para abastecerse y de esa forma poder cumplir con los pedidos de la clientela.
texts.en:
53 year old Maida is the widow of Mr Migdonio. She has one son who lives with her in her house in the city of Carapeguá.
Mr Migdonio worked for many years as a traveling salesman while his wife made the traditional blankets and bedspreads. He sold these goods until one day he died in a tragic accident while working. Since then, Maida has taken on all her husband's work, and she has been doing this for 6 years, helped by her son. She is requesting a loan to buy bedspreads, cloths, and hammocks to increase her supplies and meet her customer's orders.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, cloths, and hammocks for resale.

loans.name: One Word Group

texts.en:
Marie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born in Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone, she is married to a trader and the couple has 4 children, 3 of whom attend primary and secondary schools. Marie sells cooked food – foo-foo (a paste made from root vegetables and a staple of the local diet). She also sells bread and ground nuts. 

With the help of this loan, Marie and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Marie will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy cooking ingredients like raw foo-foo, fish, etc. in bulk in order to produce a large amount of cooked foo-foo for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like raw foo-foo, fish, etc. in bulk in order to make cooked food for sale

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana, de 55 años es una mujer muy trabajadora y con ganas de sobre salir, esta separada de su esposo y vive en casa de su padre junto a el y su hijo.El trabajo de Susana consiste en la venta de bebidas, realiza esta actividad en su casa, lleva ya un aproximado de de seis años, trabaja sola ya que su hijo  trabaja en otras actividades y no puede apoyarla.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre le gusto mucho el mundo de los negocios y también le da tiempo para poder realizar otras actividades, ella sabe que el negocio que tiene es rentable ya que siempre tiene ingresos y clientes, espera para más adelante poder poner su bodega de abarrotes y una librería.Este es el segundo préstamo entre Susana y la institución MFP, le gusta el grupo que es parte y espera poder seguir trabajando con la institución como lo ha hecho ya que siente es una gran ayuda.Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, ella comprar bebidas para tener en su almacén, ya que se ha incrementado el costos y espera tener en su almacén para no tener que invertir mucho mas adelante.
texts.en:
Susana, age 55, is a hardworking woman who is eager to move forward. She is separated from her spouse and lives at home with her father and her son. Susana’s job involves selling beverages, which she does from home. She has been in business for approximately six years. Susana works alone since her son works in other activities and is not able to help her. She has always enjoyed working and being part of the business world. In addition, she spends time pursuing other activities. Susana knows that her business is profitable and is always able to generate income and attract customers. She hopes to get ahead by establishing a grocery store and a bookstore.

This is her second loan with MFP. She enjoys being part of her group and hopes to continue working with MFP because she feels it has been a great help. With the amount of 1500 PEN that she requested, Susana will buy beverages to stock her warehouse. The cost of these products has increased, so she hopes to build a warehouse in order to avoid investing more money later.

loans.use: to buy beverages in bulk.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Doña Elba tiene 55 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, comenta que se dedica a la compra de trajes de hombre como de smoking, cadetes, frac, traje normal etc. dice que a ella le llena de emoción cada vez que van a rentarle los trajes a las quinceañeras ya que le gusta ver a las chicas la cara de emoción por su fiesta y el ver a sus chambelanes muy bien cambiados, dice que su negocio le deja muchas satisfacciones ver tanta alegría en la caras de los clientes, doña Elba tiene con su negocio desde hace 20 años, hace poco dice que se asocio con su nuera y su hijo para poder hacer mas grande la tienda y comprar mas trajes. Dice que esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de tela de diferentes colores para mandar hacer las corbatas, los moños, fajin, compra de pantalones, camisas blancas etc. dice que quiere hacer un poco mas grande el local ya que no cabe la mercancía ahí y tiene que rentar otro local para guardar la ropa que renta. Ella ira a la ciudad de México a comprar las telas, los pantalones y mandara hacer los moños y las demás cosas en diferentes tallas.
texts.en:
Doña Elba is 55 years old, married, and has two dependent children. She says that she buys men’s outfits such as smoking jackets, cadet uniforms, tuxedo tails, regular suits, and other items. Elba says that she is filled with emotion every time she rents out outfits for “quinceañeras” because she enjoys seeing the excitement on the faces of young girls as they plan their parties and helping their chamberlains (the attendants at the ceremony) transform into well-dressed young men. She takes great satisfaction in seeing the joy on her customers’ faces. Doña Elba has been in this business for 20 years. She says that just recently she partnered with her daughter-in-law and her son to enlarge her shop and buy more outfits.

Elba says that she is requesting a loan to buy fabric in different colors for making ties, bows, sashes, trousers, white shirts, and other items. She says that she wants to make her shop larger because she cannot keep all of her merchandise there. Another space has been rented so that she can store her rental outfits. Elba plans to travel to Mexico City to buy the fabrics for making trousers. The bows and other items will be made by other shops.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making men's suits that will be rented out for events.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a María, ella tiene 24 años  de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Este es el tercer ciclo en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado.

Nuestra amiga es discapacitada pues para caminar ella utiliza dos muletas pero esto no ha sido ningún impedimento para poder salir adelante y ganar sus propios recursos, ella es maestra en una escuela de la localidad pero además de esto también se dedica a realizar manualidades en su casa, nos cuenta que elabora muchos productos más que todo didácticos los mismos que luego vende a bazares y comerciantes del sector.
 
Este crédito es para comprar productos como: madera, cartulinas, pega, pinturas, láminas, etc. para elaborar sus productos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Lucha [Women of Struggle] Communal Bank meets twice a month in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial zone and for its traditional Saint Peter and Saint John festivals and for the happiness of its people.

We meet María in this place. She is 24 years old, single and lives at home with her parents. This is the third cycle at the communal bank and she enjoys the support it has offered.

Our friend is disabled and walks with two crutches, but this has not stopped her from succeeding and obtaining her own means. She is a teacher in a local school and also creates handicrafts at home. She tells us that she creates many educational learning products that she sells at bazaars and to traders in the industry.

This loan is to buy supplies such as wood, cardboard, glue, paints, and foil and other items to create her handiwork.

Her dream is to continue going forward in her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy wood, cardboard, glue, paints, and foil and other items.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola, 55, is a married lady blessed with children who are all grown up. She operates a local retail shop in the Kadhuhuni section of Malindi town. The business has been in existence for the past ten years now, and Pola usually earns a monthly income of about KES 9,800 from it. 

Pola has been loaned KES 50,000 by KADET Ltd. and this serves as her fourth loan cycle from the company. She intends to use her loan to buy items such as cooking flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpastes and sweets for children so as to add to the stock that she already has. 

The lady wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue supporting her family as well as continue restocking and gradually expanding her business so as to continue helping her family to upgrade their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 25-year-old lady. Since she is a conservative person, she requested that her husband, Ammar, appear in the photo. Ammar works in the marketing field. Using his experience, Fatima and her husband started a small retail business a while ago, buying mainly car accessories at wholesale prices and re-selling them to the stores. They have managed to buy a small warehouse and a distributing bus. Now Fatima has applied for a loan to get a larger collection of car accessories for distribution. This couple has two young children.

loans.use: to get more car accessories for her distribution business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth trabaja como empleada domestica y su esposo es carpintero en aluminio. El crédito lo requiere para el costo de traslado de tierra para comenzar la construcción de una habitación en su casa y para la compra de arena, ladrillo y cemento. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Las Lomas  de la ciudad de La Paz; Janeth es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que desea que su crédito sea canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Janeth works as a domestic employee, and her husband is a carpenter who works with aluminum.

She needs the loan for the cost of moving dirt and starting to build a room in her house.  It is also to buy sand, bricks, and cement.

She lives in her own house in the Las Lomas zone in the city of La Paz.  Janeth is married and has four children.

This is the second time that she wishes to have a loan that is channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay to move dirt and to buy bricks, sand and cement in order to start building a room in her house.

loans.name: Mushamukadzi Group

texts.en:
Lynda is a cross-border trader traveling each month to South Africa or Mozambique, where she buys clothes, shoes, and blankets, depending upon her orders, to sell from a table in the market near her home. She has one employee and has been in business for a year.
 
Lynda is married, and her husband is employed as a handyman in a local shop. She is 27 years old. Together they have two children, a two-year-old boy and a six-year-old girl who attends school. Her younger sister looks after her toddler when she is away for business. She has found it difficult to find the right person to look after the children whilst she is away. They have no other sources of income.

Lynda faces a lot of competition in the local market and restrictions at the border on how much she can bring in. She often goes with other members of her group to maximize their personal import allowance. She will use the money she borrows to fill clothing orders she has ahead of the festive season. Lynda looks forward to expanding her business, buying a plot of land, and building her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad, age 40, has a retail shop that sells coconut wines, beverages, and food seasonings. She has had this business for five years. She and her husband have four children.

She has requested a loan for PhP 4,000 in order to buy coconut wine, beverages, and food seasonings to offer for sale.

Trinidad is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Trinidad hopes to improve her business.
