loans.use: to buy coconut wine, beverages, and food seasonings to offer for sale

loans.name: Quan

texts.en:
Quan is 29 years old. She has one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living by selling clothes and materials, which they have done for the past two years. 

Quan would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell to people in her community. She hopes that through the loan her business will expand and her income will increase. This will enable her to set aside savings for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Martha Flora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas De Los Bajos se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 36 años, está separada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 9 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida y para  que a su hija no le falte nada se dedica a lavar ropa ajena y también a la  venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja todos los días tanto en el lavado de ropa como en las ventas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Portoviejo cada vez que necesita. Lleva dos años con su negocio y gracias a esto ella puede sacar adelante a su hija.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y detergentes. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos.

Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas De Los Bajos (United Women of Los Bajos Communal Bank) meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known both for its cultural riches and handicrafts such as Panama hats, which are known both inside and outside the country. Here we meet Señora Martha, age 36. She is separated and has a 9 year old daughter from her former relationship who studies at school. She lives in her parents’ house.

In order to make a living and assure that her daughter doesn’t lack anything, Martha works washing other people’s clothing and also sells clothing of all types. She sells door-to-door. She also sells out of her house to customers with whom she is better acquainted. She works every day spending as much time washing clothes as selling them. Her customers buy on credit, and she collects every eight days. She purchases merchandise at Puertoviejo whenever she needs to. She has had her business for two years, and thanks to this she has been able to help her daughter progress.

This loan is going to be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and detergent. She has been with the communal bank for two cycles and likes it because of the help that has been given to her with loans. Her dreams are to give a better life to her daughter and to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts,and detergent.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has four children.

Taleb is a photographer; in 2009 he decided to open his own store for photography, photocopying and stationeries. He has a sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply $2100 loan in order to purchase a modern camera. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a modern camera.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 43, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer, and her husband is a construction worker. Phally is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more land to grow rice. In the future, she would like to purchase rice to store in the warehouse to sell when the price is higher, build a fence around her house, and support her children's education until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more land to grow rice.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 39 years old and is married with two children aged 15 and 18. He owns a medium size primary school. His wife is a primary school teacher. He has been in this business for 6 years.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to purchase office furniture. He hopes to expand the school classes and to enroll more pupils in the future. He has applied for 50,000 KES to purchase more desks and to renovate the classrooms.

loans.use: to purchase more desks and to renovate the classrooms.

loans.name: Delina

texts.es: Delina, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Walner quien es empleado. Juntos habitan en la casa de sus suegro en compañía de su hijo, sus suegros y cuñados. La actividad que realiza Delina es la venta de comida como juanes y asados de pollos, instalando su mesa en el frontis de la casa de su suegro, desde donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Tiene más de 01 año en éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su suegra para la preparación y atención de los clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y la necesidades de  su pequeño hijo quien es la motivación para seguir progresando. Sin embargo, el alza de los precios de los insumos que debe cobrar sube y eso reduce sus ganancias. Tiene planes de seguir y mantener su negocio, por ello desea ampliarlo comprando sillas y mesas para mayor comodidad de sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas y cumplidos. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comida a precio por mayor para así tener mejores ganancias, tales como arroz, aceites, papas, y demás.
texts.en:
24-year-old Delina is a hard-working and determined woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She lives with her common-law husband Walner, who is an employee.  They live together in her in-laws' home together with their son, her in-laws and brother- and sisters-in-law.  Delina's business is selling food such as 'juanes' and roast chicken.  She sets up her table in front of her father-in-law's home and serves her customers in a kind and friendly manner.  She has more than a year's experience in this business and, up to now, she has had the support of her mother-in-law in preparing her food and serving her customers, who are mainly neighbors.

Delina enjoys her business as it allows her to make income with which she can cover her household expenses and the needs of her young son who is her motivation to continue making progress.  However, the supplies that she needs rise in price and this reduces her profits.  She has plans to continue in her business and keep it running.  To achieve this, she would like to expand it, buying tables and chairs so that she can make her customers more comfortable.

This will be Delina's second loan from MFP.  She feels grateful for the financial support that they give her so that she can continue in her business and make progress with her plans.  She says that she feels comfortable with her community bank as she considers the members to be good and thoughtful people.  Delina will invest her 1,500 soles in buying ingredients for preparing her food wholesale.  This will make her better profits.  She will buy supplies such as rice, oil, potatoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Darling Daniela

texts.es: Daniela, a sus 22 años de edad es soltera y actualmente vive sola. Con su actitud emprendedora, su proyección, empuje y ganas de salir adelante, decidió montar su propio negocio, un almacén donde ofrece mercancía para adultos, ropa interior, accesorios y juguetes para uso íntimo, aprovechando que su negocio es único en el pueblo donde reside y por ende tiene muchos clientes que le generan buenos ingresos, así puede pagar sus cuentas y tener el alimento diario en su hogar. La titular solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito como apoyo, para comprar mercancía al por mayor (ropa interior, juguetes, aceites para masajes, entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le brindan y así tener más variedad de productos que satisfagan los gustos de sus clientes, aumentando de esta forma el nivel de ventas y utilidades. Daniela sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, poder continuar pagando sus estudios y ayudarle a su madre con los gastos de la casa y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Daniela, age 22, is single and currently lives alone. With her enterprising attitude, her goals, her spirit and her desire to get ahead, she decided to open her own business: a store where she offers merchandise for adults, underwear, accessories, and intimate toys. Her business is the only one in her village, so she has many clients and makes a good income. She is thus able to pay her accounts and make a living. She is requesting her second loan cycle in order to buy more merchandise wholesale (underwear, toys, massage oil, and other items). Her goal is to take advantage of discounts and to have a greater variety of products to suit her clients' tastes. This will increase her sales and income. Daniela dreams of expanding her business and being able to continue paying for her studies. She wants to help her mother with her household costs and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (underwear, toys, massage oil, and other items).

loans.name: Ai

texts.en:
Ai nur hanasah is the daughter of a Komida client and she is a student at Cokroaminoto High school.

Her parents' reason for borrowing an education loan from Komida is because they do not have enough money to pay the costs to obtain a high school graduation certificate. By taking a loan from Komida and Kiva, she hopes can graduate and get a start on her dreams.

loans.use: to pay graduation costs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a marvelous, good-hearted young woman who makes her living by practicing mixed farming. She is ambitious and full of hope for the future. 

She makes a living doing mixed farming in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She keeps dairy cows and poultry for commercial milk and eggs, respectively. Besides mixed farming, Beatrice is also very concerned about the health of the environment. She spends most of her time working on her farm. 

Beatrice is seeking a KES 20,000 loan to purchase farm implements. These tools will make the work on her farm move much faster and easier. Tending to her farm involves a lot of digging, uprooting, planting and packaging. There are various tools in the market that are handy for a woman in her line of work. The equipment does not come cheap, however. 

The increase in income from this investment will go to her family's welfare and her children's education. All that remains is for her to say "thank you" to the people who are supporting her project.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Millis

texts.en:
Millis has a general store where she sells office and school supplies. She started the business with the help of her ex-husband who gave her a glass case for her products and $200 worth of merchandise. She has slowly begun to integrate other items into her product line like toys. Millis wants to invest in books and other supplies to sell. Not many people can afford to buy books, but Millis has used payment plans to motivate some potential clients.

Millis is currently separated from her husband. Currently she is taking night school courses at university in order to pursue a degree in commerce. Her dream is to have professional degree and own a successful business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Millis wants to invest in books and other supplies to sell.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
After graduating from medical school, Tatyana worked for a while as a nurse. She had always dreamed of being self-employed, however, so she took a risk and started her own small business selling women’s sports and casual outerwear in one of the local markets. Her business has done well. An attractive selection of top-rate, quality clothing at exceptional prices has helped her develop loyal clientele. She has demonstrated responsibility and integrity in working with “Nadiya Ukraine”, repaying every loan she has received with no defaults. Tatyana is requesting a loan for $1,200 that will allow her to increase her inventory of stylish trench-coats, light-weight fleece jackets, rainwear, parkas and other coats which she can get at wholesales prices. Offering a nice assortment of slimmed down and styled up outerwear at the lowest prices will attract many women in need of good clothing and will boost Tatyana’s sales.

Після медичного училища Тетяна певний час працювала медсестрою. Вона завжди хотіла працювати на себе. Отже, вирішила ризикнути та почати власний бізнесу з продажу спортивного та повсякденного жіночого одягу на одному з місцевих ринків. Бізнес Тетяни процвітає. Широкий вибір високоякісного одягу за помірними цінами допомогли Тетяні знайти відданих клієнтів. Тетяна виявила відповідальність та порядність в роботі з „Надією України”, сплативши усі позики без жодних прострочень. Тетяна просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент стильних пальт, плащів, легких курток та парок за оптовими цінами. Широкий асортимент стильного верхнього одягу легкого покрою за низькими цінами привабить багато жінок-покупців та сприятиме збільшенню обсягів продажу Тетяни.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a widow with four children all in primary school.  She is a primary school dropout and has not undertaken any formal training.  She started her business in 1996 in order to sustain her family.  She has specialized in selling onions.  She gets them directly from the farmers, and also sometimes from her farm.  She sells them both on a retail and wholesale basis.  With a loan from PEMCI, Imelda wishes to increase her stock and improve her status.  Through her business, she has been able to build herself a house, buy some goats to keep, and educate her children.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy winter clothing

loans.name: Valavala

texts.en: Valavala U. of Saletele Fagaloa, 52, specialises in handicraft production. She is the Centre Chief for Saletele Fagaloa. Valavala as seen in this photograph is adding the final touches to the “nifo oti”, a traditional weapon used for warfare. Valavala supplies a number of outlets in town with her handicrafts and this is one of the major sources of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her crafts and for home improvement

loans.name: Nghia Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nghia is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a brick layer, and he also can contribute to the income of the family. Mrs. Nghia’s main focus is on making rice cakes to sell. Her house is in a market area, so she can sell her goods in the front of her house. In addition, she also raises chickens and ducks for eggs and meat to sell. She wants to obtain a loan to support her business by buying more kitchenware to use for her rice cake production as well as purchasing more chickens to raise.

loans.use: Purchase kitchenware as well as chickens for raising

loans.name: Eugenia Nora

texts.es:
When we visit Nora she gives us some of her delicious plantains and mangos; products that she has worked hard to get hold of and sell, along with the help of her two young sons. Each and everyday she puts in a lot of effort to her agricultural work as she knows that this is the only way that she can help her two eldest sons at university and so that their family will have a future. It is with this motivation that Nora holds onto her optimism despite economic pressures; her husband's job as a driver does not always cover their costs. Nora feels a great affinity with her family and she really wants to grow more fruits by investing more in them, and this will only be possible with your kind help. It will be very useful and important in order for Nora to realize her and her family's dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Cuando visitamos a Nora, ella nos hizo degustar algunos de sus deliciosos mangos y plátanos productos que a costa de mucho esfuerzo y constancia logra producir junto a dos de sus hijitos, día a día pone mucho ánimo en sus labores agrícolas por que es consciente que de esta manera puede ayudar a sus dos hijos mayores quienes se encuentran lejos estudiando en la universidad con ánimos de encontrar un futuro prominente para su familia, es esta motivación la que inyecta en Nora deseos optimistas y a pesar de las carencias económicas que hay en casa sabe contribuye eficazmente en su aminoramiento, ya que el dinero que gana su esposo como chofer muchas veces no alcanza.Nora siente un profundo compromiso con su familia por lo cual desea alcanzar una mayor producción de frutas a través de una mayor inversión que sólo será posible con su gentil colaboración que será muy útil e importante para que Nora empiece a desarrollar sus sueños y los de su familia.

loans.use: An increase in capital for better production/Incremento de capital para una mayor producción

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim C., 51, is blind in one eye and is the mother of two children. She works raising pigs on her property, typically earning around $1 each day. Khim's husband has a job at a carpentry store and makes on average around $3 per day. Additionally, one of her children is employed by a private company and the other works as a construction foreman; together they earn around $180 each month.

Khim C. hopes to use this loan to dig a well and purchase a pump to supply water to her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pump

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
I am Khalida J. M., group leader. Nazira B., Khalida B., Shumaila B. and Tahira B. are my group members. We all have been together for about a year and have learned to be punctual, responsible and keen to enhance our families' financial outlook.

I have lived all my life in Chichawatni, a small city in Pakistan. I have six kids. My eldest son has completed tenth grade and now wants to start a betel nut shop. One of my daughters is married and one son is working at a factory. All of my other kids attend a local school. I am borrowing a loan for the first time from Asasah, a microfinance institution. This loan will help my son start a betel nut shop in a nearby market. He has promised to give me a decent portion of his income daily, which will help me save money for the repayment of your loan and cook better for my family.

Khalida B. stitches clothes and wants to start a sewing school where she will teach our community girls how to stitch. Nazira B.‘s husband is a tailor. Shumaila B.’s husband is a cobbler and wants to buy some material required for repairing shoes. Tahira B. is borrowing for her husband who wants to start a barber shop.

If you lend I assure you that we all are mutually responsible for each other’s loans.

loans.use: Start a betel nut shop

loans.name: Prot

texts.en: Mrs. Prot R., age 36, and her husband sells groceries, normally earning $15 of revenue a day. They have 3 children, all of whom are students. The couple will use this loan to purchase grocery products in bulk to save money and use the remainder to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk and renovate the house.

loans.name: Salelologa Tumupapa Centre - Group 4

texts.en:
June and Vaivasu are two women from Salelologa Tumupapa, Savaii, who are borrowing from SPBD for the first time. They have both undergone four weeks of training in business management and maintenance of a savings account, and have passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee.  Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and in repaying the loan on time. 

June F., 34, is married and has five children. Her husband owns a BBQ stall and grows crops. June will use her loan to help him purchase pesticides, a bush knife, rubber gloves and a knife sharpener. She expects to earn a weekly profit of 220 Tala (~US$108).    

Vaivasa S., 46, is married and has twelve children. She would like to purchase merchandise for her stall at the Salelologa market. Specifically, Vaivasa plans to buy a box of cups, a box of roll-on deodorant, and a box of boots.

loans.use: Purchase of a weed killer, pesticides, two bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.id:
This is the second loan that Muhammad D. is requesting. He paid off his first loan, and this time, Muhammad D. wants to request another loan because his business is growing. He wants to use this loan to buy more inventory to increase his overall business profit even more. At this time, Muhammad D. lives alone in Denpasar because his son and wife must live in Java with their extended families. His living space is clean, and Muhammad D. is a very resilient entrepreneur. His daily profit of $5 is not sufficient to meet his own needs and to be sent to his family in Java.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Pinjaman kali ini adalah pinjaman yang kedua bagi Muhammad D.. Pada periode sebelumnya sudah melunasi pinjamannya dan kali ini Muhammad D. ingin meminjam lagi karena usahanya cukup berkembang dan ingin menggunakannya untuk menambah modal usaha agar omset penjualannya lebih banyak lagi. Saat ini klien tinggal sendiri di Denpasar karena anak dan istrinya harus tinggal di Jawa bersama keluarga besarnya. Keadaan tempat tinggalnya cukup bersih dan klien sangat ulet dalam bekerja. Penghasilannya sebesar 50.000 perhari dirasanya belum cukup untuk kebutuhannya sendiri dan untuk dikirimkan ke keluarganya di Jawa.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella A. A. is 30 years old and married with two children. She lives in Benin City, where she makes a living sell food items.  She studied this business for 12 months before opening her store in 2001. She has been active in LAPO for the past five years, and has applied for a loan of $350 to buy more provisions to sell from her store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey L. is 32 years old and married without any children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells and repairs refrigerators and air conditioners. He learned this business in 5 years, and he started his own business in 2000. He has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years. He needs the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more parts for refrigerators and air conditioners for repairs and sale. He expresses his gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy and sell second-hand refrigerators and air conditioners

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong has borrowed 4 times from Mekong Plus and Kiva. She paid back her loans on time, did her job  well and made more profit. She is very happy with what she has done with the money she borrowed and now she would like to borrow again in order to continue and increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Amil

texts.en: This young man was born in 1983. He is married and has 2 children. Amil is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and he settled in Baku City. Four years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu L. is 25 years old and married with three children. She has four years of experience selling homemade bricks. She sells her bricks in her village and to the public five days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$250 USD).

Fetu has benefited from two previous successful SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) loans. SPBD loans are Fetu’s only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan. She will use her loan to improve her brick business by purchasing cement, sand, a wheel barrow, and shovels. Her husband will also help her to operate the business.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, a wheel barrow, and shovels for her brick business.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou A. est une femme dynamique de 30 ans qui achète et revend des articles scolaires dans un quartier populaire à Kpalimé au Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants tous à l’école. Avec cette chance de Kiva et ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, elle désire faire davantage de stock des fournitures et faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle apprécie cette opportunité qui lui permettra de participer plus à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager.
texts.en:
Akou A. is a dynamic woman of 30 who buys and re-sells school supplies in a populous neighborhood in Kpalimé in Togo. She is married and the mother of three children, all enrolled in school. With the good fortune to be able to post on Kiva for her third FECECAV loan, she wants to stock up on school supplies so as to meet the demand of her clientele. She is grateful for this opportunity which will permit her to support her family better with the profit that she will make.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of office and school supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Maréne Pêche Group

texts.fr: Thiaroye sur mer est un village traditionnel lébou (pêcheur)situé dans la région de Dakar. La principale activité est la pêche. Cependant pêcheurs de notre état, nous sommes confrontés à différentes difficultés pour mener à bien notre activité. On peut citer entre autre la rareté des poissons nous obligeant à aller de plus en plus loin des côtes pour pêcher ce qui nécessite un matériel de qualité. Ce même état de fait occasionne la pauvreté qui engendre l’émigration clandestine vidant le village de ses jeunes.L’objectif de ce prêt est de se doter une pirogue afin d’avoir un  matériel de travail plus adéquat et de d’offrir par la même occasion un emploi fixe aux jeunes pêcheurs du groupe. L’activité est la pêche artisanale et la vente des produits halieutiques.
texts.en:
Thiaroye by the Sea is a traditional lébou (fishing) village located in the region of Dakar. The main activity is fishing. However, being fishermen by trade, we are confronted with different difficulties to carry through our activity. The scarcity of fish, to name one among others, is forcing us to go further and further from the coasts to fish. This requires high quality equipment. This state of affair brings on poverty that in turn engenders illegal immigration, emptying our village of its youth. The goal of this loan is to equip ourselves with a dugout canoe in order to have better and more adequate equipment for our work. This by the same token would give permanent employment to the young fishermen of the group. The activity is fishing and the sale of products from the sea.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for fishing

loans.name: Benna Akiya Group

texts.en: Benna A. is 34 years old and a mother of one child who is aged 8. She supports two dependants aged 6 and 9 years respectively.  She has a business of selling beer and local brew, and has been in this business for over 10 years in Luwayo. Her loans have been helping her so much with her business and now this one will help her acquire raw materials like sim sim and bananas for her local brew business. Her biggest challenge is the seasonality of her business, but because of the experience she has, she has been able to retain her customers throughout the season.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making local brew like sim sim, bananas and others.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. started selling fish eight years ago in a village in a suburb of Nkawkaw, in the eastern region of Ghana, where she lives. Mary prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish and many customers buy from her stand. 

She is 52 years old and is married with four children who are currently in school. She wants to use the loan to buy more assorted fishes to increase her sales and income and to support her children’s education and business growth.

Mary buys her fish in Afram Plains directly from the fisher. This helps her to avoid the middlemen who sell at higher prices. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish, because the more she buys, the lower is the cost of each fish. 

Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Asetenapa,’ which means "good living." She hopes to receive GH¢500 to help her business progres and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 48 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ibrahim has been working as a car painter since 2003. He requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a compressor, painting materials and tools for his business. This is his third loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. Ibrahim is special in his work as he is energetic and he knows how to treat his clients. His clients include friends, neighbors and others. Ibrahim decided to go into this activity because of his experience in the business which he learned when was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business and his family situation.

loans.use: Ibrahim will use the loan to purchase a compressor, painting materials and tools for his business.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia,

texts.es:
Siendo aun muy joven, Ana Cecilia a sus veintitrés años es la dueña de un puesto en el mercado donde maneja un negocio de venta de lanas, ropa, y productos de aseo personal. Este negocio le pertenecía en un principio a su madrina quien se lo dejo a cargo hace cuatro años, puesto que iba a emprender otro negocio en un distrito diferente. 
Antes, Ana Cecilia se dedicaba a ofrecer servicio de tejidos para terceras personas. Ahora solo teje cuando es temporada alta en la venta de tejidos. 
Ana Cecilia además de microempresaria es madre de familia. Se encarga de cuidar el bienestar de su  esposo y de su única hija de cuatro años. Las ganancias de su negocio las destina para cubrir algunos gastos de su casa. 
Su meta es abrir una tienda en la avenida principal de su localidad donde pueda vender en mucha más cantidad.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is twenty-three years old, and despite her young age is the owner of a stall in the market, where she is in the business of selling wool, clothing, and personal hygiene products. This business initially belonged to her godmother, who left Ana Cecilia in charge four years ago when she went to launch another business in a different district. Previously, Ana Cecilia made her living by offering a weaving service for third parties. Now she only weaves during the high season for selling woolens. In addition to running a small business, Ana Cecilia is also a mother. She is in charge of looking after the well being of her husband and their four year-old daughter. The profits from her business go toward covering some of their household expenses. Ana Cecilia’s goal is to open a store on the main thoroughfare of her community, where she would be able to increase her sales significantly.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing school supplies for the school term, and purchasing wool

loans.name: Mayco

texts.es: Mayco tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos que son la luz de su vida y sus ganas de salir adelante. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hielo en barra, su principales cliente son los pescadores, quienes compran este tipo de hielo porque se derrite con lentitud. Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 8 años y le va muy bien, ya que cuenta con personas capacitadas para la fabricación de este hielo. Lo que le gusta su trabajo es que se relaciona con todo tipo de personas, además le es rentable porque produce 100 barras de hielo cada 15 horas y vende 100 barras al día. Más adelante, Mayco quiere mandar a arreglar su pequeña fábrica de hielo para que tenga una mejor vista. Y por ellos solicita este préstamo, además de incrementar su capital de inversión. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que son personas muy responsables y cuando alguien necesita apoyo todos colaboran.
texts.en:
Mayco is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children who are the light of his life and his reason for getting ahead. He produces and sells blocks of ice. His primary customers are the fishermen, who buy this type of ice because it melts slowly.

Mayco has been conducting this business for 8 years and it is very good to him, and now he is considered a qualified person in the production of this type of ice. What he likes about his job is that he gets to connect with all types of people. Additionally it is profitable because he produces 100 blocks of ice every 15 hours and sells 100 blocks a day. Eventually Mayco wants to fix up his small ice factory so that it has a nicer look. For those reasons he asks for this loan, additionally he wants to increase his investment in working capital. This is his second loan with MFP, and what he likes about working with a communal bank is that they are very responsible people and when someone needs support they all collaborate.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for his ice factory.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité de commerce de divers produits comme sucre, colas cigarette et thé. Elle pourra ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama D., 42, is married and the mother of 4 children. She hopes to use this loan to bolster her little business selling various products such as sugar, colas, cigarettes, and tea. She will thus be able to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of various items such as sugar, tea, cigarettes, et colas

loans.name: Olima

texts.ru: Олима и ее муж работают на Канибадамском асфальтном заводе. Хотя работа тяжелая и отнимает массу сил, оплачивается она по меркам региона очень хорошо. Рабочий день начинается рано утром и продолжается до вечера. Но чтобы покрыть все возрастающие расходы семьи Олиме и ее мужу приходится держать домашний скот. Это приносит хорошую прибыль. Олиме 42 года, имеет троих детей. Олима решила подать заявку на займ КИВА и планирует закупить корм для скота.
texts.en:
Olima and her husband work in the Kanibadam asphalt factory. The work day begins early in the morning and continues until evening. Still, to meet the growing needs of the family, Olima and her husband must keep domestic livestock. They bring a good profit. Olima is 42 years old and has three children. She decided to apply for a loan from Kiva to purchase livestock feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feed purchase

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a very ambitious self-made man. At 24 years old, he owns a shop selling mobile phones and accessories. He also provides repairs and services for his customers.

Adham is a very hardworking micro-entrepreneur. He needs a loan in the amount of $2,000 to procure more phones and accessories, hoping to attract more clients and make a better income to help his family.

loans.use: To procure more phones and accessories for sale

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Шодиева Мухайо женщина, которая имеет бизнес продажи детской одежды. Мухайо планирует получить кредит и съездить за товаром в Истаравшан и привезти ассортимент летнего товара. Она более четырёх лет кредитуется в Фонде и смогла расширить свой бизнес. Мухайо в числе добросовестных клиентов Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Muhayo S. is a woman who has a business selling children’s clothing. Muhayo plans to get a loan and to travel for products to Istaravshan and to bring back an assortment of summer products. She has been a borrower of our Fund for more than four years and was able to expand her business. Muhayo is one MicroInvest's honest clients.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua N. is fifty-five years old, is divorced, and has given birth to three children: one boy and two girls. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Akosua is a trader and has been in business for six years. She trades in food items such tilapia (a variety of fish), salted fish, etc., which she sells on a table at the market square. She buys her goods from Kumasi and wants a loan to buy fish and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fish and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es comerciante de ropa para niños, que comercializa en distintas ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto; el esposo trabaja de albañil y de esta manera reunen sus ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de la pareja. Viven en casa propia ubicada en la zona de German Buchs 1-1-2 Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (ropa para niños) por cantidad para  satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Paulina is a children's clothing retailer in the various markets in the city of El Alto. Her husband works as a bricklayer and both of their incomes help cover the living expenses for their three dependent children. They live in their own home located in the German Buchs 1-1-2 district of the city of El Alto.

Her loan will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise (children’s clothing) to meet the market demand. This is Paulina’s second loan with IMPRO. The excellent payment history she has demonstrated with our institution qualifies her to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's clothing for resale

loans.name: The

texts.en:
Mrs. The O., a 57-year-old resident of Pnouv village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. Her field is currently infertile, and she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in the field. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers.

Her husband, Mr. Duong Chheng, owns a rice miller and has been hired by the villagers. This couple has four children, two of whom stay at home to do housework while the others are attending the local school. Both Mrs. The O. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Enma Olimpia

texts.es:
la señora Enma Olimpia R. R. tiene 39 años de edad y vive en la colonia Villanueva, tiene un negocio de venta de cosmeticos y tambien vende ropa interior para dama y caballero.
las cuales los vende de manera ambulante en la colonia villanueva y en colonia aledañas a la misma, ella tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, con las ganancias le ayuda a su esposo para el manenimiento del hogar (alimantacion, educacion, vestimenta y gastos de salud). con el credito que esta solicitando ella piensa comprar mas cosmeticos con el fin de hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles mejor servicio y variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: compra de cosmeticos

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.
Fany es soltera, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Fany viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales que luego vende en los mercados. Además Fany trabaja como almacenera.
Fany necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Fany son terminar de construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fany is a member of the Dignidad Microfinance Institute.

Fany is a 35-year-old single mother with 3 children. She travels to the different open-air markets of the regions to purchase grains, then sells them at the markets. Additionally, she works at a warehouse.

Fanny needs a 1,200.00 PEN loan to invest in purchasing grains. She dreams of finishing construction of her house and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains

loans.name: Nabiha

texts.en: Nabiha is a 40-year-old mother of five, living with her husband and children. She has been working from home as a chef on demand for the past four years. Today, Nabiha is requesting to borrow $600 to purchase items that would help to improve her business and generate more profit.

loans.use: To purchase items

loans.name: Charie Lynn

texts.en: Charie Lynn L. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 20 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Charie Lynn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Charie Lynn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pigs to raise and sell. Charie Lynn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg T. operates a silver goods and craft business out of a rented stall in a large store in the city. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four daughters in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house. Her husband currently works as a decorator, her oldest daughters attend the local secondary school, and the youngest two haven't yet reached school age.

T. started her business in 2004 after previously working as a salesperson for two years. Her business has been quite successful and her earnings have allowed her to build a house for her family and extend their yard. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (~700 USD). She continues to work hard to grow her business and expand her customer base. She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to purchase more silver products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more silver products

loans.name: Mariejoy

texts.en:
“Achieving success in life is not that easy due to some instances you have to undergo,” said Mariejoy R.. She is married to Edgar R. who is engaged in their rice-farming business. Mariejoy and Edgar have been blessed with two children.

Mariejoy sells some snacks and at the same time she manages a hog-raising business to have an additional source of income. Mariejoy hopes that she will be able to maintain her businesses for them to generate a bigger income. Through her hog-raising and vending activity she is able to support the needs of her family.

Mariejoy hopes that she will be able to obtain a loan from Kiva lenders for the improvement and maintenance of her businesses. Thus, she is requesting a Php 5,000 loan. She hopes that she will be able to make her businesses more profitable.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Ala'

texts.en:
Ala' is a Palestinian young man who works as a police officer in the Palestinian National Authority. He earns a small monthly salary that doesn't meet his monthly expenses, especially since he just got married and owes some money to some of his friends and family.

Ala' decided to take a loan from FATEN to cover all his debts so that he can repay in accordance with his income.

Ala' appears in the photo at the FATEN office.

loans.use: To pay his debts

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion G.'s main source of income comes from providing manicure and pedicure services in her community. She is 46 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Ibung, Villa Verde, Nueva Vizcaya. Presentacion has been in her business for over three years now.

In 2009, Presentacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Presentacion is requesting a loan of 6000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide manicure/pedicure services

loans.name: Alma Del Carmen

texts.es: Alma del Carmen Z. de 53 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella vive únicamente junto a su esposo. Alma posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de uso personal en su casa. Dicho negocio es muy rentable ya que es el único que esta en las cercanías del lugar, de esta manera todas las personas acuden a comprar a el. Alma es una mujer la cual siempre ha luchado por seguir adelante y es por esto que solicita un préstamo por  medio del cual pueda surtir su negocio, ya que a pesar que las ganancias son muy buenas, estas no le permiten invertir más, debido a que los gastos del hogar son grandes. Ella espera mejorar sus ganancias al contar con más productos y esto lo puede alcanzar gracias al préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Alma del Carmen Z., 53 years old, resides in Ciudad Arce in the Department of La Libertad. She lives alone with her husband. Alma has a store that sells perishable goods and products for personal use in the home. Said business is very profitable, since it is the only one of its kind in the vicinity, so everyone comes to make their purchases there. Alma is a woman who has always fought to get ahead and for that reason she is requesting the loan, through which she'll be able to stock her store. Even though the profits are very good, they don't allow her to invest more in the store, due to her high household expenses. She hopes to improve her profits once she has more products, and she can achieve that thanks to the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable goods and products most needed

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sothear

texts.en: Mrs. Sothear M. is 24 years old. She is married to Mr. Lyhov Ping (at right) and they live in Prey Buy village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sothear M. is a farmer and her husband breeds ducks so that they can support their family.  These two businesses now face a problem, so Mrs. Sothear M. is seeking a loan from AMK to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and ducks to support these two businesses.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer and ducks.

loans.name: Bary Maramou Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bary Maramou 2 est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles monogames avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans la ville de Yanfolila qui relève de la 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des relations de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur ressource financière et de faire assez de stocks enfin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de céréales. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire et le précèdent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 5 tonnes de maïs et 2  tonnes de petit mil avec les fournisseurs des villages environnants de Yanfolila pour ensuite les revendre sur le marché de Yanfolila, en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 40 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé dans l’habillement et l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The group Bary Maramou 2 is composed of married women who average 26 years of age and four children each.  The women live in monogamous families with their children and husband, and they reside in the city of Yanfolila, which is part of the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  They know one another through business ties.  With the intention of increasing their financial resources and having enough inventory to satisfy customer needs, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, so as to do commerce in grains.  They are now on their second solidarity loan.  The preceding one was properly repaid. With this new loan, they intend to buy:  five tonnes of corn and two tonnes of petit mil (millet) from suppliers of villages surrounding Yanfolila.  The goods are then to be resold retail at the Yanfolila market in cash transactions.  Their customers are composed of men and women.  With this loan, the group members plan on obtaining a profit of 40,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to provide clothing and schooling for their children. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. is 25 years old.  He has been in the transportation business in Naivasha town since 2009.  His mode of transportation has been the bicycle famously known as the bodaboda. It is a cheaper mode of transportation than the motorcycle business.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He plans to open a retail shop where he will sell fertilizers with the advancement of this loan.

He hopes to grow his transport business in future, buying a pick-up van to be used to transport goods to the market.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to sell in retail as a secondary business.

loans.name: Austine

texts.en: Austine is 42 years old and married with six children. His wife sells groceries and drinks. He is from Delta State but lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Austine sells plywood and planks. He purchases the planks from timber dealers in bulk and sells in smaller quantities. He has been in this line of business for over two years now and he hopes to become a timber dealer and a major distributor in the future. He loves his business because of the one-on-one interaction he is able to have with his customers. He is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to boost his plywood business and purchase more planks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em P. is a 50-year-old married woman and mother. (She is not shown in the picture; her husband is shown instead.) Em P. has been earning a profit daily by selling a variety of vegetables in the market for years. By doing this, she has been able to help with the responsibilities for her family. Em P. has given birth to six children: four are married and live away and the other two are teenagers. Both of them are employed: her daughter is a clothes seller and her son works in construction. Her husband is a local farmer in the village. 

Recently her daughter has sold near all her clothes and she wants to acquire more inventory but she doesn’t have enough cash to resupply. Thus, Em P. is requesting a loan for her daughter to buy more clothes for her store.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for a daughter's store

loans.name: By God's Grace Group

texts.en: Esther T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called By God's Grace. She sells lapa (a wax-printed fabric popular in many parts of Africa) at the Red Light Market on the outskirts of Liberia's capital, Monrovia. Esther plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more lapa fabric for resale. Esther is 45 years old, married, and has seven children whose ages range from 8 to 24 years old. Her youngest children attend elementary school and the oldest have attained a senior high education. Esther herself was never able to go to school, as she says her parents refused to let her go. Esther has had her lapa fabric business for about 8 years now and she says she started small. Her business has grown but she says it's difficult because there are many other lapa sellers nearby, so competition is stiff. She says she tries to distinguish herself from her competitors by buying lapa fabric of high quality with fine designs. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Esther is the one holding the sign. Comfort D. is inset at lower left. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women. Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy more lapa (wax-printed fabric) for resale.

loans.name: Ama Dorcas

texts.en: Ama Dorcas B. went to a commercial school where she learned how to make various pastries using flour. She is married and lives with her three wonderful children.  Ama Dorcas makes pastries to sell at Jukwa. She has been in this business for about two years now. Her husband is a kente weaver. Ama Dorcas provides help to the husband by paying school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan she is going to receive to purchase more flour, sugar and other ingredients to prepare a variety of pastries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama Dorcas plans to save to buy a bigger oven.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Lucy Gakuru

texts.en:
Lucy Gakuru, aged 40, is married with two children and lives in Nairobi. She operates a retail shop in Nairobi city center which she has done for the last four years. Her customers are mainly people who work in the city center.

With this loan, Lucy plans to add stock of items like sugar, tealeaves, flour, salt and other food stuffs. She has never borrowed from any other financial institution.

In the future, Lucy hopes to have a wholesale business and move to a better location.

loans.use: To add stock to her retail shop, she wants to buy things like tea leaves, sugar, flour, salt etc

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria Concepción vive en la zona Primero de Mayo, ubicada en una zona populosa de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es casada y vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como artesano en la elaboración de zapatos. Y sus tres pequeños hijos.

Ella trabaja  como empleada en una fábrica la cual exporta chompas elaboradas en lana de primera calidad, en la cual se desempeña como supervisora. 

El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de materiales de construcción para continuar con las mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda, y así mejorar su calidad de vida. 
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, segundo vía Kiva, evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Maria Concepción lives in a crowded area of the city of El Alto called Primero de Mayo. She is married and lives in her own home with her husband, who is an artisanal shoe maker, and their three small children. She is employed at a factory that makes embroidered woolen sweaters of the finest quality; she is a supervisor. She will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies to improve her home’s infrastructure thus improving her quality of life. This is her 3rd loan with Impro, her second through Kiva. The evaluation conducted indicates that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operation capital

loans.name: Gani

texts.en:
R. Gani is a young man who likes to make his own way. He supports his family, which includes his wife, one child and his parents, by selling clothes. Little by little, thanks mostly to his commitment to hard work, his business has expanded. Gani wants to continue this growth, and to make that possible has applied for a loan of $3,000. He will use this money to buy more clothing to sell to his customers. With your help, Gani will be able to save money, expand his business and improve his family's life.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to his customers

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a Kiva borrower. He is a 27 year old married man from Lebanon who lives with his wife and their two young children. He has owned his own grocery store for the past year and is now asking to borrow $1,000 to buy a refrigerator and improve his store window to make it more attractive.

In his shop he sells candies, home cleaning products, dairy products, beverages, canned food, fruits and vegetables, and lots more. When BilA. opened his store a year ago, he had to face the competition in his region.  He decided on opening his shop because he wanted to have independent work.  His wife helps him in the store and sometimes she takes care of the store on her own when he has other commitments, so at least it’s a good compromise for both.

For the future, BilA. plans to keep on improving his store.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and improve his store window .

loans.name: Ysidora

texts.es: Ysidora,  D. 53 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive  en su casa propia junto a su esposo y 3 hijos. Hace más D. 10 años venD. gaseosas, cervezas, así como productos comestibles, D. esa manera ha logrado tener su bodega, situado en un pequeño espacio dentro D. su casa, siendo uno D. los negocios más concurridos D. su barrio. El trato que ofrece a sus clientes es muy calido y además esta muy atenta a las necesidades del cliente, lo cual la ha convertido en la preferida D. ellos. Disfruta mucho D. su trabajo, le da las rentas que necesita, por tal procura abastecerlo D. productos variados. Ahora cuenta con estantes y vitrinas eso la ayuda a la exhibición D. sus productos. Su gran anhelo es incrementar D. mercadería y ampliar su mercado. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente ya que sabe que le será muy fructífero para su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería y D. ese modo surtirlos con productos variados.
texts.en:
Ysidora, age 53, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. For over ten years she has been selling soft drinks, beer, and food products. This is the way she came to have her grocery store, which is located in a small space in her house. Her store is one of the most popular businesses in the neighborhood. She treats her customers very warmly, and she is very attentive to her customers’ needs. This has turned her business into the most preferred. She enjoys her work a lot, and it gives her the profits that she needs. She tries to stock it with varied products. She now has shelves and display cases, which help her show her products. Her great desire is to increase her merchandise and expand her market. This is her 15th loan with MFP. She pledges to make all of her payments punctually. She knows that it will be productive for her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy merchandise to stock her business with varied products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Dora Elia

texts.es: La Señora Dora Elia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella tiene varios empleos , en uno de ellos trabaja como empleada domestica desde hace muchos años, ella enviudo hace tiempo y se a dedicado solo a trabajar, Vive sola en la casa que le dejo su marido. La señora Dora requiere de este crédito para colocar una reja en la parte de afuera de la casa, ya que con la que cuenta es de madera y teme por su seguridad, ya que esta sola en la vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora Elia is a very hard working woman. She has several jobs. In one of them she works as a domestic employee; she’s been in this job for many years. She was widowed a long time ago and she has always worked. She lives alone in the house her husband left her. Dora needs this loan to install a metal fence around her house because the one she currently has is wood and she fears for her safety because she lives alone in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a metal fence.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga is married with two children. One year ago she decided to become self-employed and started her small business. She sells furniture by catalog. Her clients order the furniture from Olga and she manages production of the furniture at the factory and installation of the furniture at the client's home or office. High demand for this service as well as Olga's "goer and doer" character have helped to develop this business and gain more and more clients. Olga is requesting a loan of 6,500 UAH to increase her working capital in order to increase her monthly turnover and sales.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Kathegbeh Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, working in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Kathegbeh Group. They are women running small-scale businesses based in Makeni city. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 leones each to enable them to further improve the size and quality of their respective businesses. Pictured on the left is Hawa T., who is the leader of this group. Hawa was born in Makeni. She is age 37 and married to a teacher. The couple has three children: one in primary school and two in secondary school. Hawa sells dishes, rubber bowls, cloths, etc. She has had ten years of experience in the business. With her share of the loan, Hawa will buy stock in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy dishes, rubber bowls, cloths, etc.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng C., 52, is married with five children and lives in Kampong Chhnang province. She operates a grocery store, typically making US$3 each day. Her husband, Um Bonara, runs a moto-taxi and typically makes about US$2 each day.

Heng C. would like a loan of US$1,000 to increase her stock of grocery products.

loans.use: To increase her stock of grocery products

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en: Moussa is a 29 years old single man from Tyre He has been working at selling mobile phones and lines since January 2009. He also provides international and local calls with good prices per minute. A good number of foreigners, visit him and are steady weekly customers. His good reputation and the way he treats his customers are his supporting points.  Mousa is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy more mobile phones and accessories. Mousa has had no major obstacles since he started business. His friends are his clients and they support him all the time. Mousa is working on expanding his business as it is his main source of living.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maria Consuelo; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de queso, yogurt y leche, ella cría las vacas y saca leche y prepara con varios insumos el queso, yogurt y la leche y lo vende en el mercado de Huancaro que queda ubicado en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere tener un puesto para poder vender. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar el queso y el yogurt.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
María Consuelo, 52, is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE” communal bank located in Izcuchaca district, Anta province, Cusco department.

She is a single mother of 6 children.  She alternates her daily chores with cheese, milk and yoghurt sales.  She raises the cows that produce the milk which, with the addition of certain ingredients, she prepares the cheese, yoghurt and milk to sell in Huancaro Market located in Cusco.  She wants to have a sales stand.  She’s requesting funds to buy ingredients to prepare the cheese and the yoghurt. 

She uses this forum to thank all those who share his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cheese and yoghurt.

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal P. is a 48-year-old woman, married to Toun Lai, age 61, and he appears in the picture. This old couple lives with seven children and earns a living by planting various crops on their farmland. Pal P. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest when the potatoes are mature. The family typically generates revenue of about $3 each day. 

Pal P. said that she depends on the income from her daughter, who works in the garment industry. Her daughter always needs to hire a taxi to go to work because she has no vehicle. Pal P. wants to encourage her child, but her savings account is insufficient. To overcome the obstacle, Pal P. would like to request a loan for her daughter to purchase a used motorcycle for driving to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Edwin Oscar

texts.es: El Señor Edwin se dedica a la elaboración de pan, es el hermano mayor de la familia por eso el trabaja arduamente en su panadería para generar ingresos y ayudar a su Madre  también estudia arquitectura actualmente cursa el tercer año, su trabajo y sus estudios son su prioridad es muy responsable para con su familia ya que el vela por sus hermanos y su Mama, un joven muy responsable y trabajador.  El se costea sus estudios, el dinero del crédito es para la compra de harina y azúcar por cantidad, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Edwin works making bread.  He is the eldest brother in his family and for that reason he works hard in his bakery to make money and help his mother.  He also studies architecture.  He is currently in his third year.  His work and his studies are his priority.  He is very responsible as far as his family is concerned since he looks after his siblings and his mom.  He is a very responsible and hard-working young man.  He is paying for his studies himself.  The money from this loan will be used to buy flour and sugar in quantity.  He is very grateful to our institution for the support we provide.

loans.use: To buy flour and sugar in quantity

loans.name: Shamim Khadim Hussain's Group

texts.en:
Shamim K. H. is married and has four children, a daughter and three sons. Two of them study, while the other two stay at home. Shamim is a resident of Arifwala, a small city of the Punjab, Pakistan area and known for its agriculture industry. She lives in the district named 69-EB. She came here after her marriage.

She supports her family by selling milk. For this purpose, she has a buffalo at her home that gives her good quantity milk every day which helps her to fulfill the needs of her customers. Her husband runs a grocery store in the market where he offers his customers daily use items like milk, salt, sugar, etc. They both work hard to provide their children with the best living conditions.

Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her husband. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family. With the loan, Shamim’s husband will stock up his grocery store and improve his sales. Shamim is hopeful that such an investment will have a positive impact on her husband’s business and increase his income.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy stock for her husband's grocery store

loans.name: Rowaida

texts.en:
Rowaida is the mother of four daughters and two sons. Her husband is a construction worker. Rowaida earned her BA in Biology from the University of Jordan. She applied at many schools to teach but she has not had any luck being employed and with a big family she needs to find a job to help support her husband's taking care of the family.

Rowaida came to FATEN for a loan to equip a room in her house and to purchase items such as white-boards and chairs to start home-schooling students who need extra attention, as well as organizing private lessons.

Rowaida's brother in UAE currently helps her by sending her a small monthly allowance, which she will be able to replace once she starts teaching.

Rowaida appears in the picture above in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To equip a home-schooling room

loans.name: Enhzaya

texts.en: Enhzaya G. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two-year-old child in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own house and fenced area. Her daughter is in a local kindergarten and her husband helps her with the business. Enhzaya operates a used clothing retail business in her town. She started her business in 2000 selling a variety of secondhand products in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. She moved to her current town in 2010 and continued to operate her used product trading business. After many years of successful operation, she has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. Enhzaya is a hardworking and honest woman who fights to build a decent life for her family. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more used goods in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more used goods for resale.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.ar:
جعفر في عمر 23 سنة اعزب يعمل في استراحة لبيع البيتزا والعصير والمثلجات له في عمله 3 سنوات يحب عمله ويسعى دائما
الى تحسين وضعه وتطويره وخاصة انه في طور بناء مستقبله فهو طموح مثابر ومصر على تحسين مستواه المعيشي ما يميز جعفر انه
محب لعمله فهو دائما العمل مكد يتميز البصدق في المعاملة والنظافة يرد زيادة مدخوله وافتتاح مصلحة جديدة له ليزيد
من مدخوله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع خطوط تشريج وتلفونات مستعملة واكسسوار تلفونات حتى يزيد
من مدخوله فهو متطور جدا ويريد دائما الاستمرارية في العمل
texts.en: Jaafar, 23, is single. He has been selling pizza, juice and other refreshments at a rest area.  He likes his work and is keen to improve it. He wishes to build a bright future with his ambition and perseverance. He works hard to improve his living standard. Jaafar is an eager beaver. He is also honest and always complies with hygienic standards at work.  He wants to increase his income by starting up a new business. Jaafar wants a loan from Al Majmoua to buy used mobile phones, prepaid lines and accessories. He wishes to improve his financial conditions and is always looking to develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase used mobile phones, prepaid lines and accessories to resell

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina is married and lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fishing and a livestock business. Her husband, William Z., is 36 years old and works as a backhoe operator. They have four children who range in age from 8 to 10. Florina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of four previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has succeeded in slowly lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her last loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, and brought an improved life to her family. Now, for her fifth loan, she would like to borrow PHP 12,000 to buy new fishing equipment. This will allow her to increase her income further and continue to save for her children's education. Florina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy new fishing equipment

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while two are still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are clothing, rent and food for the family.

She has operated a fish selling business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Judith faces the major challenge of competition from other fish sellers in the market. She hopes to own a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for sale and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en:
For the past 14 years, Mastura has made a living selling accessories and office supplies in her store. She is married, has four children and is determined to provide a better living for family. She is hard working and kind, and is committed to her business and providing outstanding service. She is skilled at what she does and has a perfect credit history with IMON International. Mastura has applied for a loan for $1,500 to buy the equipment she needs to expand her business and improve the financial situation of her family.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.
