But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to expand a small store

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Madame Madeleine D. est une femme de 67 ans/ elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses 06 petits enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE2 depuis son inauguration le 04 juin 2002. 

Elle fait de l'élevage et embouche porcine. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plus de 15 ans. 

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter 10 pourceaux et 02 porcs adultes pour mener son activité d'élevage et d'embouche. 

Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille par l'achat de nourriture, de frais médicaux, de vêtements etc.
texts.en: Mrs. Madeleine D. is a 67-year old woman. She is married and the mother of seven. She also has six grandchildren in her care. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of Sainte Anne 2 since its inauguration on June 4, 2002. She raises and fattens pigs for resale. She is very experienced in this line of work as she has been doing it for over 15 years. Her loan will allow her to purchase 10 piglets and two grown  hogs to develop her livestock business. She contributes to the family budget by covering the costs of food, healthcare, clothing etc.

loans.use: to purchase 10 piglets and two grown hogs

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is a mother of seven children who are between the ages of 11 and 30 years old. She herself is 49 years old. She is a widow and she is very hardworking. She owns a store in which she sells foodstuffs and she has been selling foodstuffs for seven years.She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs for her business. With any extra profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
la sra. Ana Julia L. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en Ojo de Agua El Paraiso y se dedica a la venta de granos basicos como ser maíz y frijoles, dicha actividad la realiza en su casa de habitación y tiene mas de 3 años de realizarla, durante todo este tiempo ha logrado adquirir amplia experiencia en la administración de su negocio, de esto ha vivido en los últimos tres años y sus condiciones de vida han mejorado.
Doña Ana abastece a una gran cantidad de personas del lugar en donde vive, Ana al momento de comprar los granos basicos siempre escoge lo mejor y es por esto que tiene  muchos clientes, el producto que vende es de muy buena calidad.
Doña Ana esta casada y con su esposo lograron procrear 3 hijos, los que en la actualidad son totalmente independientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frijoles y maiz en granos.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Julia L. is 51 years old and lives in Ojo de Agua, El Paraiso and works selling basic grains like corn and beans. She has been doing this from her house for over three years, during which time she has gained a great amount of experience administering her business, which has allowed her to make a living in the last three years and improve her quality of life.

Ana is able to serve a lot of customers. When she is buying her basic grains, she always chooses the best quality, which is why she has so many clients. 

Ana is married and has 3 children with her husband, all of which are currently totally independent. She will use the loan to buy beans and corn.

loans.use: to buy beans and corn.

loans.name: Razelou

texts.en:
Razelou is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a hollow block business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy supplies for her hollow block-making business. Razelou has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from selling gasoline.

Razelou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of doing some house improvements in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for hollow block-making.

loans.name: Viterba

texts.es:
Viterba madre D. familia D. 45 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos, tiene casa propia  con servicio sólo D. luz, ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD. y a una hora del departamento D. Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Viterba se dedica a la venta D. salchipollo (comida a base hot dog, papas fritas y pollo frito), negocio que lo tiene en su domicilio y atienD. los fines D. semana solamente, ya que esos día es donD. más demanda tiene su producto y cuenta con su propio carrito sanguchero para la preparación del salchipollo.  Otra actividad a la que se dedica es a la crianza y venta D. aves D. corral.  En ambas labores que realiza tiene ingresos económcos que le permite solventar sus gastos D. su hogar.

A solicitado Viterba un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1200 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla  para comprar insumos para la preparación D. salchipollo y utensilios que se necesitan tanto para la elaboración como  para servir el producto, alimplementar su negocio con material nuevo, le va a permitir brindara su clientela un mejor servicio, por lo mismo podrá cobrar un mejor precio y así sus ganacias se incrementarán para tener un mejor nivel D. vida para ella  y su familia.   Viterba es muy conocida en el lugar donD. vive por la buena atención y el servicio  que brinda a sus clientes, es una persona alegre y muy trabajadora, siempre con las ganas D. seguir superandose.
texts.en:
Viterba is a 45 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in her own home which only has electricity.  It is located in TambogranD. district, one hour from Piura department.  The residents of these areas work in farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Viterba sells 'salchipollo' (which is maD. from hot dog, fries and fried chicken).  Her business is based in her home and she works in it on weekends only since this is when there is most demand for her product.  She has her own 'carrito sanguchero' (a special cart for frying food) where she prepares the 'salchipollo'.  Another business activity that Viterba is engaged in is raising and selling poultry.  She makes income from both jobs which allows her to cover her household expenses.

Viterba has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa through their seed fund.  She will use this money to buy supplies for preparing her 'salchipollo' and also utensils that she needs both for making and serving her product.  Stocking her business with new materials will allow her to proviD. her customers with a better service which means that she will be able to charge a better price and thereby increase her profits which will allow her and her family to enjoy a better standard of living.

Viterba is well known in her area for the good service and attention that she gives her customers.  She is a cheerful and very hard-working person who always wants to continue improving herself.

loans.use: to buy supplies and utensils for making 'salchipollo'

loans.name: Tey

texts.en:
Ty, 47, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Ty is a housewife and a farmer during rainy season while her husband is employed at a construction company, earning an income of USD 2 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. 

Ty is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice fields. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a mechanical plow to help plow the rice fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sugar cane squeezer machine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old and married with two children ages two and five. He runs a general merchandise store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Daniel has owned this business for seven years and sells clothes and cosmetic creams at his store. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothes and cosmetic creams. Daniel says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve the standard of living and the health of his family. In the future, he would like to supply stock within the city.

loans.use: To purchases more clothes and cosmetic creams

loans.name: Loreza

texts.en:
Loreza is 42 years old and married with two children.

Loreza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Loreza has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 24 years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Loreza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to begin a farming business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна замужем. У нее есть 11-летняя дочь Даша. Татьяна живет и работает в Орджоникидзе. Она торгует косметикой и парфюмерией, как мужской, так и женской, а также предоставляет разные товары по уходу за собой. У Татьяны просторный отдел в удобном, проходном месте большого торгового центра. Благодаря тому, что у нее достаточно места на прилавке, есть возможность выставить больше товара и тем самым привлечь больше потенциальных покупателей. 

Татьяна занимается торговлей уже 20 лет. На данный момент ее валовый доход составляет 11 000 гривен, а чистая прибыль – 4 000 гривен. Татьяна – молодая и предприимчивая женщина, у нее хорошо поставлен бизнес. Татьяна регулярно делает закупки нового товара для пополнения ассортимента. В этот раз Татьяна хотела бы закупить как косметические средства, так и парфюмерию на сумму в 15 000 гривен. Татьяна убеждена, что ее бизнес будет процветать и в будущем, потому что женщины не могут не ухаживать за собой и обязательно покупают себе хотя бы помаду раз в месяц. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Tatyana is married. She has an eleven-year-old daughter, Dasha. Tatyana lives and works in Ordzhonikidze. She sells cosmetics and perfumes, as well as  different products for personal care, for both men and women. Tatyana has a spacious shop in a convenient place in the main thoroughfare of a big shopping center. Due to the fact that she has enough space on the counter, she can display more goods and thus attract more potential buyers. 

Tatyana has been working in trade for twenty years. At the moment, her gross income is 11,000 hryvnias, and her net profit is 4,000 hryvnias. Tatyana is a young and enterprising woman. She is well placed business. Tatyana makes regular purchases of new goods to supplement her inventory. This time, Tatyana wants 15,000 hryvnia's worth of cosmetics and perfumes. Tatyana is convinced that her business will prosper in the future because women have to look after themselves and are sure to buy themselves lipstick at least once a month.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ma. Ester

texts.en:
Ma. Ester is engaged in pig breeding. She lives in a rural area of Ilagan province, Isabela. Ma. Ester is a hard-working mother.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 because she would like to increase the number of pigs and to establish a large farm.

With the loan’s help, Ma. Ester will develop her business and increase her income. Additional income will help Ma. Ester to ensure a sustainable future for her family. Ma. Ester lives together with her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Karen Pahola

texts.es: Karen Pahola tiene 24 años de edad, es comerciante, soltera y reside en el Barrio Belen en la ciudad de Juticalpa. Ella inició su actividad laboral desde hace 5 años vendiendo ropa nueva ya que una de sus hermanas se la enviaba del exterior del país. Actualmente se dedica a la venta ambulante de calzado y en su casa tiene una venta de helados, aprendió de este oficio observando el negocio de una de sus tías. Por los momentos su negocio no tiene nombre y trabaja sola, y cuando va a sus clases en la universidad su madre le ayuda a atender la venta de helados, y siempre lleva en un bolso grande varios tipos de calzado para ofrecerselos a sus amigos y compañeros. El prestamo que Karen solicita lo necesita para comprar sandalias, zapatos y helados de diversos sabores. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podra surtir su negocio y al mismo tiempo podra obtener ganancias que le permitiran seguir apoyando a sus padres con su sostenimiento y seguir pagando sus estudios. Su meta es terminar su carrera en Comercio Internancional e instalar una microempresa para tener una fuente de ingresos fija y contribuir con la generacion de empleos en la comunidad. Este es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y ha cancelado sus pagos puntualmente y gracias a eso ha seguido recibiendo el apoyo de los prestamos y ha podido mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
Karen Pahola is 24 years old and is a businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Belen neighborhood in the city of Juticalpa. She began her business 5 years ago, selling new clothing, since one of her sisters was sending it to her from outside the country. Now she sells footwear as an walking vendor, and in her home she sells ice cream. She learned this business by observing the business of one of her aunts. For the moment, her business has no name, and she works alone. When she goes to her classes at the university, her mother helps her tend to the ice cream sales. She always carries a big bag containing various types of footwear to offer to her friends and classmates.

Karen needs the loan she is applying for to buy sandals, shoes, and ice cream of various flavors. With the help of this loan, she will be able to stock her business and at the same time she will be able to obtain earnings that will permit her to continue helping her parents with their sustenance and continue paying for her studies. Her goal is to finish her courses in international commerce and set up a microbusiness to have a fixed source of income and generate jobs in the community . This is her second loan cycle in FAMA, and she has made her payments punctually. Thanks to this, she has continued receiving help through the loans and has been able to keep her business active.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes to sell, among other items.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Maria es de la ciudad de Santaní, ella es soltera, y tiene una hija. Ella tiene una pequeña despensa en la que trabaja todos los días. Comenta que todos los días su jornada empieza a tempranas horas. Va al mercado y compra los productos frescos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Dice que su negocio la ayuda mucho, pues es conocida en el barrio y tiene mucha clientela. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener alguna día un pequeño supermercado donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y de esa forma poder atraer a más personas. Comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por su hija, para darle un estilo de vida diferente al que ella tuvo, quiere darle una buena educación y una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is from Santaní, single, and has one daughter.  She has a small pantry where she works everyday.  Her day begins in the early hours everyday.  She goes to the market to buy fresh produce to offer her customers.

Her business helps her a lot, as it is known in the neighborhood and has many customers.  Her dream is to one day have a small supermarket where she can offer her customers more variety and in this way attract more people.  All the effort is for her daughter; to give her a better lifestyle than she herself had.  She wants to give her a good education and a decent and dignified life.

She requests the loan to buy food, beverages, dairy, baked goods, and more, which she will stock to meet her customers’ demand.  She thanks the Foundation for the opportunity, since getting a loan will help her business a lot.

loans.use: buy food, beverages, dairy, and baked goods.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, age 47, is a resident farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. She is married with three adult children. She has been farming for 15 years producing maize, potatoes, carrots, tea, and milk, and selling all to the local market. She also runs a retail business selling cereals in the local market. Grace notes poor market for products is the challenge in farming. 

Grace has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva partner, to help venture into poultry farming. She says the venture into poultry will spread her risk, improve her farming income, and enable her to meet basic needs with ease. She aspires to own rental houses in future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 55 years old, married and has 6 sons! He works in animal-husbandry. He has cattle and sheep. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Ali gets up early in the morning to feed his animals and all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle. 

He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Ali wants to buy young cattle and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan of 1500 AZN. Ali has already demonstrated himself to be a good client with a positive credit history with three previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cattle and 8 sheep

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El señor Ronald se dedica a la producción de embutidos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra insumos para elaborar chorizos barrilleros. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en anticrético (es un contrato legal entre el dueño de casa y el inquilino, por el cual el inquilino entrega por adelantado una suma de dinero por vivir en la casa del dueño por un tiempo determinado, bajo una cláusula que indica que al final del periodo, el dueño de casa se compromete a devolver el dinero al inquilino) en una casa, la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Villa Armonia de la ciudad de La Paz; Ronald es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la segunda vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Ronald makes sausages. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies for making barbecued chorizo. This business is the source of income by which he is able to cover his expenses. Ronald lives in a house through an “anticrético” (a legal contract between a homeowner and a tenant in which the tenant pays a determined lump sum to live in a house for a specified period and the homeowner promises to return the money at the end of the lease). He resides in the District of Villa Armonia in the city of La Paz. Ronald is single and has no children.

This is the second time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO and through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making barbecued chorizo sausages.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.es: Joselyn de 23 años de edad,  vive al sur Occidente de la ciudad y en su vivienda tiene un punto comercial,  donde vende variedades de productos como fantasías, artículos de piñatería, para bebé, accesorios etc. Inicialmente vendía solamente cosméticos mediante revistas especializadas; con ello le empezó a ir muy bien, hasta que logró ampliar su oferta e involucrar nuevas líneas de productos, como ahora lo hace, pues además de vender mediante catálogos, compra directamente, surte su punto comercial y maneja las líneas de contado y a crédito. Joselyn empezó su emprendimiento hace 2 años, orientada por su madre, quien por su experiencia de comerciante logró encaminarla, para que obtuviera sus propios ingresos y no dependiera de un empleo. Al principio le regaló una vitrina y le dio productos para que los vendiera.  En la actualidad  Joselyn se esmera por vender a sus clientes productos con la calidad que sus clientes ameritan; valor en el   cual trabaja para diferenciarse de su competencia y por eso da de sí misma lo mejor, para conservarlos y convertirlos en sus fieles compradores.  Actualmente está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; con su credikiva comprará mercancía variada alusiva a la temporada navideña, preparándose para responder como ella sabe a este final de año en el que espera tener la mejor venta.
texts.en:
Joselyn, age 23, lives to the southwest of the city and has a store in her home where she sells a variety of goods such as costume jewelry, piñatas, baby products, accessories, and other items. She started out only selling cosmetics through specialized magazines. When she began doing well, Joselyn expanded her product lines and now sells through catalogs in addition to making direct purchases to restock her store. She sells her products for cash or on credit.

Joselyn started this venture two years ago and received guidance from her mother. She relied on her experience as a traveling merchant so that she could generate her own income and not have to depend on a job. At first, her mother gave her a display cabinet and some products that she could sell. Today Joselyn strives to sell quality products that her customers deserve. She places great value in her work in order to differentiate herself from the competition, so she does her very best to hold on to her customers and turn them into loyal buyers.

Joselyn is currently applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the Kiva funds to buy a variety of merchandise for the upcoming Christmas season. Joselyn wants to prepare herself for the year-end season because she expects to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, age 22, is a hard-working man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lives in a semi-permanent house with five of his family members. He is currently operating a motorcycle business, a venture he started three years ago, before which he was working for other people. He faces a challenge in the rainy season, during which the roads are slippery. 

Christopher's business dream is to acquire more motorcycles. Christopher needs the loan in order to buy a motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transportation business

loans.name: Izomat

texts.ru: Изомат 46 лет, она замужем и мать 5 детей. Более 11 лет она занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. В бизнесе ей помогает дочка. Она начала свой бизнес с купли продажи мелочевки, а потом постепенно перешла на продажу продуктов питания. Особенности бизнеса в том, что лавка находится в центре города в многолюдном месте. С целью получения прибыли, она хочет расширить ассортимент продуктов питания, чтобы осуществить все свои планы и желания, она запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони.
texts.en: Izomat is 46 years old, married with five children. She has been in grocery sales for over 11 years. Her daughter helps her. She started her business with the purchase and sale of consumer goods, and then gradually moved to the sale of food. Her shop is located in a crowded, downtown area. She wants to expand her product line in order to increase her profit and accomplish her goals. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni.

loans.use: Purchase goods to expand product line

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora lleva por nombre el grupo integrado por 15 mujeres de la ciudad de  Itá, quienes se unieron con el propósito de ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo en conjunto. Ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa d mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y cuentan que les gustaría llegar al máximo nivel del programa. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Alberta, quien nos comenta que con esfuerzo y mucho trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, gracias a sus ventas. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, puesto que siempre tiene mucha variedad. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual abastecerse y tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group, “Maria Auxiliadora” is called that because its 15 members, from the city of Itá, wanted to get together so that they could help their families by working together.  They are in their first cycle of the “Entrepreneurial Women” program of the “Fundación Paraguaya” and they say that they want to reach the maximum level of the program.

Alberta is one of the members who tells us that she has managed to get her family ahead through her sales, and through much hard work and effort.  She sells all kinds of clothing and she is doing well because she always has a great variety.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy summer clothing so that she can stock up and have a greater variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to stock up on summer clothing.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson lives in Likoni, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He began selling passion fruits five years ago. He started by planting passion fruit vines, and a year later, the fruit was ready for sale.

Benson is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy posts and wires and to perform maintenance. His future ambition is to cultivate two acres of passion fruit vines, which would enable him to purchase a pickup truck to transport the produce. 

The current challenges Benson faces are the high cost of transportation, theft of his produce, and seasonal weather, which at times does not support good production. He plans to save the income obtained from this loan to purchase a pickup.

loans.use: to buy posts and wires and to perform maintenance.

loans.name: Nguyen's Group

texts.en:
Nguyen is 27-years-old with 2 children who are small. Being  a farmer, she focuses on growing rice. To have more income, she works as a butcher in a local market. Her business started 7 years ago. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 5,152,000  Viet nam dong from SEDA ‘s credit program to buy  fresh pork for selling

Hang is 42-years-old. She runs a business of selling snails for some small restaurants. She wants to have a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to  expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh pork for selling.

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad, administra una tienda de productos domésticos, la tiene instalada en su propia casa y la administra desde hace varios años, su horario es todo el día atender a sus clientes.
Actualmente María está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como huevos, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, papel higiénico, esta inversión será de mucha importancia para ella ya que estará surtiendo el negocio para atraer a más clientes para que consuman de sus productos.
La aspiración de ella es que sus hijos tengan todo el apoyo necesario para que puedan desarrollarse en su vida.
texts.en:
María is the single mother of two children, ages 17 and 12.  She runs a store of household products installed in her own home that she has run for several years.  Her schedule to wait on customers is all day.

Currently María is requesting a loan to buy products such as eggs, sugar, rice, beans, oil, and toilet paper.  This investment will be of great importance to her since she will be supplying the business to attract more customers to buy her products.

Her goal is for her children to have the necessary support to be able to develop in their lives.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, rice, beans, oil, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,al socia cria cuyes y gallinas y tambien tiene una chacra donde cultiva maiz y papa,los productos y animales los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Cachimayo,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales y sus productos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes,gallinas y tambien para comprar fertilizantes para su chacra.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Josefa continues to dedicate herself to the business of raising animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens and also she has a ranch where she grows corn and potatoes. She sells the produce and animals in different fairs that exist in the district of Chachimayo. Her dream is to have a location where she can sell the animals and her produce. She solicits the loan to be able to buy guinea pigs, chickens and also to buy fertilizers for her ranch. She is happy because of the loan and she promises to comply with the payments for her share.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, chickens and also to buy fertilizers for her ranch.

loans.name: José Rigoberto

texts.es: José Rigoberto de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia, él se dedica a la venta de tostadas de plátano, yuca, chicharra que él mismo prepara y al cultivo de maíz, las tostadas las vende de forma ambulante en calles y buses del transporte público, ésto es cuando no esta ocupado en las labores agrícolas, es un hombre que permanece ocupado con la intención de brindar una calidad de vida mejor a su familia. Tiene  varios años con el  negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas y las mejores ventas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios pero sobre todo el excelente servicio; José es un hombre entregado a su labor, dispuesto a cumplir sus metas, quiere aumentar la cosecha y hacer crecer el negocio pero no posee del capital suficiente para la inversión de los insumos por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herbicida, plátanos y yuca para las tostadas. José Rigoberto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar el financiamiento en el periodo establecido

loans.use: semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herbicida, yuca y plátano

loans.name: Ratih

texts.en:
Ratih is a nice girl, and she is a student in Progresia Vocational High school in Cianjur.
besides her activity as a student, sometimes she always help her mother for selling vegetables in traditional market. but she confused when she can't for pay school costs. komida comes for help her and by dint of komida she can continues the school.

loans.use: To pay for Monthly school costs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Jane. She is a passionate farmer from Chuka, Kenya. For the last three years, she has been involved in mixed farming, planting various varieties of food crops and keeping dairy cows. The mother of three enjoys cultivating land. However, the Chuka area experiences frequent dry spells annually. Lack of rain in this area usually leads to poor harvests due to crop failures. Dairy farmers are also affected, too, as they realize a drop in milk production. Jane is determine to resolve this.

Jane is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 for purchasing a water tank. This tank will store water that will be used for both irrigation and for animal consumption. She makes a living selling milk and crops produced from her farm. She also engages in other personal businesses outside agriculture for extra income to pay school fees for her children. 

With your loan, Jane will greatly benefit from the stored water during the dry spells. This will keep her farm green and mitigate the annual crop losses as a result. Her cows, too, will remain hydrated for high milk production.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Risper, 24 years of age and a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Chebiemit, a remote village in Kapsowar. She is happily married and is blessed with an adorable family. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years, and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Kapsowar area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. 

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy snacks ingredients for her snack making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of 2 sufurias (cooking pots) with lids, 1 big kettle, 1 pressure lamp, 2 big jikos (local cooking stoves), 2 trays and 2 thermos flasks

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana is an IDP (displaced person) from the occupied Shusha district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. Married, Tarana has one child. She started her business in 1993 from zero. She has already taken one loan from Normicro Baku branch. Her first loan amount was US$ 350. This time, Tarana is requesting a loan of $500. She wants to purchase more goods so that she can retain her clientele because there is a lot of competition in the area where she runs her business.

loans.use: To increase her variety of goods and better satisfy her customers

texts.id:
M. (51) is a mother of 3 children, 2 boys and 1 girl. After her husband left her 2 years ago, M. supports her family by starting a rice milling business, with funds that her husband left her. Currently M. earns about $10-15 net profit per day from her quite successful business. She may even earn more profit during the Eid-ul Fitr holiday season. Currently M. needs $125 loan to repair and maintain her milling machine so she can serve more customer.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

M. (51) merupakan Ibu dari 3 anak, 2 diantaranya laki-laki dan 1 perempuan, setelah ditinggal suaminya 2 tahun lalu, M. menghidupi keluarganya dengan membuka Penggilingan Beras, dengan modal peninggalan suaminya, M. berhasil menjalankan usahanya sampai sekarang dengan pendapatan bersih per harinya $ 10 - $ 50. bahkan kalau menjelang hari raya Idul Fitri pendapatannya meningkat, Saat ini M. membutuhkan pinjaman sebesar $ 125.untuk melakukan pemeliharaan dan perbaikan mesin gilingnya sehingga dapat melayani pelanggan lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use:
$ 100 will be used for Maintenance
$ 25 will be used for buy more goods

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Ever since she started her family, Doña Leonor was always focused on her home and the well-being of her four adolescent children. With the immense desire that all mothers have to improve their household’s quality of life, she began working in a small grocery store that she set up in the vicinity of her home. But due to constant conflicts with her husband, she had to close it and focus exclusively on caring for the children at home. Now after much effort and sacrifice, she has been able to save a little money to invest in building a mobile stand for grocery sales. This enterprising mother’s dream is to own a secure sales booth in the Las Mercedes plaza in the city of Juliaca and increase the amount of merchandise so that her earnings can send her four children to college. To make her plans a reality she is requesting a $400 loan that she will invest in acquiring more products to augment the stock for her shop. She is committed to repaying the loan in no more than seven months. Your important help will make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Leonor desD. que formó su familia siempre fue muy hogareña y preocupada por el bienestar D. sus cuatro hijos adolescentes y con el inmenso deseo que toda madre posee por incrementar el nivel D. vida D. los miembros D. su hogar inició su responsable labor trabajando en una pequeña bodeguita que instaló en las inmediaciones D. su hogar; pero por conflictos muy constantes con su esposo tuvo que cerrarla y sólo hacerse cargo D. la atención a sus hijos en casa; ahora después D. mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido ahorrar un mediano capital para invertirlo en la constitución D. un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes en forma ambulatoria.El deseo D. esta emprendedora madre es poseer un puesto seguro D. venta en la plaza Las Mercedes D. la ciudad D. Juliaca y aumentar la cantidad D. su mercadería para que con las ganancias que obtenga pueda ofrecerles estudios universitarios a sus cuatro hijos.Para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo D. 400 dólares dinero que invertirá en adquirir más productos para aumentar el stock D. su mercadería, comprometiéndose a retornar el préstamo en un lapso no mayor a siete meses.“Vuestra importante ayuda posibilitará la cristalización D. estos anhelos”

loans.use: Increase of sales and products to acquire a small sales stand in the main plaza of the city.

loans.name: Mujeres Jereh - Group 1

texts.en:
Manuela lives with her husband and three children in the neighborhood of La Pina, in the outskirts of Santo Domingo. Over the past several years she has started a business for herself where she makes and sells cloth curtains (which often serve as makeshift doors in homes throughout the Dominican Republic), sheets, and comforters. She is asking for her first loan so that she can buy better quality fabric and a few new patterns of fabrics from which she will make her sheets, curtains and comforters.

She says her goal is to improve her business step-by-step and to watch it continue to grow “more and more as each day passes.” Her dream is to see her children become educated professionals and to live a life of healthy decisions and love. Personally, she says she strives to always be a good, honest, and hardworking person.

Manuela wants to thank everyone who is supporting her with this loan, and she says that “if at any time you need anything, she is your friend, and her doors are open.”

NOTE: This is a group loan. Manuela is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of the loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To buy better quality fabric and a few new patterns of fabrics.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and has a grown son. She lives in the Zaporozhye region of Ukraine and runs a small business selling women’s outer-wear in several markets.

Yelena owns four vending facilities in the towns of Volodarskoye, Kamish-Zorya, Chernigovka and Pology. Yelena has been in this trade for 10 years. Her inventory is characterized by uniqueness and high quality. She tries to choose good quality merchandise which will always be in demand and sell well.

Yelena is requesting a loan of $200 to increase her stock of jackets, sheepskin coats, sweaters and hats for the winter season. She believes her conscientious efforts and perseverant work will help her expand her trade even more and boost her sales. Yelena is planning to use a portion of her profits to support her son’s family financially. She is ready to invest in her family's well-being and is planning to work hard to ensure a stable future for them.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Kireka A1(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Beatrice M.. She is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of shoes. Ms. M. is 30 years old and single. She has 2 children aged 10 and 16 and her children go to school. Each week, M. makes approximately UGX 60000 (~ $35 USD) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Ms. M. has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 400000 (~ $233 USD) to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

Ms. M. is joined in her small group by Joan Nakigudde, Grace M., Florence N., and Beatrirce Z.. Joan Nakigudde has a business selling clothes and wants to add to her clothing business. Grace M. operates a gift shop and wants a loan to add to her stock. Florence N. operates a business sellng shoes and wants to expand her business. Beatrirce Z. has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: To increase the stock of shoes

loans.name: Phoeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeung C., 59, lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River. She has been married to Oeun PICH since 1979 and has three sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home; two of her sons study in local schools and one of her daughters weaves silk at home.

Phoeung learned to weave and started silk production when she was eighteen years old. She sells her finish product on the island. Her husband has done farming and raised cows since 1965.

She is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $200 to buy silk material for weaving.

loans.use: purchasing silk material for weaving

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a 38 year old woman who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs.

Saida does embroidery work and is also a nurse. This is the second time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs a loan to buy material to sustain and develop her embroidery business.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Franklina

texts.en:
Franklina B. sells slippers and plastic bags. She is married and has 4 children. Business is doing very well, and she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for $825 as additional capital to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.use: The loan will be used for additional capital to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Seydina Oumar

texts.fr:
Seydina is a young businessman who manages a shop in the Medina Falls neighborhood of Thies. He is single and lives with his parents. With this loan, he would like to purchase products to increase his supplies and better meet the demand of his main customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Seydina est jeune commerçant qui gère une boutique au quartier Medina Falls de THIES. Il est célibataire et vit chez ses parents. Avec ce pret il veut acheter des marchandises pour renforcer ses stocks et satisfaire davantage la demande de ses principaux clients.

loans.use: Purchase of products for his store

loans.name: Kudiratu

texts.en: Kudiratu O. is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City with her husband and children. Kudiratu has been in this business of selling provisions and drinks since 1978. She learned this business for a year from her mother. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. Kudiratu is a LAPO client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Mavjuda M. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has secondary education and stays at home. She had been growing rice for the past 3 years. This allows her not to purchase rice, which is usually expensive, on a market. She mainly uses her crops for her own family and sells any extras. At this point in time, Mavjuda would like to purchase quality seeds for the next sowing. After consulting with her family, she decided to take out a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудова Мавжуда Эргашевна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 31 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее ,домохозяйка. Клиентка более 3 лет занимается посевом риса. Это позвляет ей не покупать на рынке рис,который стоит дорого, Свой урожай она использует для своих нужд , а лишнее реализует на рынке. В данный момент Мавжуда хочет закупить качественные семена для повторного посева. Посоветовавшись с близкими она решила взять кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase quality seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  clothes, loincloths and other products

loans.name: Mrs. Much Non's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Much N. is the leader of this group of four. They now live in O'Rum Chek Village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Much N. is a basket maker who can earn a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bu Sao, owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. Unfortunately, Mr. Bu Sao now faces a small problem because his rice field is infertile, which affects his crop. To solve this problem, his wife decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to enrich the field in order to make the crop more productive. Mrs. Much N. is 45 years old and the mother three children. One of the children is a farmer, while the others are attending the local school. 

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, and they are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK (Kiva’s Field Partner) has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for the field in order to make the crop more productive

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen Baji is the wife of M. R. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 15 years. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nasreen Baji’s husband has a grocery shop near the community. People of her community come to him and buys groceries. His monthly income is $120. Nasreen Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zafran Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Noor Baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell. Irshad Baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, sketches and beads) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en el colegio D. la ciudad. Cuando era niña se dedicaba a pastar el ganado D. sus padres, y desD. que se casó cambió su actividad para dedicarse mayormente a su casa; su esposo es profesor. Pero ahora que sus hijos ya crecieron ella no pueD. estar sin realizar alguna actividad, por ello empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura, actividad que le agrada mucho y les es muy rentable, sobre todo en tiempos D. cosecha, donD. negocia sus productos. Le es dificultoso en las épocas D. siembra y cosecha, ya que ella solo no se abastece, y a veces no encuentra peones que le ayuden. Le tiene mucha gratitud a su IMF, porque dice que  le han permitido tener independencia económica. Con este, es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y durante todo este tiempo demostró puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero va comprar abono D. corral para que pueda sembrar, ya que tiene semilla guardada y quiere hacerla producir.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old, is married and has two children who are studying in the high school in the city. When she was a child she worked putting her parents' cattle out to pasture and since she married she changed her activity to work primarily at home; her husband is a professor. But now that her children are already grown she cannot be without carrying out some activity which is why she started to work in agriculture, which she likes very much and is very profitable, above all in harvest times when she negotiates her products. It is difficult for her in periods of planting and harvesting as she cannot do it all herself and sometimes she does not find laborers to help her. She is very grateful for her IMF, because she says it has allowed her to have economic independence. With this, itis her seventh loan with MFP, and during all of this time she demonstrated punctuality with her payments. With this money she will buy animal manure to help her grow, as she has seed stored and wants to make it produce.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Vay

texts.en: Mrs. Vay Y. is 44 years old and a rice farmer who lives in Koh Village. She has been farming since 1980 and is married with three children; one is employed and the other helps with the family's farm. Her husband is a construction worker and being mobile is one of the requirements of his job. Rice farming is the main source of income for the family and she is responsibility of caring for the farm. She is requesting a loan to purchase three oxen to use on the farm.

loans.use: Purchase three oxen for use on the farm

loans.name: Mr. Leay Soun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people living in Krang Thmei village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Leay S. is the 66- year-old village bank president. He and his wife, Mrs. Vang Mao, are farmers who own 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest rice. In order to solve this problem, Mr. Leay S. decided to request a loan for this purpose. He is the father of two children, one of whom is a laborer in the hospital while the other is employed in a garment factory.  

One member of this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To request a loan to hire laborers to harvest rice.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Mactar

texts.fr: agé de 31 ans ,mouhamadou a apres les études primaires appris le metier de tailleur pour avoir une qualification professionnelle.Depuis 5 ans il gere son propre  atelier avec trois modestes machines à coudre qui ne luipermet plus de repondre aux exigences de la clientelle . ansi il sollicite un pret pour l"acquisition d"une  nouvelle machine plus performante.
texts.en:
Following his primary schooling, 31 years old Mouhamadou, learned to be a tailor in order to have a professional qualification. For the last 5 years he has managed is own workshop with three basic sewing machines that no longer allow him to meet the demand of his customers. Thus, he is soliciting a loan to acquire a new, more efficient sewing machine.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina O. is 39 years old. She is married and has three children - one daughter and two sons. One of her sons is currently in the senior high school and the other is in the junior high school. Her daughter is in primary school. Faustina’s husband is a poultry farmer. Faustina also works to make some income to support her family. She and her family live in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Faustina sells poultry feed. She procures the feed from big poultry feed dealers in Tema in the Greater Accra Region of Ghana. She sells it to poultry farmers in her community. Faustina has a storehouse where she stores and sells her goods. She has been in business for ten years. Faustina wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure poultry feed in bulk.

loans.use: To procure poultry feed

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: A sus 35 años, Roxana ha sabido ganarse la vida por sí sola, tiene una casa propia, la cual está hecha de material noble, se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Cocinando sus ricas salchipapas (platillo hecho a base de salchichas en rodajas y papas fritas) y hamburguesas, Roxana pasa sus días. Disfruta mucho de cocinar y lo hace con mucha habilidad, su comida es comprada por muchos clientes, los cuales acaban con la deliciosa comida en unos segundos. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener una restaurante, donde pueda vender todo el día y con mayor tranquilidad la comida que prepara, porque actualmente solo lo hace por las noches, aunque tiene 3 años de experiencia en esta actividad, todavía le sigue siendo difícil atender a todos los clientes que tiene, con todo el esfuerzo que realiza espera poder salir adelante y mejorar su vida. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con trescientos nuevos soles que solicita planea comprar más ingredientes para preparar sus ricos platillos, con el resto del dinero comprará mesas y sillas para amoblar el restaurante que tanto desea tener.
texts.en:
At 35 years old, Roxana has known how to earn her way through life for herself; she has her own home, which is well-built, and she works hard to move forward and improve her quality of life. She works each day cooking delicious salchipapas (a dish made from sliced hot dogs and french fries) and hamburgers. She enjoys her job and she is a very skilled cook. She has many customers that purchase her food and who often buy seconds. In the future, she hopes to open a restaurant where she can sell the food she prepares all day and with greater ease as she currently only sells at night. Though she has run her business for 3 years, it is still difficult for her to attend to all her customers; yet she hopes to put forth greater effort to move forward and improve her life. This is her 5th loan from Prisma Microfinance and she is saving to pay her installments on time, since she hopes to avoid causing problems for the other members of her village bank where she feels very content. With the money she is requesting, she plans to buy ingredients to prepare her dishes; with the rest of the money she will buy tables and chairs to furnish the restaurant that she wishes to start.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Savina

texts.en:
Mrs. Savina P. ventured into the “sari-sari” (general store) business in order to help her husband. She is married and lives in Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 5 children. Her husband is a laborer.

Mrs. P. got additional working capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in November, 2008. She is a Member in Good Standing of the Cooperative. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC because she has been able to continue her business and send her children to school. Today, she is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional goods for her store. In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Бахром уже несколько лет в сфере бизнеса. Раньше он занимался куплей продажей сухофруктов. Постепенно накопив денег он открыл свою мини столовую (так как он имеет также профессию повара), которая расположена в центральном рынке. Здесь у него имеются постоянные клиенты, которые торгуют на рынке. Кроме блюд, которые предлагаются у него в столовой, он также привозит различные кондитерские изделия: булочки, торты, пирожные, пряники и тп. Многие его клиенты кроме горячих блюд заказывают в качестве десерта эти кондитерские изделия. 
Бахрому исполнилось 38 лет, женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена его сидит дома и воспитывает ребенка. Дополнительно к своему основному бизнесу Бахром занимается откормом скота и в этом ему помогает его жена. Для этой цели год назад Бахром стал кредитоваться  МикроИнвест и показал себя ответственным и пунктуальным клиентом. Сейчас он подал заявку на займ и собирается приобрести одного бычка и немного корма для него.
texts.en:
Bahrom has been working in the business sphere for several years. He used to sell dried fruit but, having gradually saved money, he opened a mini-canteen, located at the central market. Bahrom is also a cook by training. He has regular customers among the local vendors. In addition to the dishes offered in his canteen, Bahrom sells pastry: buns, cakes, ginger cookies, etc. Many of his clients, in addition to hot dishes, order dessert. Bahrom is 38 years old and is married with one child. His wife is a stay-at-home mom. Besides his main business, with the help of his wife Bahrom raises cattle. A year ago Bahrom got a Microinvest loan for this purpose, and got a reputation of a responsible and punctual client. He has recently submitted an application for another loan, which he is going to use for the purchase of a bull calf and fodder.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf and fodder

loans.name: Nak Bakat Group

texts.en:
Nak Bakat is the group leader of Nak Bakat group. There are three members in this group and they together want to take a loan of 42,000 Afghani for the term of 10 months for the progress of their businesses.

Nak Bakat wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Amana wants to take a loan for her leather-working business.

Raza Gul wants to take a loan for her mobile-selling-cart business.

So they are very happy with this process of loans that can support all people.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.en: Ismaila K. is 43 years old and married with five children. He makes and sells baking pans of various sizes and shapes. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more materials in order to make more baking pans. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more baking pans

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Gloria is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gloria runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 48 años, es soltera, vive con su hijo Arnold de 14 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles en la tienda que instaló en su casa, donde ofrece gran cantidad y variedad de productos para la clientela asidua a su tienda. Maria se distrae mucho con su trabajo, ya que mientras vende su mercadería conversa con sus clientes, siendo una persona muy carismática. Pero no todo es fácil, ya que a veces le resulta muy cansado tener que permanecer durante todo el día atendiendo, pues abre desde las 6 de la mañana y se queda aproximadamente hasta las 9 de la noche porque siempre tiene clientes en ese horario. Para un futuro cercano, a Maria le gustaría implementar su tienda colocando un mostrador con otros artículos no comestibles, teniendo así un mini bazar. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre ha sido muy responsable con todos sus pagos al igual que sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita empezará a comprar aquellos productos no comestibles para ir implementando su bazar y sus clientes no tendrán que ir más lejos de su vecindario en busca de estos artículos.
texts.en:
48-year old Maria is single and lives with her 14-year old son Arnold in their own home. For the last three years she has earned her living by selling groceries from the store located in her house. She offers a wide variety of products to her many regular customers. Maria enjoys her work very much as while she sells her merchandise, she chats to the customers—she is a very charismatic person. But it isn’t an easy life. Sometimes she gets very tired as she has to work the whole day long serving customers; she opens up at 6am and remains in the store until up to 9 pm at night as there are often customers at that time. In the near future, Maria would like to equip her store with a counter displaying non-grocery items, like a mini hardware store. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has always been a responsible person with her repayments—just like everyone else in her group. With the money she will start to buy products to stock her hardware store so that her customers won’t have to go out of the neighbourhood to buy these items.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy hardware items

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.ru: Шабнам Косимова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 24 года. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Муж работает в строительной компании Российской  Федерации. Шабнам сама более 4 лет занимается выращивает овощей. У нее имеются постоянные покупатели. Кредит просит посева урожая, т.е. покупки минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
Shabnam K. lives in the Gissar district. She is 24 years old, married and has 1 child. Her husband works at a construction company in the Russian Federation. Shabnam has been growing vegetables for over 4 years. She has loyal customers. She is requesting a loan for planting the crop, i.e. purchasing mineral fertilizers and seeds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For planting crops

loans.name: Once Por Ciento Group

texts.es: Banco D. Emprendimiento: ONCE POR CIENTO fue fundado el 29 D. julio D. 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir.Está compuesto por 11 personas, como Presidenta tenemos a la señora: Rosmery V. F., se dedica a la venta D. cosmeticos mediante revista Avon y Yambal, es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo.Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas. Tesorera: Maria Gumercinda Z. es socia antigua del Banco D. Emprendimiento Once Porciento, se dedica al rubro D. venta D. perfumes y cosmeticos D. Yanbal y Esika, ademas D. trabajar como empleada D. limpieza, dentro del rubro tiene 9 años D. antiguedad y tambien realiza labores D. casa. Con los ingresos que persibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia, tiene 4 hijos,es viuda por eso es que ella trabaja incansablemente, las socias del grupo la consideran un ejemplo. Secretaria:Yoissy G. C., se dedica a la venta D. productos por catalogo, perfumes y cosmeticos,tiene 23 años D. edad, y 5 años D. antigüedad en el rubro, trabaja D. lunes a viernes 6 horas al dia, su trabajo mayormente es atender a la gente que visita su domicilio y a las personas que ella visita para ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: Incremento de Capitales de Trabajo y Mercaderia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Khajak

texts.en: Khajak is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a mini-market since 2006 to earn income to help satisfy, in collaboration with his parents, the needs of the family. Today, Khajak is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase a laptop for the accounting and the inventory of his shop in order to develop his work.

loans.use: purchase a laptop

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a native cake vendor in their village.  She is 52 years and still aiming for a success in life. She  is living with her family in the village of Sta. Rosa, Santiago City, Isabela. She both stand as father and mother to her four children. She is happy because she is able to provide all the needs of her family. Her four children are already married.

Anita would like to buy additional native cakes so that she could generate bigger income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting PHP5,000 that will be a great help in improving her vending business.  She is hoping that the loan amount she is requesting will be granted. Anita is hoping that she could improve her way of living.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Fredielyn

texts.en:
Fredielyn B. is from the village of Purok 4, Valencia City. She is 25 years old. Fredielyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Fredielyn owns & operates a business providing internet services to local community members. Fredielyn has been engaged in her internet cafe business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fredielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fredielyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fredielyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Chhom C., age 34, is married and has three children. Two of her children are enrolled in the local school. To make a living, she designs and sews clothing. She earns an income of US $4.00 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband, a taxi driver in Kampot Province, who earns US $4.50 per day as the primary source of income for the family. C. and her husband are seeking to improve his business and their family's standard of living. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine to expand her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 40-year-old single mother of two teenage boys. She has run the Brown Skin Beauty Clinic since 2004 in the Kayole area of Nairobi. She offers manicures, pedicures, and hairdressing for men and women.  Beatrice employs one person and she describes herself as very successful.

Beatrice has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 through Kiva's field partner, Faulu, to add stock to the salon.

Beatrice says that she has developed her business from very humble beginnings.  She dreams of expanding into more businesses in the future.

loans.use: Purchase stock for beauty salon

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn P. lives in Sitio Tuburan, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is 37 years old and married to Pelagio, who is a farmer. They have three children between the ages of 12 and 19. Two of them are still attending school and one is working in Manila, the capital city of the Philippines, and helps her parents support their family by sending money every month. Jonalyn wants her children to finish their studies, and she wants to help her husband earn income for their family.
 
To help her husband earn a living for the family, she put up a small general store adjacent to their house. At the start, her earnings were small, but it helped support their household expenses, and she saw that it had potential for expansion if she only had the necessary capital to fill her store with products to sell. This is why she joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1988, and with the additional capital from her loans, she is now able to earn a monthly income of about $213 a month, most of which she spends for their household expenses. She is also saving up for the education of her children. 

Now she is in her 18th loan cycle, borrowing 27,000 PHP as additional working capital for her general store.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Damaris Del Carmen

texts.es: Damaris del Carmen E. M. de 33 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Delgado, vive junto a  sus tres hijos menores de edad. Damaris posee una venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así también vende vaselinas, la cuales son un tipo de crema para la piel. Cada día Damaris sale a las calles de Ciudad delgado ofreciendo su producto de manera ambulante, lo cual le deja ganancias diarias, la cuales no le son suficiente para solventar todos sus gastos familiares, ya que ella debe esforzarse el doble por su familia debido a que es madre soltera. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, los cuales muchas personas se los solicitan y que por falta de capital no ha podido comprar, ella espera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y poder aumentar sus ventas diarias.
texts.en:
33-year-old Damaris del Carmen E. M. lives in Ciudad Delgado with her three children who are minors. Damaris sells clothing for men, women and children and also sells petroleum jelly, which is a type of skin cream. Every day, Darmaris takes to the streets of Ciudad Delgado to sell her product on foot. Her daily income is not enough to cover all of her living expenses because she has to work doubly hard for her family since she's a single mother. She is requesting a loan that she'll use to buy a greater amount of products, which many people are asking for and which she has not been able to buy due to a lack of capital. She hopes to improve her business conditions and to be able to increase her daily sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy skin products.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is from Gango Ozamiz City. She is 43, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business where she makes and sell snacks in the market. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.en: Born in 1980, N. Saifullo is married and has one child. He is a farmer and agriculture has become his beloved job, and has been the principle source of income for him for the last ten years. On his land he produces different kinds of produce. Thanks to his experiences that he gained during ten years, he gets a rich harvest every year from his land. In light of the current high demand, Saifullo would like to improve his land and production to meet the market. In order to do this, he is seeking a loan of 8,000 Somoni to buy fuels and lubricants and fertilizer for improving and expanding his harvest. He would then be able to better take care of his family's health and food needs. You could become an important part of the life of Saifullo’s family. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden A. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts paste and charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Kiden is 39 years old and is married to a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.
