Cirila is a member of the 'Llapanchik' Community Bank, which means 'everyone' in Quechua. Cirila is 39 years old, is married, and has two children. Cirila travels to the regional market twice each week to buy cheese, cereals, potatoes, animals and other products which she then sells in the local Nery García market. Cirila will use her loan of 1,000 soles to buy broad beans, wheat and barley. Her dreams are to help her family move forward in life by offering her children a good education, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase broad beans, wheat and barley

loans.name: Aquino

texts.en:
Aquino N. raises pigs in his backyard. He is 23 years old and single. His parents taught him this business. At a young age, he realized that he needed to work hard to achieve his dreams. Aquino's small pig farm will help him achieve his dreams, even though he was not able to finish his studies. He failed his parents once, but this time he will prove to everyone that he can do better in society by having a business.

Aquino is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy piglets and feed for his pigs. This loan will definitely help Aquino grow his small pig farm. Aquino can buy more pigs, which will allow him to earn a significant profit for his parents and his future.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to eradicate poverty. CEVI helps people start and own a business. They provide credit, training, and insurance coverage to all their clients to help them grow their small businesses.

loans.use: Buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Mahbuda

texts.ru:
Махбуда , женщина сорока лет , проживает в районе Утконсой вблизи гор.Она нигде не работает , а занимается откормом и продаже скота и домашнего молока.Продаёт скот её муж, т.к. продажа скота , это мужская работа.Махбуда решила помочь мужу , увеличить в кредит его оборотный капитал,при помощи кредита.
Сейчас у неё пять больших коров , которые дают в день 20 литров молока.На деньги кредита она хочет купить ещё пару голов скота.
texts.en:
Mahbuda is a 40 year old woman and lives in the Utkansoi area close to the mountains. She does not have a job and fattens and sells livestock and home produced milk. Her husband sells the livestock since livestock sales is a man’s job. Mahbuda decided to help her husband - increase his working capital with the help of a loan. Right now she owns five large cows which produce 20 liters of milk per day. She would like to use the loan money to purchase a couple more heads of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten and sells livestock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ali has owned a grocery store since 1996. He requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him diversify his merchandise.

Ali is special in his work because he has a big variety of products. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn dreams that someday her children will finish college and have a better job. She knows that it is not easy but she always tries her best to save her daily income for her children’s future. She believes that God will always be with them to guide and give them spiritual support.

Emilyn is a resident of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Edwin B. who has been a construction worker in Roxas since 1994. He is employed there with a salary of PHP350.00 daily. They have been blessed with two children who are both studying at present. Edilyn, the eldest child, is 11 years old and in grade six; Mark Andrew is in grade two, and he is 7 years old. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 because she is planning to expand her poultry raising and put up a piggery business. According to her, as soon as she receives her loan, she will immediately buy piglets to fill up her empty pigpen. The loan will also be a big help to maintain her existing poultry business. She wants to help her husband in generating additional income to support the growing needs of their children, especially in their studies. She is happy that they already have their own house and she hopes that their ways of living will be uplifted to experience a better life in the future.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr: mr abdourahmane sène est un commerçant originaire du village de sangué,il a démarré ses activités commerciales depuis l'an 2000 avec un capital personnel de 50000 FCFA,son activité consiste à acheter du foin de bétail ,de l'aliment de volaille ,du mais et de l'arachide en zone rurale pour les revendre sur le marché urbain :avec ce pret ,il envisage d'augmenter ses stocks avant l'arrivée de l'hivernage
texts.en:
Mr. Abdourahmane Sène is an entrepreneur whose roots are in the village of Sangué. He started up his business in the year 2000 with a personal capital of 50,000 F CFA. His business is buying cattle fodder, chicken feed, maize and peanuts in rural areas to re-sell on the urban market. With this loan, he expects to be able to add to his stocks before the arrival of the off-season.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to his stocks of animal feed for re-sale

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina J. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 41 years old. Rizalina is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Rizalina owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rizalina has been engaged in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rizalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase a fishing boat. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rizalina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Fish vending was 53-year-old Lorna A.’s previous livelihood. Later on, she found herself unfit to this field, since she experienced loss from fish vending. Instead of getting discouraged, she shifted her attention to sewing bridal dresses. Soon she was able to save enough capital to open a boutique. From this, she gets to support her husband in feeding their three children and providing their family needs.

Although her business is presently stable and growing, Lorna is requesting the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) to grant her a loan to expand her boutique. She aspires to have a tailoring shop in the future. Based on what she has learned at CEVI, this goal is just close at hand if she continues her hard work and pairs this with faith in the Almighty.

loans.use: materials for her boutique

loans.name: Oksana's Group

texts.en: Oksana is married with no children yet. She runs a small production company that produces and installs windows. She has been in this business for 2 years. Many people live in old houses and want to fix their windows, so there is a high demand for new windows in the area. Being a hard-working and active person, Oksana has plans to develop her business and increase the sales. Oksana would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to purchase materials for window production.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex M. joined CEVI in October 2007. He is pleased with the CEVI program because it offers a valuable service of loans with only 2% interest per month which he believes is good and acceptable. Alex is a farmer, and rice is his main crop. His wife Josephine M. also helps him.  They have been married since 2001. He utilizes all his harvest to buy the things they need in their home like food, clothing, and the education of his eldest child who is now 6 years old.  He is asking Community Economic Ventures Inc. for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 which he will use to pay the laborers who work on his farm.

loans.use: To finance his farm.

loans.name: Blanca Julia

texts.es: La Señora Blanca Julia Juárez tiene la edad de 39 años, tiene dos hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Blanca es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con muy poco capital ya que no tenía el suficiente capital para ofrecer más productos. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, a pesar de ser muy humilde tiene suficiente clientes. Los propósitos de Doña Blanca son de  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia proporcionado lo necesario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, comal entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca Julia Juárez is 39 years old. She has two children, and they are in school. Blanca’s business is the sale and manufacture of tortillas. She has been engaged in this business for more than 20 years. It began with very little capital, and she didn’t have sufficient capital to offer more products.

The location of her business is in her home. In spite of being very humble, she has sufficient customers. The intentions of Doña Blanca are to improve her family’s living conditions in proportion to their needs. The financing is to buy working capital for the purchase of corn, firewood, lime, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr: A. Agathe est née le 31/07/1978 à Pobè. Agathe est mariée à AHOUNOU Raphaël. Agathe est mère deux enfants mais elle a un autre enfant qui n’est pas d’elle aussi à charge en plus des tiens. Agathe vit avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Agathe fait la couture mais vend en plus des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Agathe achète ses articles à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin et les vend à Djègan Daho à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN.  Agathe a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé pour faire évoluer son activité. Agathe a bien remboursé ces crédits et elle sollicite un autre aujourd’hui pour mieux développer son activité couture.
texts.en:
Agathe A. was born on 31/07/1978 in the city of Pobe. Agathe is married to Raphael Ahounou. Agathe is mother of two children but she has anonther in her care that is not her child. Agath lives with her children and she is the sole breadwinner of the family. Agathe is a seamstress but she also sells various items (candies, cookies, boxes of milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pastas, laundry detergents, dish soaps, beauty bars, batteries, candles etc.). Agatha purchases her inventory in Cotonou, the financial capital of Benin, and she resells them in the Djegan Daho district of Porto-Novo, capital city of Benin. Agathe has had two previous loans with Alide (Kiva Field Partner) to benefit her business. Agathe has never had problems repaying her loans, and so she requests a new loan to improve her seamstress business.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tailoring tools.

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en:
Nuth T. is 61 years old and the mother of three children: one is single and the other two are married and have already started new families.

In the beginning of 1996, Nuth T. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a variety of vegetable to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. In addition, she and her husband always cultivate crops during the approaching farming season, after the rains fall and the land is suitable for growing rice.

Nuth T. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo which she will use to alleviate her hard labor on the farm.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo to alleviate her hard labor on the farm

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
O. Habib is a 47-year-old farmer, who lives with his wife and three children in the Northern part of Tajikistan, in Spitamen. Habib has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local traders. He has five years of experience in raising cattle and selling dairy products. Habib's dairy products are in very high demand in his village; however the milk from two cows is not enough to meet demand. Habib is therefore applying for a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Habib is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his standard of living through this loan.
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a cow and fodder to expand his dairy business

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em N., 47, is a widow with two children. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her children. To make a living, she rents discs, earning approximately $5 US per day. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently employed in a local garment factory. He helps cover the household expenses. Ms. N. and her children are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, N. is asking for a loan of $200 US to purchase more discs to rent and juice for sale.

loans.use: To buy discs and juice

loans.name: Andeline

texts.en: Andeline O. is 34 years old and the mother of 6 children. She lives in Delta State, Nigeria. She sells groceries and foodstuffs to make a living. Anderline has been with LAPO for seven years and she is a faithful and a committed client.  Andeline hopes for a loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to meet customer demand and to make more profit.  One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: La Señora Maria Virginia se dedica, hace 5 años a la venta D. comida, ella prepara 20 almuerzos al dia que lleva a la Fabrica San Aurelio, además D. eso es profesora D. musica; se levanta muy temprano todos los dias para ir a comprar la carne que necesita para preparar sus alumuerzos que debe repartir hasta las 12:00 horas del mediodia en la que los trabajadores salen a comer. Tomo la decision D. aumentar su capital D. trabajo y  D. comprar más cajitas D. almuerzo y D. una heladera para mantener mejor los viveres que compra para los almuerzos, es por eso que ha accedido a un credito con EMPRENDER, ella esta muy orgullosa del trabajo que esta haciendo puesto que debe dar el ejemplo a sus hijas que estan en secundaria, por lo que esta muy contenta D. contar con el apoyo que le brinda la institucion y esta muy comprometida en no fallar, para ser un ejemplo para su familia. Desea con el tiempo poder colocar una pension familiar en su casa y vender cena tambien para poder mejorar sus ingresos y darle mejores oportunidades a su familia.
texts.en:
For 5 years, Señora Maria Virginia has been selling food, preparing 20 lunches a day that she carries to the San Aurelio factory. In addition to this, she is a music teacher. She gets up very early each day to go to buy the meat that she needs to make her lunches; she distributes them at noon to the workers who leave the factory to eat. She maD. the decision to increase her working capital and to buy more lunch containers and a cooler to better maintain the perishables that she buys for the lunches. For this reason she has approached EMPRENDER for a loan. She is very proud of the work she is doing, since she must set a good example for her daughters who are in secondary school. For this reason she is very pleased to have the support of the institution, as she is committed to succeed so as to be an example for her family. She hopes that over time she will be able to rent out rooms in her house and also sell dinner so that she can improve her income and give greater opportunities to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase capital

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo C. T., 45, has her own small business selling fruit drinks and cakes to people along the street. Her husband works in construction. Keo C. T. has three children: one is married and two are students. Both of her school-aged children face difficulty going to school, because their school is far from their house and they have no vehicle for traveling. Thus, Keo C. T. requests a loan to buy a bicycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle

loans.name: Mil

texts.en:
Mrs. Mil P. is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare field of land to grow rice. She is 42 years old and the mother of six children: one is employed in a garment factory, three others are laborers, and the rest are attending the local school. They live in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Mil P. faces a problem because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for a laborer to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Orey Se, helps her with the farming. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay for a laborer to plow the field

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: K. Patrick is a businessman of thirty-one years old. He is married with five children going to school. He deals in supplying hardware products. He has been in this business for over 3 years. He is using the loan to add capital in order to purchase a big stock of  cement and so forth for his business. His future plans are to expand the business, educate his children, and give good care to his family.

loans.use: purchasing big stocks of cement and so forth for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Reyna María

texts.es:
La señora B. S. tiene 4 años de trabajar con ceprodel es Madre soltera con dos hijos a su cargo en edad escolar, esta señora antes era ama de casa pero su esposo le regaló cinco mil córdobas para que ella se ayudara decidio venirse a vender al mercado en el callejon de las verduras frente al sector cerdo.
Ella empezo su negocio con poca mercaderia poco a poco he salido adelante ahora tengo una ventesita en mi casa que esa la administra mi hija la mayor y ahora solo podemos constar con estos dos negocio ya que se quedo viuda hace poco.
texts.en:
B. S. has collaborated with Ceprodel for 4 years. She is a single mother with two, school age children under her care. She used to be a housewife but her husband gave her five-thousand córdobas so that she could help herself out; she decided to become a vegetable merchant in the market; she's located in the vegetable section across from the pork section. She started her business with little merchandise but gradually has been getting ahead and now "I have a small sales operation at home that my oldest daughter runs" They rely on both these businesses because she was recently widowed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables:  yucca, quiquisque (a popular Central American tuber), cabbage, raddish, carrots.

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Sim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. M. S. is the village bank president for a group loan offered by Kiva partner AMK located in Boeng Leach village in Takeo province and consisting of 17 people. With the loans, the members plan to purchase equipment, supplies and other items to support a variety of purposes.

Mrs. M. S. is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Chhorn, is a construction worker and receives a small salary to support his family. 
Mrs. M. S. is requesting a loan of 800,000 Riels frO. AMK to buy fruit (mangos, tangerines, etc.) for resale. With her new business, she hopes to increase her income and improve the family lifestyle.  Mrs. M. S. is 38 years-old and a mother of four children who are all students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: This is Rugiatu K., a small-scale businesswoman from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The 39-year-old Rugiatu K. is married to a teacher and they have two children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary school II and the other is in class II. For over seven years now, Rugiatu has been selling medicines. She has applied for a loan of SLL 3,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy more medicines to add to her pharmacy inventory. She will buy medicines such as Penoplex (two cartons), Dexorange (five cartons), Nigel (three cartons), Penadol (five cartons), Chloroquine (three cartons) and ORS (five cartons).

loans.use: Buy medicines wholesale to add to her pharmacy

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and the mother of five. She supplies books to primary schools. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Her biggest priority is assisting her husband in feeding their children and making sure their school fees are paid.

Mary joined LAPO four years ago. She is requesting a loan of 180,000 NGN to enable her to increase her inventory of books which she says will enable her get a discount and to also meet her customers' demands. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and to LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more books to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Julia Umbelina

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Julia es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y gaseosa.
Los sueños de Julia son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y progresar mas.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Faith Community Bank. Julia is married, 44 years old and she has three children. She has a store at her house where she sells general grocery items. She does this job everyday with the help of her children. Julia needs a loan of 900 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of rice and sodas. Julia's dreams for the future include educating her children so that they will be professionals and be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and soda

loans.name: Juana Luisa Jahel

texts.es: Juana es de 23 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón, se dedica a tejer güipiles típicos, tiene 3 años de estar trabajando la actividad la cual le ha ayudado mucho en el sustento de su familia, solicita su primer préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo específicamente compra de hilo para sus tejidos, sus referencia personales indican que es un apersona responsable y trabajadora, con la ayudad e su esposo pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana is 23 years old, married, and has a young son. She has been making traditional blouses for three years, which has been a great help in supporting her family. Juana is requesting her first loan to increase her operating capital, specifically for the purchase of thread for her woven products. Her personal references indicate she is a responsible and hardworking person. With the help of her husband, she will be able to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Ayayi Same

texts.en: Monsieur Ayayi Same D. is a young computer technician. He is 24 years old and single and runs a business fixing computers and providing computer technology services in Lome, Togo. He has requested his first loan from WAGES of 300,000 CFA in order to purchase a laptop computer. This will make it easier to help his clients in the future when he is able to take his computer with him.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop computer

loans.name: Norma Magnoly

texts.es:
La señora Norma Magnoly R. A. llego el año 1999  del Beni  junto a  su familia,  a puerto Villarroel en Cochabamba con la esperanza  de buscar mayores oportunidades de vida, en los primeros  años norma trabajo junto a su madre vendiendo comida camba, y así poder costear sus estudios de colegio, porque no alcanzaba sus ingresos que ganaban sus padres, puesto que son  siete hermanos.

Posteriormente concluido sus estudios de colegio trabajo en el hospital, y actualmente  trabaja en la institución PRODEM como cajera, al mismo tiempo quiere reactivar su puesto de venta de empanadas es para esto que está pidiendo el crédito ella desea reabrir su puesto de comida y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma Magnoly R. A. came from Beni with her family and arrived in 1999 in the outlying community of Villarroel in Cochabamba with hopes of finding better opportunities. During the first few years she was here, Norma worked with her mother selling local dishes to help pay for her high school studies. Her parents did not earn enough money since they had to support seven other children.

Norma worked at a hospital after she finished high school. She currently works as a cashier at an institution called PRODEM. At the same time, she wants to reopen her food stall so that she can begin selling turnovers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can restart her food business and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to reopen her food business

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es: La señora Norma Alicia Trabaja en una cafetería de una universidad, es una señora que le gusta mucho su trabajo y convivir con los estudiantes de la universidad, ella quiere mejorar su lugar de trabaja, es por eso que requiere de este crédito por que el techo de la cafetería ya esta muy dañado debido a las lluvias tan intensas que se han suscitado en la ciudad, y es necesario repararlo. Ella les agradece el apoyo.
texts.en:
Ms. Norma Alicia works in a university cafeteria and is a woman who enjoys working and mingling with the university students. She wants to improve her work area, so she needs this loan because the roof in the cafeteria is damaged from the intense rains that have hit the city and the roof it is in need of repair. She appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof in her place of business

loans.name: Richard Kipngetich

texts.en:
Richard has been farming for the last six years in Naivasha town.  He is 34 years old, married to Mary Jelangat and they have five children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to start practicing mixed farming and with this cash, he plans to buy cows which he will rear for both meat and milk production.  

His future plan is to have a big animal farm where he will rear a variety of animals for wholesale production of both meat and milk.

loans.use: To buy cows to rear

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 39-year-old lady who has spent all her life in a city called Vehari. Vehari is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. 
She lives with her family in a three-roomed brick house. Her family consists of her husband, her brother-in-law and six children: two boys and four girls, all of whom are attending a local school. 

Nasreen works in a factory on a monthly wage, while her husband is a rickshaw driver. Her working hours are 8am to 1pm. She then gives time to her sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns a good income.
 
Her brother-in-law also works and contributes his salary to the family. He has a business selling construction supplies which he has been doing for the last 7 years.
 
Naseem has applied for a loan from Asasah for her brother-in-law. With the loan amount he will buy construction supplies such as sand, cement and bricks.
 
Naseem loves her family and she has a great desire for her brother-in-law to get settled as soon as possible. 
She is very hopeful that her brother-in-law will be able to enhance his business by making positive use of the loan money.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Phanic

texts.en:
Phanic M. is a 28-year-old single gentleman. He is a cattle trader who buys cattle from other traders and later sells them at a profit. His business is located in the open air market at Bungoma where many traders frequent.

Phanic joined KADET after an awareness campaign was done in his area of operation by the World Vision staff where KADET is a subsidiary. This will be his first loan and he hopes to use the funds to buy more cattle for resale.

In the future he would like to open a butcher shop where he can sell some cattle as meat. He believes that his hard work will in the end payoff.

loans.use: To buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Haem Sem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Si Sla village, Takeo province, there are sixteen people who make up this village bank loan. T. will uS. their portion of the loan for varied ways to support their businesses. Mrs. Haem S. was born in 1957, and was selected by other members to be the village bank president.

She and her husband, Mr. Phorn Nob, are farmers who own a 2.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family, and he is also a vice village chief. She has a problem becauS. her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production of rice, Mrs. Haem S. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a driver, while the other is attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun D. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Hin Khoem, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1983 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. 

The couple has been growing rice for more than four years. In addition, they also grow cucumbers. Aun is a applying for a loan of $500 to continue her business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and also to pay for plowing.

loans.use: purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide and also to pay for plowing

loans.name: Flor De Libertad 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Clara is the coordinator of her group Flor de Libertad 1 & 2 (Liberty Flower). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their six children. They have raised and educated their children by working hard. Her most difficult challenge is to finish a university career. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to read the Bible. She is part of the microfinance program because these loans are for business and she really likes that.

Clara is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around one month, starting with some savings she had. After she started was when she discovered the Esperanza program. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing like 10 skirts, 10 pairs of pants, blouses and shirts. She will use the profits to save and to study. She is dreaming to have enough income to help her children in everything they need, especially in their studies.

This Esperanza associate's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Los Arcarrizos, a dusty, industrial area north of the capital where free-trade zones are common. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy 10 skirts, 10 pairs of pants, blouses and shirts

loans.name: Burulbu's Group

texts.en:
The East has always been known for its colorful traditions and unique lifestyle. Central Asian countries are not an exception. The highest value for people is family ties. They are very strong and are kept tight for generations. Therefore, people always help out their children and their parents, both morally and financially in any kind of situation. 

Burulbu M., 53, is from the village of Aravan in southern Kyrgyzstan. Burulbu has been married for 27 years now and has two grown children. Her husband is a dentist. Her older son has chosen a military career and her younger son has decided to follow his father’s steps and become a professional dentist. 

Burulbu and her daughter-in-law are busy with raising and selling cattle. In ten years of being in business, the family already has managed to purchase a car and arrange a nice wedding for their older son. Burulbu plans to spend this loan on construction materials for building a temporary house. In the near future, she would like to adorn her house with new furniture and continue helping her younger son to get a good medical education.

Yulduzkhon A., 41, sells vegetables and fruits in the local market. Yulduzkhon plans to spend some part of the loan on broadening her business and the rest on purchasing construction materials. When she has the opportunity, she plans to open a small shop in the village.

Tojikhon H., 55, raises and sells sheep. Her business was started two years ago, and by now she has already made major repairs to her house. Tojikhon applied for this loan in order to get new furniture as a gift for her daughter’s wedding. 

Mavjuda E., 38, is a farmer. Thanks to her business she moved to a new house. She would like to spend this loan on buying new furniture for her daughter’s house. Also, with the profit from her business, she would like to repair her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gerson Goyo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Gerson; El socio tiene 26 años de edad, el es soltero; el socio tiene un pequeño taller de melamina, el socio fabrica muebles de todo tipo en su taller en melamina, el realiza trabajos desde hace dos años, el hace mesas, escritorios, roperos, cocinas, cómodas, camas y otros, el socio desea poder implementar su taller con maquinaria para pintar y cortar melamina, también comprar material al por mayor para realizar sus trabajos. El socio invertirá su dinero en la compra de taladro y tornillos, también ganchitos llamados sapos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar taladro y ganchitos para los muebles.

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Los Lideres (The Leaders) communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac part of the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Mr. Gerson; he is 26 years old and is single. He has a small melamine resin shop where he builds all types of furniture in his shop. He has been working in this business for two years; he makes tables, desks, closets, kitchen sets, chests, beds and other items. Mr. Gerson wishes to include in his shop machinery to paint and cut melamine resin as well to buy material wholesale to do his work. The member will use the money to buy a drill and screws, as well as hooks called frogs. The member needs the loan to buy the drill and hooks for the furniture.

Mr. Gerson is thankful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is committed to meet the payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy paint, and minor tools.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 32 year-old businessman. He has two main businesses namely dairy farming and transport. He is requesting a 50,000 Kes loan to buy a dairy cow and a chuff cutter for his dairy business. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He plans to acquire taxis and grow his farming business in five years time. He is married with children who are in school and he describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Jayniel

texts.en:
Jayniel M. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. He is 32 years old. Jayniel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jayniel owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling cosmetics & medicinal products like aloe vera shampoo in the local community. Jayniel has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jayniel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jayniel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jayniel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like medicinal capsules. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jayniel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like medicinal capsules

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem S., 49, is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

The family has to spend $20 on food, $10 on electricity supply and $60 on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Silika Kazungu

texts.en:
Silika Kazungu K. is 32 years old. She is married to Danson and they have two children. Silika has been a fishmonger for the last ten years in Mtwapa, Mombasa.

Silika managed to service her first KADET loan successfully and this marks her second borrowing from KADET to finance her business. She plans to use the money to purchase fish stock in bulk. 

With the anticipated profit Silika hopes to purchase a freezer.Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Lencer Adhiambo

texts.en:
For 18 years, Lencer Adhiambo has been selling fish in Dandora Estate, a highly populated area.  She has very many customers and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. Lencer is 42 years old, married to Peter, and they have four school-going children.

Lencer is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a client who is a registered member of KADET. She intends to use the loan to buy more fish to sell to her customers. With the anticipated profit, she will add more stock of fish and pay school fees for her children.

In the future, she desires to grow her business and start supplying fish to the hotels. Lencer is a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 29 years old, married and a father of two.  He has a quarry business with which he earns a living.  He has been running the business for five years and has employed three people.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access loan easily.  Hence, he has managed to improve his business.  He hopes to continue growing his business to get a better income. 

 He has requested for 20, 000 Kes to buy a water pump for the operation in the quarry and to get income to pay his addition employees.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for the operation in the quarry and to pay his additional employees.

loans.name: Fatumah

texts.en:
Fatumah N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Her child is currently in school.  Fatumah has a business selling shoes, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Fatumah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fatumah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. 

 In the future, Fatumah hopes to own a small retail shop.     Fatumah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by letting her hear good storybooks in the club.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos es mecánico y  también vende accesorios  para movilidad; el crédito lo requiere para comprar herramientas como ser limpia parabrisas, repuestos para motores  ya que tiene mas demanda en estos artículos para movilidad. Con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. Vive en Anticrético en una casa ubicada en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciado y tiene dos hijos . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Carlos is a mechanic and also sells vehicle accessories.  He needs this loan to buy items such as windshield wipers and spare parts for engines since he has a lot of demand for them.  Carlos uses the income he makes to support himself.  He lives in a rental house, in Las Lomas neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  He is divorced and has two children.  This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy windshield wipers and spare parts for engines, for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose C. V. es vecino de Pérez Zeledón. El se dedica al engorde de cerdos desde hace poco tiempo.
Gracias a  a la idea de uno de sus amigos, don Jose será parte de un proyecto en su pueblo con el que formaran la porqueriza más grande de  la comunidad. Para ello el necesita un préstamo de  ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para pagar la mano de obra y parte del material necesario para construir la porqueriza.
El es  socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose C. V. lives in Pérez Zeledón and raises pigs.  He has only been in the business for a short period of time.

Thanks to a friend who came up with the idea, Jose will be part of a project in his village to set up the largest pig farm in the community.  He needs a loan of 594,000 CRC to pay for labor costs and part of the construction material for the pig pen.

He is a member of the "Productores El General" Association, one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce and Rick S. own Frosted Delights by Joyce, a café and bakery located in San Antonio’s “Southtown District” (just south of downtown).  They bake custom-order cakes for weddings and special events, as well as offering coffee, food, and desserts in their café.  A few weeks ago, Joyce and Rick expanded their menu to include deli food, giving customers dining options for any time of the day. 
 
Having baked recreationally for most of her life, Joyce dreamed of someday owning her own bakery.    Prior to opening “Frosted Delights by Joyce,” she spent twenty years working with AT&T.  Rick spent most of his life in the trucking industry and was working as an operations supervisor when the recession forced the company he was working for to eliminate his position.  Instead of looking for a new job in the trucking business, Rick, together with  Joyce, decided to retire from their careers and launch their own business.

Rick and Joyce opened “Frosted Delights by Joyce” in November, 2010.  In the six months they have been in business, they have already developed a loyal clientele.   For them, it is rewarding to see repeat customers walk through their doors because it tells them they are doing a good job.  They hope to continue growing the deli and delivery part of their business by capitalizing on their location close to downtown.  With all of the companies in the area, they see great opportunity for growth.

Rick says that he and Joyce work more hours now than they ever have, but that being personally and emotionally invested in the business makes it all worthwhile.  In addition to the two of them, Frosted Delights by Joyce has two part-time employees.  Joyce and Rick are using this loan to purchase more equipment.  For example, they need more baking pans, and as their business continues to grow, will soon need another oven.

loans.use: to buy equipment: baking pans, snow cone machine, oven.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 51-year-old man living in Bint Jbeil and father of two children. He has owned a bakery since 2000, with 10 years of experience. He is a hard worker. He has good reputation for his proficiency at work. His customers are the people living in his town. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy a silent generator to keep his bakery provided with the necessary electricity when it’s not provided by the government. He hopes to expand the bakery in the future and buy new equipments. He hopes to be the first in his domain and be well known for his good product quality. Ahmad also hopes he can educate his children to be important people in their community.

loans.use: To buy a silent generator necessary to provide his bakery with electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farming supplies.

loans.name: Narankhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Narankhuu is a 53-year-old widow. She lives with her youngest son’s family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has four children; the three eldest ones are married and live with their families. She owns a small land plot and a house on it. Her youngest son, Batjargal, runs a small workshop to repair digital cameras. 

Mrs. Narankhuu has been on her pension since 2008. Last year, she started to renovate her house but could not finish it due to the coming wintertime and shortage of money. The loan she is taking will be used to buy necessary building materials to complete the unfinished renovation to her family house.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials to complete the unfinished renovation to her family house.

loans.name: Oeur

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Mrs. Oeur, 47, has been producing fish-paste for many years. She is a single mother who now lives in a small house with two single children: one works in the fishing business and the other one sells many kinds of goods at home.  She has three other children who are married and live in a separate house. Mrs. Oeur is seeking a loan from Kiva to use as capital to buy more fish to produce fish-paste for sale and to support her child in the merchandise business. Mrs. Oeur is pictured in front her daughter’s store.

loans.use: to buy more fish to produce fish-paste for sale and to support her child in the merchandise business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old and married to Mbatha, and they are blessed with four children, aged 20, 16, 10 and 8. He has been operating his shoe business for the past eight years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 13,500 which he uses to take care of his family.

He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. This will be his second loan from KADET. He intends to use his loan to purchase stock of shoes and clothes for sale.

He plans to use the profit from his business to buy a pick-up for transporting shoes to other towns and to open a wholesale shoe shop. In the future, he hopes to be a wholesale seller and to be importing shoes from abroad.

loans.use: to purchase stock of shoes and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lydia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy piglets and feed.

Lydia has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: To build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.)
Florencia tiene 53 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) pero ahora vive en la comunidad de Papel Pata a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco). Desde muy joven se dedico a la agricultura, ella cultiva frutas, cacao, café y los distribuye en la ciudad de Quillabamba. Ya son varios años que funciona el negocio y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas y para plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convención province and an important commerce center in the Lares and La Convención valleys.  The main economic activity is production of coca, coffee, cacao, and fruit.

Florencia is 53-years-old and has two children.  She was born in Cusco (Peru), but no now lives in the community called Papel Pata 45 minutes away from the city of Quillabamba (La Convención, Cusco).

Since she was very young she has worked in agriculture.  She grows fruit, cacao, and coffee and distributes them in the city of Quillabamba.  She has been in this business for several years and it has been going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time she needs the loan to buy fruit and for cacao plantations.

loans.use: to buy fruit and for cacao plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open another barber shop and buy a shaving machine, chairs and mirrors.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata de 48 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Alejandro de 54 años y sus 03 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Honorata trabaja todos los días en sus tierras. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, pues ahí  siembra de todo un poco, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra plantas de cacao y café ya que estos son los productos que mejor precio tiene en los mercados.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectarlas, lo cual reduciría mucho sus ganancias. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, pues es ahí donde vende sus productos. Ya que las plagas aquejan sus sembríos, Honorata comprará con el crédito solicitado tramperas para combatir  los insectos quienes se apoderan de los frutos de las plantas. Para el bien de su futuro espera  cuidar con el mismo ímpetu sus parcelas. Este será su 17avo crédito de Honorata con MFP,  por tanto espera de un pequeño apoyo de los financistas para llevar consigo su propósito y por ello esta apta en devolver todo sus aportes puntualmente como en sus anteriores créditos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto  de las socias. Con los 2,000 mil nuevos soles, comprará mallas que utilizará como trampas, para combatir con la plaga de insectos que asechan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Honorata, 48, is from the city of Quimbiri.  She is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Alejandro, 54, and their three minor children for whom they want to provide the best quality of life.  Together with her husband, Honorata works every day on her land.  With much effort she has been able to make her land more productive.  She grows a little bit of everything and produces quality crops, the mains ones being cocoa and coffee since these command the highest price at market.

What she enjoys most about her work is caring for her crops against insect plagues since this would reduce profits.  She has been in this trade for 20 years and feels the hardest part of it is transporting the crops to the city of San Francisco which is where she sells them.  Since plagues are a menace to the crops, Honorata will use the loan to buy wire netting to combat the insects.  She plans to care for all of her cropland in the same way to protect her future.  This is her 17th loan through MFP and she is counting on lenders to help her meet her goal.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time as she has done with previous loans.  She is a very supportive member of her communal bank.  With this 2,000 PEN loan she will buy wire netting to combat the insect plagues threatening her crops.

loans.use: To buy several meters of wire netting.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo, de 42 años es madre de tres hijos aún menores quienes viven en su casa propia junto a su esposo con quien tuvo que trabajar mucho para poder obtener una vivienda propia.El trabajo de consuelo consiste en realizar compras del mercado al por mayo, después ella lleva los productos a su casa para poder venderlos poniéndolo un valor agregado, esta actividad la realiza en su casa. Aquí, tiene la ayuda de sus hijos y lleva en esta actividad ya casi seis años.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da independencia para poder hacer otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que siempre hay personas que quieren ir a sorprender con el cuento del crédito, ella espera poder crecer aun mas ya que se siente joven y espera poder seguir trabajando como lo hizo hasta ahora.Este es el quinto préstamo entre Consuelo y la entidad MFP, le gusta mucho trabajar con este grupo ya que hasta ahora se mostraron todos responsables y espera poder seguir trabajando con su asesora ya que s siente cómoda igual que con la institución. Con el préstamo solicitado 2000 soles, ella comprará abarrotes para tener en stock y algunos otros productos para así poder surtir su bodega.
texts.en: Consuelo is 42 and the mother of three.  She lives with her husband, who worked hard to own their own home.  Consuelo works out of her home, buying products wholesale and selling them at a mark-up.  Her children help her with the business, which she has run for the past 6 years.  She enjoys the autonomy her business gives her, but she dislikes being surpised by customers asking for credit.  She hopes to grow her business and feels youthful and energetic to work as she has up to now.  This is Consuelo's fifth loan with MFP, and she enjoys working with this group, whose members have proven responsable. She also hopes to continue working with her advisor and feels very comfortable with the institution.  With a loan of 2,000 soles, she will buy food items and inventory stock for her store.

loans.use: to buy general food items for her store inventory

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 23 y 22 años de edad, ambos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer. Nuestra amiga es artesana y hace varios años estuvo en una academia de corte y confección en la cual aprendió muy bien esta profesión.

Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde se dedica a coser ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que requieren de sus servicios. También vende ropa de todo tipo la cual lo realiza puerta a puerta aunque le mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su propio taller. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva más de 10 años dedicada a estas actividades y le va bastante bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa de todo tipo, telas, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy amigables y unidas.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su vida diaria.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (Toward Development with Love and Faith) meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and its handicrafts. For example, its straw hats are known within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Ana. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children (ages 23 and 22). Both of them still live with her. Her husband is a chauffeur. Ana is a seamstress and attended a sewing and dressmaking academy several years ago. This is where she learned her profession very well.

Ana has a small sewing workshop in her home where she makes clothing based on the orders she receives from people who request her services. She also sells all types of clothing by going door-to-door, although most of her sales are made directly from her workshop. Ana works every day from 6am to 10pm and sometimes much later when she has orders to deliver. She has been doing this type of work for more than 10 years and has done very well.

This new loan will be used to buy clothing of all types, fabrics, thread, and other materials for sewing. Ana has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and enjoys being part of the group because her fellow members are friendly and she is close to them. Her dream is to move forward in her daily life.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Chiose

texts.en:
Chiose is 46 years old and single.  She lives in the Philippines. Chiose buys and sells pillows, curtains, and bed sheets. She has had this business for 20 years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy home products such as pillows and curtains.

Chiose is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Chiose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase home products such as pillows and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Rafael Edilberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rafael Edilberto; el tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el es chofer de una combi de turismo que trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio de transporte las la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de transporte. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas y repuestos para el carro.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member is part of the “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO” in Cusco.  Rafael Edilberto is 42, married and has 2 children.  He works driving a small bus from 8:00 a.m to 9:00 p.m, and in this way supports his family.  He wants to grow his business by using this credit to buy tires and spare parts for his vehicle.  He is pleased to have access to this credit and is committed to prompt repayment.

loans.use: El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas y repuestos para el carro.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: La socia tiene 4 hijos de 19, 13, 8, 8 años de edad, la socia  se dedica aún ala crianza de pollos, la socia compra pollos al por mayor y los lleva  a vender al por menor  a los diversos clientes que tiene en el poblado, la socia esta nuevamente solicitando el credito para invertir en la compra de 200 pollos tiernos para criarlos y una vez que alcanzan la madurez ella los vende, la socia ha creciedo con su negocio de manera favorable al punto que en esta nueva etapa ella esta duplicando el numero de pollos para criarlos y venderlos porque la socia tiene mas clientes que confian en la calidad de sus pollos; el prestamo a la socia le permite seguir creciendo y apoyar con los estudios a sus hijos. La socia reafirma su compromiso de pago y seguir trabajando arduamente.
texts.en: Aurelia has 4 children, aged 19, 13, 8 and 8.  She raises chickens, buying them wholesale and selling them retail to a diverse clientele in the area.  She seeks this loan in order to buy 200 chicks, and plans to raise them for re-sale.  She has grown her business successfully and is now doubling the number of chicks she is raising as her clients are growing in number and have come to trust the quality of her poultry.  This loan will also allow her to support her children's studies.  She is committed to prompt repayment and will continue to work hard to do so.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Binta. She is a widow and has three children, aged 21, 18 and 10. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he is her relative.  

In 1994, Binta established her foodstuffs, beverages and drinks business. She began her business by selling drinks to passengers traveling to Freetown. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,300,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Binta has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase a new type of drink sold at Le 22,000 per gallon. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Binta plans to build a house and educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for foodstuffs, beverages and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en:
Maria Cecilia is married with one child. She is 21 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Maria Cecilia sells a variety of snacks and barbecue to earn a living and has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase pork for barbecue, plus flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients for snacks vending.

Maria Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for 9 months.

loans.use: to purchase pork for barbecue, plus flour, sugar, and milk for snacks vending

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Tupee

texts.en: Tupee is 30 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children between 10 and 20 years old, who are in school and live at home. For the past two years she has been selling charcoal in her community. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to attend college.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson is 27 years old, not married, and yet very devoted to his farming business. He is a college graduate but has not been able to find a better job because of the employment crisis in this country. For this reason, Jefferson is dedicated full-time to operating his farming business. He works hard and patiently cares for his business in order to get better crop yields.

To provide his parents with a good quality of life and to lift them out of poverty, he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to continue financing his business. This loan would be used to purchase seed corn and fertilizer for his corn field. He hopes for further growth and improvement of his business, and to increase his yield by the next harvesting season.

loans.use: to buy seed corn and fertilizer for his corn field.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
Muhamad is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of four and 10. Two of them go to school. 

Muhamad runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for nine years. He has no employees. Muhamad heard about Finance Sudan from fellow clients in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 1000 to purchase items like milk, cooking oil, biscuits, sweets, Nomi, and others. Muhamad has no source of income other than this business.

In five years time, Muhamad hopes to build a house before the children are increased in number.

His major challenges include home expenses being too high.

Muhamad says that he has become better because of Finance Sudan; he is raised up financially.

loans.use: to purchase items like milk, cooking oil, biscuits, sweets, Nomi, and others.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is a widower with three grown-up children. The whole family lives in Isabela. For the last ten years, Fidel has been growing corn and rice. 

Fidel plans to use a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more seed and fertilizer for his farm.

Fidel very much hopes to gain additional profit from his farming business in order to finish long-needed repairs on his home next year.

loans.use: to buy more seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esther  solicita un préstamo para poder iniciar la construcción de un cuarto; el cual les falta para que todos los integrantes de la familia tengan su espacio personal. 
Doña Maria Esther  trabaja como vendedora de teléfonos móvil con una antigüedad de cinco años,  y su esposo como  chofer de un taxi  actividad que tiene practicando más de 14 años.
Ambos son originarios de Nuevo Laredo, tiene tres hijas, una de ellas ya esta casada y las otras dos aun viven con ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Esther is requesting a loan so that she can begin the construction of a room. Everyone in her family lacks their own personal space.

Doña Maria Esther works as mobile phone saleswoman and has five years of experience. Her husband is a taxi driver who has been in that profession for more than 14 years. Both of them are from Nuevo Laredo. They have three daughters, one of whom is already married while the other two live with them.

loans.use: to begin the construction of a room in her house.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has raised ten children and works to make a better future for them. She never finished elementary school but Fatma uses her skills, learned from her mother, to create an income. Fatma creates knitted clothing such as scarves, hats, ponchos and winter clothing. She has been able to create additional monthly income and help her family. 

Fatma needed this loan to purchase wool, string, patterns, supplies and materials.

Fatma wants to send her daughter to college and dreams of further expanding her business to include additional items and clothing.

loans.use: To purchase wool, string, patterns, supplies and materials.

loans.name: Bertha Marina

texts.es:
La señora Berta de 44 años de edad, es casada, vive con una de sus dos hijas en su casa en Valle al sur de Honduras, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y le apoya económicamente.
Doña Berta desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a la confección de prendas para damas como trajes, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, etc., con esta actividad a podido sacar delante a su  familia, esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de telas, botones, hilos y otros accesorios para confeccionar los trajes, 
Doña Berta pretende que con las utilidades de este préstamo invertido en su negocio mejorara sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, Ella desea que su negocio crezca y que su familia prospere. 
El sueño de Doña Berta es tener su casa con piso de cerámica.
texts.en:
Bertha is 44 years old, is married and lives with one of her two daughters in her house in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. Her husband is a mason and he supports her economically.

For twenty years, Bertha has dedicated herself to the creation of clothing for women like suits, dresses, skirts, pants, etc. Through this activity she has been able to get ahead with her family. She is requesting $525 to buy fabrics, buttons, threads and other accessories to create the suits.
Bertha intends to use the proceeds of this loan, invested in her business, to better the condition of her life and the life of her family. She desires for her business to grow and for her family to prosper.

Bertha's dream is to have a house with a ceramic floor.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, threads and other accessories for her business.

loans.name: Laureano

texts.es: Don. Laureano, tiene 33 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por siete miembros cinco hijos y los dos padres, es una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos, viven en el municipio de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria, produce papa, frejol y cebolla; los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. Don Laureano es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y la educación de su familia. Por el desborde del rio Moqontuyu, ha perdido sus cultivos de frejol, papa, maní y una cuarta hectárea de terreno cultivable. Don Laureano, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas, abonos y agroquímicos  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia,, y poder recuperarse antes estos desastres naturales.
texts.en:
Laureano is 33 years of age. There are seven members in his family: five children and the two parents. It is a humble family with few economic resources. They live in the small town of Mizque, in the Cochabamba department. He works in agriculture and livestock. He grows potatoes, beans and onions, which he sells in his home town to the businesses in Mizque. 

Laureano is a well-respected member of his community because of his dedication to his work and also because he is the one who takes responsibility for his family's education and food requirements.

He lost his potato, bean and groundnut crops, as well as a quarter hectare of arable land, when the River Moqontuyu burst its banks. Laureano is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertiliser and agrochemicals and to improve his family’s situation, so as to be able to recover from this natural disaster.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers and agrochemicals

loans.name: Moch, Rizky

texts.en:
M.Rizki is a student which come from Cibeber. and he takes electricity program study in his school. but he has some trouble about Costs for pay school, so he must hard work for find some budget for his school costs.
but all of trouble now was nothing because KOMIDA and KIVA gave loan to him for continue the school and that's really helpful for him.

loans.use: To Pay Monthly costs of school

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.en:
Born in Baguida in 1960, Mrs. Adjovi G. became a widower in 2003. Her husband’s job as a motorcycle engine mechanic was not enough to leave any inheritance for her. Today, she takes care of six (6) orphans who attend school, as well as her parents. With her small savings made from selling ice water on the side of the road, Mrs. G. invested in traditional local chicken raising. In 2004, she received some training in pastoral agriculture, which has given her the strong desire to invest in laying hens. Mrs. G. received a first loan that she repaid before the deadline. Her secondary school education allows her to grasp vital information on credit management. She is currently hoping for a credit of $950 to enhance her poultry house and purchase chicks and feed. The success of this business will increase her savings and strenghten her capacity to meet her needs and those of her orphan children and of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1960 à Baguida, Madame Adjovi G. devenue est veuve depuis 2003. La profession de mécanicien 2 roues de son mari ne lui a pas permis de lui laisser un héritage. Aujourd’hui, elle a à sa charge les six (06) orphelins en scolarité et ses parents. Madame G. a investi sa petite économie tirée de la vente de l’eau glacée au bord des routes dans l’élevage traditionnel des poules ordinaires. Elle a suivi en 2004 une petite formation en Agro pastoral qui suscite aujourd’hui en elle une forte envie d’investir dans les pondeuses. Madame G. a reçu un premier crédit qu’elle a soldé avant la date de remboursement. Son niveau secondaire lui confère une aptitude à mieux cerner les informations et les renseignements sur la gestion des crédits. Aujourd’hui elle attend ce crédit de $950 pour aménager son poulailler et acheter les poussins et des provendes. La réussite de cette entreprise lui fera accroître son économie et renforcer sa capacité de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins et de sa famille.

loans.use: to improve her poultry house and purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. has two (2) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells materials for tailoring. She will use the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet (pictured in the center with her solidarity group) is applying for her first loan from Esperanza to finance her retail business that consists of selling undergarments as well as cooking ingredients such as oil and salsa, which she sells to people along the street. Janet is married to Jose Antonio, a construction worker. Together they are raising their four children: Hector Antionio (7), Alvine (6), Favian (3) Yafresi (13 months).

NOTE: Janet is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Amor y Paz (Love and Peace) Bank of Hope solidarity group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying $150 each of this $750 loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

Janet looks forward to growing her business and being able to provide more adequately for her children. She desires an opportunity to become a professional and to improve her skills and education level.

She feels strongly that her participation in the Amor y Paz Bank of Hope is a new beginning for her entire family. To Janet, Esperanza is a chance to develop strong community relationships and to create a financial safety net for her family, which will allow her children to continue their schooling past primary school.

loans.use: Purchase an inventory of undergarments and cooking supplies to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Sharofat is married and has 2 children. She has been borrowing money from MLF MicroInvest for 2.5 years. During this time her business of selling men’s and teen clothing has undergone substantial changes. She has been able to expand her inventory and now has many regular clients.
