HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en: Lorenzo T. is from the town of Surallah. He is 45 years old. Lorenzo is married. To make a living, Lorenzo raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lorenzo also operates a habal-habal (motorcycle transport) service. Lorenzo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorenzo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lorenzo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is currently in business selling rice, onions, cooking oil and sugar.  She is 38 years old and is married, with 6 children.  Five of them go to school.  She requested a loan so that she can stock more rice, onions, cooking oil and sugar, and gain extra profits.  Jane hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more rice, onions, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.  

Alex has a business of selling milk. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Alex sells her products door-to-door.    

Alex has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of milk. She also generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenges for Alex include debtors and the ever-increasing prices of milk.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own milk coolers and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.   

Alex lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie E. is a married woman who lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store, a motorcycle transport business and a farm. 

Her husband, Robert Glenn E., who is 34 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. 

They have two children who are 1 and 6 years old. 

Rosalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs. 

Rosalie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Anju D..  She is married and has two children aged 16 and 11.  In 2000, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. 

 In the future, Anju plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work with their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's "kurta surwal" and men's "daura surwal".  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:

 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Emma Miriam

texts.es:
Emma de 21 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo y una hija de 21 años de edad, ellos viven en casa alquilada, administran el negocio desde hace 3 años, trabaja a tiempo completo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de celulares y accesorios, cargadores, estuches entre otros, este préstamo la ayudara a compara lo necesario para el negocio y atender mejor a los clientes.

Su aspiración es tener casa propia y ver crecer el negocio, que a través de él pueda tener una mejor condición de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Emma is 21 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán.  She sells mobile phones and accessories for a living. Her family is comprised of her husband and 21 year-old daughter.  They all live in a rental property.  She has been running her business for three years and works full time.

She is requesting a loan to buy mobile phones and accessories (chargers and cases, among other things).  The loan will help her buy what she needs for the business to improve customer service.

Her goal is to have her own home and expand business so she can improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories (chargers, cases, etc.)

loans.name: Santos Teresa

texts.es:
Santos tiene 25 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 8 años de edad y dos meses, por el momento vive con su madre, se dedica a la venta de pescado seco, este negocio tiene 6 años de existir, está ubicado en el mercado municipal, trabaja todos los días de la semana y junto a su madre lo atienden.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para  la compra de pescado seco, dicha inversión se debe a que se acerca la semana santa, tiempo en crece la demanda del pescado, esto será una gran ayuda para Santos, ya que estará aumentando el negocio y la capacidad para atender a los clientes.
Su objetivo es tener mejores ingresos, aprovechar la temporada para vender más cantidad y que le quede una mayor ganancia, al mismo tiempo poder construir su propia casa y dar lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos is 25 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  She is a single mother and has two children: one is 8 years old and the other is 2 months old.  Santos currently lives with her mother and her business is selling dried fish.  She has had this business for six years and it is located in the town market.  Santos works every day of the week together with her mother.

Santos is currently requesting a loan to buy dried fish.  This investment is necessary because 'Semana Santa' (Holy Week) is approaching.  During this period, the demand for fish increases.  This will be a great help to Santos since she will be able to increase her business and her ability to serve her customers.

Santos' goals are to make more income, to take advantage of the season in order to make more sales and to make more profits so that she can build her own home and provide her children with what they need.

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Milagros De Mozoquilpan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “MILÁGROS DE MOZOQUILPAN”,  está ubicado en el Estado de México, El grupo está conformado por 9 clientas, en este grupo se encuentra la señora Berenice P. M., es la presidenta del grupo.  Tiene de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta 3er grado de secundaria, su ocupación es comerciante de tortillas, servilletas y manteles, y tiene en total 2 hijos: 1 mujer y 1 varón, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, solicitó su préstamo para comprar maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.Nos platica que su negocio cada día va mejorando ya que cuenta con más clientes, se siente muy entusiasmada por la compra de material para la elaboración de más producto que le han solicitado sus clientas y que por falta de recursos no ha podido surtir y de sus ganancias poder abastecer lo indispensable para el sustento de su familia y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Miracles of Mozoquilpan” and is based in the State of Mexico. The group is made up of 9 members, including Berenice P. M., the group’s president. She is 28 years old, has completed 3 years of secondary school and makes a living selling tortillas, napkins and tablecloths. She has 2 children: 1 girl and 1 boy.
She requested this loan to buy corn for making tortillas. She tells us that her business improves every day as her customer base grows. She is very excited about purchasing supplies to increase production and meet customer demand, which, for lack of resources, she has been unable to meet. She is also happy about the profits that will allow her to provide for her family and her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Burastan

texts.en:
Burastan M. is from the village of Haykavan in the Shirak region of Armenia. Haykavan has abundant nature, especially for farming.  

Burastan has been engaged as a private entrepreneur for over 35 years. She is married with four children: three daughters (32, 34 and 36 years old) and a 27-year-old son. 

She is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. She will seed one hectare of her irrigated land with potato seeds and expects her income this year to increase by 20 percent. She is impressed by the services of microfinance and wants to continue growing her small business.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos Rogué  B.  vive en Pilas de Pérez Zeledón y se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura.
Don Santos tiene una pequeña finquita en la cual quiere sembrar granos básicos. Específicamente maíz y frijoles. Para eso necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar los insumos necesarios para la siembra de los tubérculos. 
El espera sacar provecho de la temporada y aumentar sus ingresos, para el beneficio de su familia.
El es socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Santos Rogué B. lives in Pilas de Pérez Zeledón and has been a farmer all his life.  He has a small farm where he wants to plant basic grains, specifically corn and beans.  

But he needs a ₡500 000 (five-hundred thousand colones) to buy farming supplies necessary to plant the tubers.  He hopes to take advantage of this season and increase his income for his family’s benefit.  

He is a member of the La Danta S.A. communal bank, one of EDESA’s 110 social enterprises in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Amelita has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 9 years and also earns an income from buying and selling copra (coconut meat) . Amelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masika représentante du groupe d’affaire « Tusaidiane »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, tous étudient. Elle fait l’artisanat, la forgerie de  fabrication des braseros à travers le sol d’argile. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans la commercialisation de ces produits. Elle étale ces braseros au long de la route, sur les différents points de vente. Signalons que ces braséros réduisent le cout de consommation de braises. D’où, sa contribution sur la conservation de l’environnement. Il ya 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  18 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  la terre d’argile, 10 tôles, quelques carcasses, etc.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une clôture autour de sa résidence.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Tusaidiane» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
The client named Masika, representative of the business group called « Tusaidiane » is a 45-year-old entrepreneur, married and the mother of five children, all enrolled in school. She is an artisan, making fired brasiers using clay. She and her husband share the duty of selling the products. She sets up her brasiers alongside the road, at different sales points. Please note that these clay brasiers reduce the cost and use of charcoal, so she contributes to protecting the environment. She has been in this business for 10 years, however, she has just completed her 18th loan with Hekima. 

This new loan will serve to buy clay, 10 pieces of sheet metal, etc. She also wants to pay school fees for her children and build a fence around her property. The client thanks Hekima for working on behalf of poor women who are excluded from conventional banks. Please also note that the business group  « Tusaidiane» is made up mostly of women.

loans.use: to buy clay, 10 pieces of sheet metal, etc.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a young woman married to Hatem; they have no children. They live in Palestine, where Haya's husband runs a grocery store. 

Haya took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a wider variety of grocery items in order to attract more customers. Grocery stores are highly competitive due to their increasing number. 

Haya is a conservative woman, so her husband appears in the photograph in her place.

loans.use: to increase store inventory, attract more customers, and have a better income
